analyzed: gang zhig yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de ni dbang po rtul po yin la dbang po rtul po gang yin pa de yang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la dngos gzhi la 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: because one who regresses is of dull faculty and one of dull faculty is unable to enter the actual basis on the ninth liberated path.

original: dbang po rnon pos ni nus te /
analyzed: dbang po rnon pos ni nus te /
translated: One of sharp faculty can,

analyzed: dbang po spo ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is difficult to upgrade one's intellectual faculty.

analyzed: de ni bden na 'on kyang gal te dbang po rtul po mthar gyis 'thob pa 'di phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob ste /
translated: That is true, but if one of dull faculty who obtains the result of nonreturn by the serial approach obtains the result of nonreturn,

original: de las kyang yongs su nyams par gyur nas dbang po 'pho bar byed la dbang po 'phos nas kyang dbang po rnon por gyur te sngar bshad pa'i rim pa kho nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
analyzed: de las kyang yongs su nyams par gyur nas dbang po 'pho bar byed la dbang po 'phos nas kyang dbang po rnon por gyur te sngar bshad pa'i rim pa kho nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob bo //
translated: then if one regresses from that, one upgrades one's intellectual faculty and having upgraded one's intellectual faculty, one obtains the result of nonreturn by the serial approach alone, just as previously explained.

original: gal te rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la dngos @106b gzhi la 'jug par byed na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la dngos @106b gzhi la 'jug par byed na /
translated: If one enters the actual basis of the first absorption through the ninth liberated path,

original: de phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dgu'am brgyad kyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dgu'am brgyad kyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: then the result of nonreturn is obtained by nine or eight faculties.

translated: If one enters by the mundane path, then it is obtained by the five such as faith, the mental faculty, the faculty of equanimity subsumed by the uninterrupted path and the faculty of mental satisfaction subsumed by the actual basis of the first absorption.

analyzed: ji ste 'jig rten las 'das pas 'jug par byed na ni dgu pa kun shes pa'i dbang po yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If one enters by the transcendent path, then it is obtained by the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni yongs su nyams phan chad nam yang bde ba'i dbang pos 'thob pa med do zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni yongs su nyams phan chad nam yang bde ba'i dbang pos 'thob pa med do zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that one who has degenerated never obtains it by the faculty of pleasure.

analyzed: 'o na ni 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro bas de bcu gcig gis 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then those previously freed from attachment obtain it by eleven.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

original: gang zag dbang po rtul po bsam gtan gsum pa thob pa bsam gtan gsum pa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug par byed na sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa la phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /

analyzed: des 'bras bu de bde ba'i dbang po dang dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang yid dang kun shes pa dang kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dag gis 'thob po //
translated: He obtains that result by the faculty of pleasure, the five such as faith, the mental faculty, the faculty of understanding and the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

analyzed: de phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de las yongs su nyams pa dang dbang po sbyangs nas dbang po rnon po'i bdag nyid du byas te mi lcogs pa med pa kho na la brten nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu

original: pa la dngos gzhi la 'jug par byed na /
analyzed: pa la dngos gzhi la 'jug par byed na /

translated: The result of that is obtained by eight faculties, just as before: the faculty of equanimity, the faculty of mental satisfaction, the five such as faith, the ninth faculty of either pleasure or mental satisfaction, and the ninth faculty of the faculty of either pleasure or mental satisfaction.

original: de ltar na gang zag des ni dus gnyis dag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dbang po bcu gcig gis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag des ni dus gnyis dag tu phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de dbang po bcu gcig gis 'thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, in two instances, the result of nonreturn is obtained by eleven faculties.

original: de'i phyir de dag dgag pa'i don du 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid sngon du 'gro ba la ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dgag pa'i don du 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid sngon du 'gro ba la ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: To refute that, it is said: One who is previously freed from attachment does not fully degenerate,

original: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di smos te /🔽'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gang la brten te nges pa @107a * //
analyzed: de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di smos te / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gang la brten te nges pa @107a * //
translated: because freedom from attachment is obtained by two paths.

original: la zhugs kyang rung yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la zhugs kyang rung yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is freed from attachment to the desire realm does not fully degenerate, whether or not they enter the state of an arhat.

original: de lta bas na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lam gnyis kyis te 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pas 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ste 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni lam gnyis kyis te 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pas 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the state of being free from attachment to the desire realm is obtained by two paths, the mundane and transcendent paths.

original: 'di la 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: Here, the result is twofold:🔽the result of separation and the result of advancement.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of separation is the unconditioned result, and the result of advancement is the conditioned result.

original: de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'thob la nges pa la 'jug pa na yang de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'thob ste /
analyzed: de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dus ma byas gang yin pa de ni sngar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'thob la nges pa la 'jug pa na yang de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'thob ste /
translated: The unconditioned result of nonreturn is the result of separation, which is obtained earlier by the mundane path. When one enters the state of certainty, one also obtains it by the transcendent path.

original: de'i 'thob pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'thob pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The obtainment of that result is twofold: mundane and transcendent.

original: de lta bas na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni brtan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the state of being free from attachment to the desire realm is stable.

original: de bas na 'di las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one does not retrogress from that state.

original: 'bras las nyams 'gyur dang po las ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras las nyams 'gyur dang po las ma yin //
translated: But it does not degenerate from the result of nonreturn.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni gzhi med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni gzhi med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because those objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are nonexistent,

original: rgyu gzhan 'di yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan 'di yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: is this not another reason why it does not degenerate?

original: ci'i phyir de 'dir ma bshad ce na /🔽'di yang brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan dag 'di skad du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par ma gyur kyang ci'i phyir yongs su nyams pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'dir ma bshad ce na / 'di yang brjod par bya ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan dag 'di skad du mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par ma gyur kyang ci'i phyir yongs su nyams pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i
translated: Why is this not explained here?

original: nyon mongs pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par go mi 'gyur zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par go mi 'gyur zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This should be stated, but others say: Even though one who is free from attachment to objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing does not degenerate, why does one not understand that degeneration is due to the mere affliction of the desire realm that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation?

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes a nonreturner through abandoning the five factors associated with inferior states.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, and doubt are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Desire realm sensual pleasure and malice are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de dag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro bas des mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa de na de'i mthus zag pa med pa'i rigs rnams thob pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i thob pa yang zag pa🔽med pa'i thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro bas des mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug pa de na de'i mthus zag pa med pa'i rigs rnams thob pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis spangs pa'i thob pa yang zag pa med pa'i thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Since they are previously freed from attachment, at the end of realization on the sixteenth moment of mind, they obtain the uncontaminated type through the power of that, and the obtainment of abandonment by the mundane path becomes uncontaminated obtainment.

original: gnas @107b skabs de na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'dus byas zag pa med pa rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'dus ma byas 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa spangs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas @107b skabs de na phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'dus byas zag pa med pa rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / 'dus ma byas 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa spangs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they obtain the conditioned uncontaminated result of nonreturn and the unconditioned result of abandoning desire realm sensual pleasure and so on, which is the nature of the ninth liberated path.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pas de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir rgyu 'di kho na bshad de /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pas de'i 'dod chags dang bral ba lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir rgyu 'di kho na bshad de /
translated: Therefore, the noble ones explain only this cause, because they attain freedom from attachment to the desire realm by two paths.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa spangs pa lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa spangs pa lam gnyis kyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
translated: The meaning is: because they attain freedom from attachment to the desire realm by two paths, such as the path of meditation and the uninterrupted path.

original: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
analyzed: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
translated: Those possessing equanimity, life force, and mind possess three.

original: zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms sam srog gam yid dang ldan zhing ma bral ba ni gdon mi za bar gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms sam srog gam yid dang ldan zhing ma bral ba ni gdon mi za bar gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Those possessing equanimity, life force, and mind, or not separated from them, definitely possess three.

original: btang snyoms dang srog dang yid kyi ngo bo nyid de dag kho na dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang srog dang yid kyi ngo bo nyid de dag kho na dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They possess only those three that are the nature of equanimity, life force, and mind.

original: 'di dag ni phan tshun med na mi ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gcig dang ldan pa de gzhan gnyis dang yang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan tshun med na mi ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gcig dang ldan pa de gzhan gnyis dang yang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are mutually inseparable means that whoever possesses one also possesses the other two.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ldan par rnam par 'jog par byed kyi mig la sogs pa ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ldan par rnam par 'jog par byed kyi mig la sogs pa ni mi byed do //
translated: Therefore they are posited as possessing each other, but the eyes and so on are not.

original: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “One is not accompanied by the eye, ear, nose, or tongue faculties.”

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang mi ldan no //
translated: One who is born in the formless realm is not accompanied by the eye, ear, nose, or tongue faculties.

original: 'dir lus kyi dbang po ma smos pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na ni gang gis ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba bsdu ba'i don mig la sogs pa kho na la srid kyi lus la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir lus kyi dbang po ma smos pa ni 'dod pa'i khams na ni gang gis ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba bsdu ba'i don mig la sogs pa kho na la srid kyi lus la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body faculty is not mentioned here because the phrase “one who has not obtained or has lost” refers only to the eye, etc., and not to the body, since it is possible to be born in the desire realm and not obtain or lose the eye, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs med par skyes pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po dag dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba kho na zhig brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs med par skyes pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po dag dang mi ldan no zhes bya ba kho na zhig brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the root text would have stated, “One who is born in the formless realm is not accompanied by the physical faculties.”

original: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculties that are not obtained or that have deteriorated.

original: ma thob pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni nur nur po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculties that are not obtained during the embryonic states of kalala, etc.

original: rnam par nyams pa dag ni long ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang rim gyis 'chi ba thob pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa dag ni long ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang rim gyis 'chi ba thob pa rnam par nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are impaired are impaired due to the condition of being blind, etc., and due to the gradual death of those who have attained.

original: so so'i skye bo mi ldan no zhes khyad par du byas pa ni 'phags pa ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo mi ldan no zhes khyad par du byas pa ni 'phags pa ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The specification that ordinary beings are not possessed of it is because āryas are definitely possessed of it.

original: de'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba ni sa 'phos pas gtong ba med do //
analyzed: de'i zag pa med pa'i bde ba ni sa 'phos pas gtong ba med do //
translated: The undefiled pleasure of that is not relinquished by changing levels.

original: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ni mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'di na gnas pa'am /🔽khams gzhan na gnas pa'am so so'i skye bo'am @108a * //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang ni mi ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'di na gnas pa'am / khams gzhan na gnas pa'am so so'i skye bo'am @108a * //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm is not possessed of mental dissatisfaction.

original: 'phags pa yang rung mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang rung mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: One who abides in this realm or abides in another realm, or an ordinary being or an ārya is not possessed of it.

original: so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la gnas pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la rnam par nyams pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po de dang mi ldan no
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni 'bras bu la gnas pa rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la rnam par nyams pa'i phyir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po de dang mi ldan no
translated: Ordinary beings and those abiding in the result do not possess the faculty producing complete knowledge because ordinary beings do not obtain it and those abiding in the result of stream entry and so on do not possess it because it degenerates after the realization of the truths.

original: // kun shes pa'i dbang po mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa dag ni ma thob pa'i phyir mi ldan la mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa dag ni 'bras bu thob pa na rnam par nyams pa'i phyir mi ldan no //
analyzed: // kun shes pa'i dbang po mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa dag ni ma thob pa'i phyir mi ldan la mi slob pa'i lam la gnas pa dag ni 'bras bu thob pa na rnam par nyams pa'i phyir mi ldan no //
translated: Those abiding on the path of seeing do not possess the faculty of complete knowledge because they do not obtain it and those abiding on the path of no learning do not possess it because it degenerates when they obtain the result.🔽In the remaining states that are not refuted, they possess the faculties as explained.

original: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni ji skad bshad pa dang zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni dbang po gang dang gang bshad pa'i dbang po de dang de ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ma bkag pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni ji skad bshad pa dang zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni dbang po gang dang gang bshad pa'i dbang po de dang de ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: In the remaining states other than those, they should be understood to possess the faculties that were explained.

original: da la 'dod pa'i khams na ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa lce la thug pa'i bar dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: da la 'dod pa'i khams na ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs pa mig la sogs pa lce la thug pa'i bar dag dang ldan no //
translated: In the desire realm, one possesses eyes and so on up to tongue, except for those who have not obtained them or have degenerated.🔽One possesses the body faculty if born in the desire or form realms.🔽One who possesses four faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: One who possesses five faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, pain, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses six faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and two faculties of pleasure and pain.🔽One who possesses seven faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses eight faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.

original: bde lus ldan pa bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba ni ldan la zhes bya ba dang nges par ldan zhes bya bar sbyar te grangs kyi go rims brjod par 'dod pas de'i 'og tu bde ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bde lus ldan pa bzhi dag dang // zhes bya ba ni ldan la zhes bya ba dang nges par ldan zhes bya bar sbyar te grangs kyi go rims brjod par 'dod pas de'i 'og tu bde ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: One who possesses nine faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses ten faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses eleven faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses twelve faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses thirteen faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.🔽One who possesses fourteen faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo las ma gtogs pa thams cad ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan la /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo las ma gtogs pa thams cad ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan la /
translated: One who possesses fifteen faculties is one who definitely possesses the four faculties of life force, equanimity, mental satisfaction and mental dissatisfaction and one of the faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure or mental dissatisfaction.

original: de bzhin dag dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin dag dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: One who possesses sixteen faculties

original: mig la sogs pa lce'i dbang po la thug pa'i bar dag dang ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yang ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lce'i dbang po la thug pa'i bar dag dang ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yang ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: The eye faculty and the others up to and including the tongue faculty are not possessed in the formless realm and in the desire realm when they are not obtained or when they are lost.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang ni gzugs med pa'i khams na ni mi ldan no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang ni gzugs med pa'i khams na ni mi ldan no //
translated: The body faculty is not possessed in the formless realm.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dang ni gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na yang mi ldan no //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dang ni gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na yang mi ldan no //
translated: The male and female faculties are not possessed in the form and formless realms and in the desire realm when they are not obtained or when they are lost.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na mi ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of pain is not possessed in the form and formless realms.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo'i bsam gtan @108b gsum par skyes pa dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo'i bsam gtan @108b gsum par skyes pa dang mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure is not possessed by ordinary beings born in the third absorption.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is not possessed in the state of freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: One does not possess the five beginning with faith when the roots of virtue are severed.

original: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: One does not possess the faculty producing complete knowledge when one is an ordinary being or when one is abiding in the result.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang mthong ba'i lam dang mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang mthong ba'i lam dang mi slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: One does not possess the faculty of complete knowledge when one is an ordinary being or when one is on the path of seeing or when one is a nonlearner.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ni so so'i skye bo dang slob pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: One does not possess the faculty possessing complete knowledge when one is an ordinary being or when one is a learner.🔽One who possesses the body faculty also definitely possesses four faculties

original: gang zhig lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa de yang bzhi dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang zhig lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa de yang bzhi dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa ni lus kyi dbang po dang ldan pa /
translated: One who is born in the desire or form realms definitely possesses the body faculty.

original: de gzhan dag dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gzhan dag dang ni gdon mi za bar ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But one does not definitely possess the others.

original: mig la sogs pa dag dang ni 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag dang ni 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa'i gnas skabs na mi ldan no //
translated: One is not accompanied by the eye faculty, etc. in the desire realm when one has not yet obtained them or has lost them.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang ni gnas skabs de dang gzugs kyi khams na mi ldan no //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag dang ni gnas skabs de dang gzugs kyi khams na mi ldan no //
translated: One is not accompanied by the male and female faculties in those states and in the form realm.

original: sdug bsngal dang ni de nyid na mi ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ni de nyid na mi ldan no //
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculty of suffering in those states.

original: bde ba dang ni so so'i skye bo bsam gtan bzhi par skyes pa dang mi ldan no //
analyzed: bde ba dang ni so so'i skye bo bsam gtan bzhi par skyes pa dang mi ldan no //
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculty of pleasure when one is born as an ordinary being in the fourth absorption.

original: yid bde ba dang ni so so'i skye bo bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi par skyes pa mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang ni so so'i skye bo bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi par skyes pa mi ldan no //
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculty of mental satisfaction when one is born as an ordinary being in the third or fourth absorptions.

original: yid mi bde ba dang dad pa la sogs pa gzhan dag dang mi ldan pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang dad pa la sogs pa gzhan dag dang mi ldan pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One is not accompanied by the faculty of mental dissatisfaction and the other faculties of faith, etc. as previously explained.

original: mig sogs ldan la lnga dang ldan //
analyzed: mig sogs ldan la lnga dang ldan //
translated: One who possesses the eye and so on possesses five.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang ldan pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means one who possesses the eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni mig de dang ste mig yod na lus kyi dbang po gdon mi za bar yod kyi /
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni mig de dang ste mig yod na lus kyi dbang po gdon mi za bar yod kyi /
translated: That is, if the eye sense faculty exists, the body sense faculty necessarily exists.

original: rna ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the ear sense faculty, etc., do not necessarily exist,

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that one who is born in the desire realm has not yet obtained or has lost the ear sense faculty, etc.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po la sogs pa la 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po la sogs pa la 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The error regarding the male and female faculties, etc., should be stated in the same way as before.🔽It should be understood that those who possess the ear, nose, and tongue sense faculties are similar to those who possess the eye sense faculty.

original: rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang srog dang yid dang lus kyi dbang po dag
analyzed: rna ba dang sna dang lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang srog dang yid dang lus kyi dbang po dag
translated: That is, those who possess the ear sense faculty definitely possess five sense faculties: the body sense faculty, the life faculty, the mental faculty, the feeling of equanimity, and the ear sense faculty.

original: dang de dang dbang po lnga dang ldan te zhes bya ba de lta bur thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang de dang dbang po lnga dang ldan te zhes bya ba de lta bur thams cad sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: yid bde ldan yang zhes pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yid bde ldan yang zhes pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the phrase “one who possesses mental satisfaction”?

original: @109a * // gdon mi za bar lnga dang ldan no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: @109a * // gdon mi za bar lnga dang ldan no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: One definitely possesses five.

original: ci'i phyir yid bde ba mig la sogs pa kho na'i nang du mi bsdu zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yid bde ba mig la sogs pa kho na'i nang du mi bsdu zhe na /
translated: Why is mental satisfaction not included among the faculties such as eye?

original: gnas gzhan nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas gzhan nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from a different stage.

original: 'di ltar sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus na ni 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdus na ni 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the term “and so on” were to be included, it would be confused.🔽If one born in the second absorption has not obtained the third absorption, with what faculty of pleasure is one endowed?

original: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum par ma thob pa bde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i dbang po 'dod pa'i khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa yod la bsam gtan dang po na
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bsam gtan gsum par ma thob pa bde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i dbang po 'dod pa'i khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa yod la bsam gtan dang po na
translated: In the desire realm, the faculty of pleasure exists in the fivefold collection of consciousness.

original: ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa yod /
analyzed: ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa yod /
translated: In the first absorption, it exists in the three collections of consciousness.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa na ni yid kyi yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na ni yid kyi yod do //
translated: In the third absorption, it exists in the mental faculty.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bde ba'i dbang po 'og ma dang yang mi ldan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa bde ba'i dbang po 'og ma dang yang mi ldan no //
translated: Therefore, one born in the second absorption does not possess the faculty of pleasure of a lower level.

original: de ni sa 'phos pas btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sa 'phos pas btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is relinquished by changing to a different level.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa dang yang mi ldan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa dang yang mi ldan te /
translated: They do not possess the faculty of pleasure of the third absorption level,

original: de ni ma thob pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //🔽bde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ma thob pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no // bde ba'i dbang po gang dang ldan zhe na /
translated: because they have not obtained that level.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang ldan no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With how many faculties is one who possesses the faculty of pleasure necessarily endowed?🔽One who possesses the faculty of pleasure is necessarily endowed with seven faculties,

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni sems can 'og mar skyes pa thams cad ni sa gong ma ba'i nyon mongs pa can ma spangs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni sems can 'og mar skyes pa thams cad ni sa gong ma ba'i nyon mongs pa can ma spangs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the philosophical tenet is that all sentient beings born in lower realms possess the afflicted faculty of the third absorption that has not been abandoned.

original: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The error regarding the remaining faculties should be stated as before.🔽One who possesses the faculty of pain is necessarily endowed with seven faculties.

original: sdug bsngal ldan bdun dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ldan bdun dang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yin te /
translated: This refers to one born in the desire realm.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar lus kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar lus kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Therefore, he is necessarily endowed with the body faculty.

original: tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa dag dang ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa dag dang ngo //
translated: He is endowed with four faculties of feeling, excluding mental pain.

original: yid dang srog gi dbang po dag kyang yod pas gdon mi za bar dbang po bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang srog gi dbang po dag kyang yod pas gdon mi za bar dbang po bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Since the mental faculty and the vitality faculty are also present, they definitely possess seven faculties.

original: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma 'khrul pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The error regarding the remaining faculties should be explained as before.🔽Those possessing the female faculty and so on possess eight.

original: mo'i dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang // zhes bya ba ni mo pha pho dang yid mi bde ba dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mo'i dbang sogs ldan brgyad dang // zhes bya ba ni mo pha pho dang yid mi bde ba dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means they possess the female faculty, the male faculty, the mental faculty, the faculty of mental dissatisfaction, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: srog dang yid dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni bshad zin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: srog dang yid dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni bshad zin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The faculties of life force, the mental faculty, pleasure, pain, mental satisfaction, and equanimity have already been explained.🔽The three faculties of possessing complete knowledge and so on will be explained later.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir @109b dbang po brgyad po 'di dag kho na gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir @109b dbang po brgyad po 'di dag kho na gzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore only these eight faculties are included.

original: gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni zhes bya ba ni mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yin pas de'i phyir de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang 'di dag kho na bzung ba yin no //🔽bdun po de dag dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni zhes bya ba ni mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yin pas de'i phyir de ni gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang 'di dag kho na bzung ba yin no // bdun po de dag dang ldan zhe na /
translated: because one who possesses the female faculty is born in the desire realm.🔽One who possesses seven faculties definitely possesses seven faculties.

original: bdun po de dag dang mo'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdun po de dag dang mo'i dbang po dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One who possesses seven faculties definitely possesses seven faculties,

original: lus dang srog dang yid dag dang tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi ste bdun dang brgyad pa mo'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: lus dang srog dang yid dag dang tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi ste bdun dang brgyad pa mo'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: because one who possesses the female faculty possesses seven faculties, namely, the body, life, and mind faculties and four faculties of feeling, plus the eighth, the female faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa ni nyams pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa srid pa'i phyir rgyu de dag gis na lhag ma dag ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni nyams pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa srid pa'i phyir rgyu de dag gis na lhag ma dag ni nges pa med do //
translated: The remaining faculties are not definite, because it is possible to lose eyes and so on, as previously explained.

original: pho'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa bzhin brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa bzhin brjod par bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the male faculty should be explained in the same way as one who possesses the female faculty.

original: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa yang 'dod par skyes shing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas de dang 'dra bar bdun po de dag yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa yang 'dod par skyes shing 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas de dang 'dra bar bdun po de dag yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Also, one who possesses mental dissatisfaction is born in the desire realm and is free from attachment to the desire realm. Thus, these seven are also possessed by one who possesses mental dissatisfaction.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa yang khams gsum pa'i sems can yin pas dad pa la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang srog dang yid dag dang ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa yang khams gsum pa'i sems can yin pas dad pa la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang srog dang yid dag dang ldan no //
translated: One who possesses faith is a sentient being of the three realms. Thus, these five that do not occur without faith and so on, equanimity, life force, and the mental faculty are possessed.

original: lhag ma dag dang ni ma nges te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dag dang ni ma nges te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are not definitely possessed by the remaining faculties, as before.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa ji lta bar shes rab dang ldan pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽kun shes pa la dbang byed pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa kho na la dbang byed pa ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa ji lta bar shes rab dang ldan pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o // kun shes pa la dbang byed pas na kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa kho na la dbang byed pa ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: Just as one who possesses faith, so too one who possesses wisdom.🔽The faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the faculty of one who has complete knowledge.🔽It is the faculty of complete knowledge of all objects to be known.🔽The faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the faculty of one who has complete knowledge.

original: ma lus par shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma lus par shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the faculty of complete knowledge of all objects to be known.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po yang kun shes pa la dbang byed pa ni yin mod kyi ma lus par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po yang kun shes pa la dbang byed pa ni yin mod kyi ma lus par ni ma yin te /
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is indeed the controlling power with regard to final and perfect knowledge, but not in its entirety,

original: spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the remainder of the aggregates that are to be abandoned.

original: yang na tshig gi phyogs gcig smos nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la kun shes pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na tshig gi phyogs gcig smos nas kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i gang zag la kun shes pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Or else, the person who possesses final and perfect knowledge is called one who possesses final and perfect knowledge, by mentioning only one part of the expression.

original: de'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: His faculty is called the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.🔽One who possesses the faculty of final and perfect knowledge certainly possesses eleven faculties.

original: gang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi tha bar bcu gcig dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni slob pa 'bras bu la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi tha bar bcu gcig dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni slob pa 'bras bu la gnas pa yin te /
translated: One who possesses the faculty of final and perfect knowledge is a learner who is situated in the result.

original: khams gsum char na yang yod do //
analyzed: khams gsum char na yang yod do //
translated: It exists in the three realms.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa de ji ltar bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang po dag dang ldan @110a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa de ji ltar bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang po dag dang ldan @110a * //
translated: How can one who is born in the fourth meditation or in the formless realm possess the faculties of pleasure and mental pleasure?

original: zhe na / ji ltar 'phags pa ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba na gdon mi za bar yid bde ba'i dbang po 'thob la /
analyzed: zhe na / ji ltar 'phags pa ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba na gdon mi za bar yid bde ba'i dbang po 'thob la /
translated: If you say that is not so, then how is it that when āryas are free from attachment to the desire realm, they definitely obtain the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba na yang bde ba'i dbang po 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba na yang bde ba'i dbang po 'thob po //
translated: And when they are free from attachment to the second absorption, they obtain the faculty of pleasure.

original: de dag ni sa 'phos kyang gtong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni sa 'phos kyang gtong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not relinquish those faculties even when they change level.

original: 'di ltar / sa 'phos nyams pa dag gis ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sa 'phos nyams pa dag gis ni //
translated: As it is said,

original: bsam gtan gtogs pa'i dge ba gtong //
analyzed: bsam gtan gtogs pa'i dge ba gtong //
translated: They relinquish virtuous absorption through changing level or degeneration.

original: de bzhin gzugs med gtogs 'phags ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs med gtogs 'phags ni //
translated: So too, āryas in the formless realm

original: 'bras thos sbyangs dang nyams rnams kyis //🔽zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras thos sbyangs dang nyams rnams kyis // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Relinquish through result, obtainment, training, and degeneration.

original: 'bras bu thob pa dang dbang po sbyong ba na yang zhugs pa'i lam dang dbang po rtul po'i lam gyis bsdus pa de dag gtong mod kyi 'on kyang 'bras bu dang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa gzhan dag ni 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa dang dbang po sbyong ba na yang zhugs pa'i lam dang dbang po rtul po'i lam gyis bsdus pa de dag gtong mod kyi 'on kyang 'bras bu dang dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa gzhan dag ni 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they obtain the result or train in the faculty, they relinquish those subsumed by the path of entry and the path of dull faculty. However, they obtain others subsumed by the result and sharp faculty.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos 'phos pa yang yongs su ma btang ba de dag dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dbang pos 'phos pa yang yongs su ma btang ba de dag dang ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore āryas born in the fourth absorption or the formless realm possess the faculties of pleasure and mental satisfaction that they have not relinquished.

original: lhag ma dag dang ni snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dag dang ni snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa yin no //
translated: They are not definitely possessed of the remaining faculties.

original: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
analyzed: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
translated: One possessing the faculty producing complete knowledge

original: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin //
translated: possesses thirteen.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po skyed pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po skyed pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can yin te /
translated: One possessing the faculty producing complete knowledge is a sentient being who experiences the desire realm alone, because the faculty producing complete knowledge is generated in the desire realm.

original: mi skyo lung las 'dir rtsom zhing //🔽de mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skyo lung las 'dir rtsom zhing // de mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
translated: The sūtras state:

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here one begins and there one completes.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar 'di la lus kyi dbang po yang yod la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar 'di la lus kyi dbang po yang yod la /
translated: Therefore one definitely possesses the body faculty.

original: yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa tshor ba bzhi yang yod de /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa tshor ba bzhi yang yod de /
translated: The four feelings exist, except for mental dissatisfaction.

original: des ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is confused in the state of freedom from attachment.

original: de la gdon mi za bar zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽dbang po bcu gsum dang gdon mi za bar kho nar ldan no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la gdon mi za bar zhes bya bar sbyar te / dbang po bcu gsum dang gdon mi za bar kho nar ldan no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin gyi /
translated: Here, the phrase “without doubt” is supplied.🔽One definitely possesses thirteen faculties without doubt.

original: bcu gsum kho na dang zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //🔽lhag ma dag dang ni ma nges te /
analyzed: bcu gsum kho na dang zhes bya ba ni ma yin no // lhag ma dag dang ni ma nges te /

original: long ba la sogs pa la yang mthong ba'i lam srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa la yang mthong ba'i lam srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is indefinite with regard to the remaining faculties because it is possible that a blind person and so on generates the path of seeing.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ma tshang na yang ji ltar mthong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag ma tshang na yang ji ltar mthong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: How can the path of seeing arise if the male and female faculties are incomplete?

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa rnams la sdom pa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa @110b dang 'dod chags dang bral ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa dang nyams pa rnams la sdom pa dang 'bras bu 'thob pa @110b dang 'dod chags dang bral ba med do zhe na /
translated: Because those who do not possess the male and female faculties and those who degenerate do not obtain vows, obtain results and freedom from attachment.

original: re zhig kha cig na re sdom pa thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: re zhig kha cig na re sdom pa thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Some say: The result of obtaining vows is obtained.

original: mtshan gnyis 'byung bas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong bar 'gyur gyi de dag nyams pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis 'byung bas so sor thar pa'i sdom pa gtong bar 'gyur gyi de dag nyams pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But the vows of individual liberation are relinquished due to the arising of two organs, not due to their degeneration.

original: yang na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la goms pa la rim gyis 'chi bas mo dang pho'i dbang po 'gags kyang mthong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la goms pa la rim gyis 'chi bas mo dang pho'i dbang po 'gags kyang mthong ba'i lam skye bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Or else, the path of seeing arises when the male and female organs cease through the gradual death of one who is accustomed to the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir ni gang zag spyi'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi gcig kho na la gdon mi za bar dbang po dang ldan pa dang 'khrul pa brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir ni gang zag spyi'i dbang du byas pa yin gyi gcig kho na la gdon mi za bar dbang po dang ldan pa dang 'khrul pa brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro /
translated: Others say: In this context, the general case of persons is considered, but it is not said that one definitely possesses or is confused about the organs.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
translated: Those possessing equanimity, life force,

original: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
analyzed: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
translated: and the mental faculty definitely possess three.

original: zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yang rung srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa yang rung srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes pa yang rung ste /
translated: One born in the desire realm up to one born in the summit of existence

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i gang zag ji snyed pa de thams cad gdon mi za bar gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i gang zag ji snyed pa de thams cad gdon mi za bar gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: All those who possess equanimity definitely possess three faculties.

original: mig la sogs pa 'khrul pa ni thams cad du ci rigs par sbyar te /🔽la la ni gzugs can gyi dbang po dag dang mi ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'khrul pa ni thams cad du ci rigs par sbyar te / la la ni gzugs can gyi dbang po dag dang mi ldan pa nyid yin te /

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par la la ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan te dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par la la ni dad pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan te dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nyid ni ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa de nyid ni ma yin te //
translated: Those born in the formless realm do not possess the faculty of equanimity.

original: yang 'dir kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni gdon mi za bar ji skad bshad pa'i dbang po bcu gsum ldan pa yin no //

translated: Here all those who possess the faculty producing complete knowledge definitely possess the thirteen faculties as explained.

original: 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa ni ci rigs par kho nar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa ni ci rigs par kho nar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The error of some should be applied as appropriate.

original: 'dir ltar la la ni mig gi dbang po dang mi ldan te /
analyzed: 'dir ltar la la ni mig gi dbang po dang mi ldan te /
translated: Some are not endowed with the eye faculty,

original: long ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: long ba gang yin pa'o //

original: la la ni pho'i dbang po dang mi ldan te mo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: la la ni pho'i dbang po dang mi ldan te mo gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: la la ni yid mi bde ba dang mi ldan te 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu kho na khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Some are not endowed with the mental faculty, such as those who are free from attachment.

original: dge med nang na nyung ldan pa //
analyzed: dge med nang na nyung ldan pa //
translated: Those lacking virtue possess the least,

original: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan //🔽zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig 'ga' zhig nang na nyung ba @111a * //
analyzed: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan // zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig 'ga' zhig nang na nyung ba @111a * //

original: dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyung du ji srid cig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: dang ldan pa gang yin pa de nyung du ji srid cig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many faculties does a person possess who possesses the least number of faculties?

original: smras pa / dge med ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / dge med ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu chad pa yin no //
translated: Those lacking virtue are those who have severed their root of virtue.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kho na'i yin pas 'di la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kho na'i yin pas 'di la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang mi srid do //
translated: Moreover, it is only in the desire realm, so it is impossible to be free from desire for the desire realm.

translated: Therefore, in this realm, all five faculties of feeling are present, as well as the body faculty, the life faculty, and the mind faculty.

original: mig la sogs pa ni med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni med de /
translated: The eye faculty and so on are not present,

original: rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs dang / long ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs dang / long ba nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are absent in the situation of dying gradually and in the situation of being blind and so on.

analyzed: myong bar byed pa ni tshor ba ste zhes bya ba ni byed pa por sgrub pa yin no //

analyzed: tshor ba ni tshor ba ste zhes bya ba ni ngo bor bsgrub pa yin te /

analyzed: dper na phun sum tshogs pa la phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni khungs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The statement “For example, it is like perfection in perfection” shows the source.

original: gzugs med byis pa'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: gzugs med byis pa'ang de bzhin te //
translated: The childish are also like that in the formless realm.

original: zhes bya ba la de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni grangs tsam mthun par sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni grangs tsam mthun par sbyor ba yin no //

analyzed: dge ba smos pas ni dad pa la sogs pa gzung bar bya ste /

translated: The meaning is that they are virtuous alone, not nonvirtuous or neutral.🔽It follows that the faculty of understanding all, and so on, would also be included,

analyzed: dge med nang na nyung ldan pa //

analyzed: brgyad dang zhes bya ba 'dis bsgre ba brgyad do //

analyzed: de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to distinguish that,

original: bstsags pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ba smos so //🔽'dod na / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: bstsags pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ba smos so // 'dod na / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: it is called the most subtle particle of accumulation.🔽If you accept that,🔽the most subtle particle of the desire realm has eight substances.

original: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gang gi tshe 'di la sgra mi 'byung ba de'i tshe nges par rdzas brgyad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na gang gi tshe 'di la sgra mi 'byung ba de'i tshe nges par rdzas brgyad pa kho na yin no //
translated: In the desire realm, when sound does not occur for this [being], then it definitely has only eight substances.

original: 'di las rdzas nyung ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las rdzas nyung ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no substance that is less than this.

original: dbang po gzhan ldan zhes bya ba 'di la dbang po gzhan yod pas na dbang po gzhan ldan te mig la sogs pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan ldan zhes bya ba 'di la dbang po gzhan yod pas na dbang po gzhan ldan te mig la sogs pa dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Possessing other faculties means possessing other faculties besides the eye faculty.

original: gang la mig dang rna ba la sogs pa yod pa de la ni lus kyi dbang po yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la mig dang rna ba la sogs pa yod pa de la ni lus kyi dbang po yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: One who possesses the eye faculty and so on also possesses the body faculty,

original: mig la sogs pa ni de la rag lus te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni de la rag lus te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye faculty and so on arise in dependence on the body faculty.

original: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas brgyad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas brgyad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: If those atoms arise with sound, then there are eight substances.

original: bstsags pa'i rdul phra rab dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni go rims bzhin du rdzas dgu dang bcu dang bcu gcig par skyes te /🔽rdzas brgyad pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: bstsags pa'i rdul phra rab dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na ni go rims bzhin du rdzas dgu dang bcu dang bcu gcig par skyes te / rdzas brgyad pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas dgu pa yin no //
translated: If the atoms that are the basis of the sense faculties arise with sound, then there are nine, ten, or eleven substances, respectively.

original: rdzas dgu pa gang yin de ni rdzas bcu pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dgu pa gang yin de ni rdzas bcu pa yin no //
translated: That which is an atom with eight substances is an atom with nine substances.🔽That which is an atom with nine substances is an atom with ten substances.

original: rdzas bcu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas bcu gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas bcu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas bcu gcig pa yin no //
translated: That which is the eleventh substance is the eleventh substance.🔽There is also sound that is not distinct from the faculties, that is, sound that cannot be made distinct from the faculties.

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dbang po dang tha dad par bya mi nus pa de ni dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yin te dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa can zhes bya🔽ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yang yod de zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dbang po dang tha dad par bya mi nus pa de ni dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i sgra yin te dbang po dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is sound that is not distinct from the faculties, that is, sound that exists without being distinct from the faculties.🔽Just as the elements are not distinct, but it is observed that in a certain composite, only some of the elements are present, such as solidity.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni sra bar dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sra ba ni sa'i khams yin la @112b gsher ba ni chu'i khams yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba rnams tha mi dad pa las 'di na 'dus pa kha cig kho na ni sra bar dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sra ba ni sa'i khams yin la @112b gsher ba ni chu'i khams yin /
translated: Solidity is the earth element, fluidity is the water element,

original: dro ba ni me'i khams yin /
analyzed: dro ba ni me'i khams yin /
translated: heat is the fire element, and movement is the wind element.

original: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams yin pa 'byung ba mnyam par yod pa'i phyir de dag 'dus pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo dag tu 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams yin pa 'byung ba mnyam par yod pa'i phyir de dag 'dus pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo dag tu 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since the elements exist equally, they become composites of the same nature.

original: gang zhig gang na ches gsal zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzas gang zhig 'dus pa gang la ches gsal zhing mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang na ches gsal zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rdzas gang zhig 'dus pa gang la ches gsal zhing mngon pa yin no //
translated: The text continues, “Whatever substance, such as earth, is most evident in a composite.”

original: mthu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas yin gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas shas che bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas yin gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas shas che bar gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By the word “power,” the text means “capacity,” not “substance.”

original: de ni de na dmigs te zhes bya ba ni rdzas de ni 'dus pa de na dmigs shing 'dzin pa yin no //🔽khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu zhes bya ba de la khab ni 'jig rten la lcags las byas par grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de na dmigs te zhes bya ba ni rdzas de ni 'dus pa de na dmigs shing 'dzin pa yin no // khab dang sdong bu'i tshogs la reg pa lta bu zhes bya ba de la khab ni 'jig rten la lcags las byas par grags pa yin no //
translated: “It is perceived there” means that the substance is perceived in the composite.🔽The text gives the example of “a bundle of reeds,” where “reed” is a type of iron known in the world.

original: sdong bu ni ldum bu bi ra na la sogs pa'i me tog gi rtsa ba'i sdong bu yin te skye bo phal pa yan chad la me tog gi rtsa ba zhes grags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdong bu ni ldum bu bi ra na la sogs pa'i me tog gi rtsa ba'i sdong bu yin te skye bo phal pa yan chad la me tog gi rtsa ba zhes grags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Bundle” is the root of a flower such as a virana, which is known to ordinary people as a “flower root.”

original: khab dang sdong bu de dag gi tshogs la reg pa ste ches gsal zhing mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba'i 'byung ba de dmigs pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khab dang sdong bu de dag gi tshogs la reg pa ste ches gsal zhing mthu'i sgo nas shas che ba'i 'byung ba de dmigs pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The object of the sense of touch is the collection of the atoms of the four great elements, or the collection of the atoms of the four great elements that are predominant and manifest in terms of their power.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar khab dang sdong bu rnams kyi tshogs mnyam par yod kyang rno ba'i phyir khab dag kho na'i reg pa gsal bar dmigs kyi rtul pa'i phyir sdong bu rnams kyi ni ma yin pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa kha cig kho na
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar khab dang sdong bu rnams kyi tshogs mnyam par yod kyang rno ba'i phyir khab dag kho na'i reg pa gsal bar dmigs kyi rtul pa'i phyir sdong bu rnams kyi ni ma yin pa de bzhin du shing la sogs pa kha cig kho na
translated: Just as, although the collection of needles and sticks exists equally, the touch of the needles is manifest and perceived because of their sharpness, but not that of the sticks because of their dullness, in the same way, in some trees, etc.,

original: la sra ba dmigs la /
analyzed: la sra ba dmigs la /
translated: hardness is perceived,

original: kha cig la ni gsher ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig la ni gsher ba ste /
translated: in some wetness,🔽in water,

original: chu la'o // kha cig la ni dro ba ste /
analyzed: chu la'o // kha cig la ni dro ba ste /
translated: in some heat,🔽in fire,

original: me la'o // kha cig la ni g-yo ba ste rlung la yin yang tshogs pa de dang de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me la'o // kha cig la ni g-yo ba ste rlung la yin yang tshogs pa de dang de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and in some movement, in wind. But the four great elements do not not exist in that collection.

original: phye dang lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na phye'i phye ma dang lan tshva'i phye ma rnams kyi ro dmigs pa lta bu yin te /
analyzed: phye dang lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na phye'i phye ma dang lan tshva'i phye ma rnams kyi ro dmigs pa lta bu yin te /
translated: The phrase “like the taste of flour and salt” is an example: just as the taste of flour and the taste of salt are perceived,

original: lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro kho na gsal bar dmigs kyi phye ma'i ro ni ma yin pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lan tshva'i phye ma'i ro kho na gsal bar dmigs kyi phye ma'i ro ni ma yin pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: only the taste of salt is clearly perceived, not the taste of flour. It is like that here.

original: sdud pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / smin pa dang / g-yo ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'i las kyis na shing la sogs pa la chu'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: sdud pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / smin pa dang / g-yo ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'i las kyis na shing la sogs pa la chu'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
translated: The phrase “because of the function of collecting, holding, ripening, and moving” means that the existence of the water element in wood, etc., is understood because of the function of collecting.

original: gal te de na chu'i khams med par gyur na des spar gang gtor ba bzhin du rnam par 'gyes par 'gyur ro //🔽chu la gru la sogs @113a * //
analyzed: gal te de na chu'i khams med par gyur na des spar gang gtor ba bzhin du rnam par 'gyes par 'gyur ro // chu la gru la sogs @113a * //
translated: If the water element did not exist in wood, etc., it would disintegrate like a handful of dust.

original: pa 'degs pa'i las kyis na sa'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: pa 'degs pa'i las kyis na sa'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: The existence of the earth element in water is understood because of the function of supporting a boat, etc.

original: smin par byed pa'i las kyis ni me'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: smin par byed pa'i las kyis ni me'i khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
translated: The existence of the fire element is understood because of the function of ripening.

original: gal te de med par gyur na shing la sogs pa 'drul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de med par gyur na shing la sogs pa 'drul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, wood and so on would rot.

original: g-yo ba'i las kyis na rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i las kyis na rlung gi khams yod pa nyid du rtogs te /
translated: The wind constituent is understood to exist because of the function of moving.

original: gal te de med par gyur na de 'phel zhing rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de med par gyur na de 'phel zhing rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, it would not expand and grow.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other elements.

original: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni me la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na sra ba la sogs pa yang gsher ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: rkyen dang phrad na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ni me la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na sra ba la sogs pa yang gsher ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir la /
translated: If they encounter the conditions of fire, etc.,

original: gsher ba la sogs pa yang sra ba nyid la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsher ba la sogs pa yang sra ba nyid la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: hardness, etc., become wetness, etc., and wetness, etc., become hardness, etc.

original: dper na mer gyur pa yod na sra ba lcags kyang nal nal por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na mer gyur pa yod na sra ba lcags kyang nal nal por 'gyur te /
translated: For example, if fire exists, even hard iron becomes soft.

original: des na lcags la chu'i khams yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: des na lcags la chu'i khams yod do zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the water element exists in iron.

original: de bzhin du gsher ba yang grang ba nyid la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na sra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsher ba yang grang ba nyid la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad na sra bar 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if wetness encounters the conditions of cold, etc., it becomes hard.

original: des na 'di la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: des na 'di la sa'i khams yod pa nyid du shes so //
translated: Therefore, one knows that the earth element exists in it.

original: de bzhin du 'drud pa las dro bar dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'drud pa las dro bar dmigs te /
translated: Similarly, one observes heat in friction.

original: des na 'di la me'i khams yod do zhes bya bar shes so //🔽de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro /
analyzed: des na 'di la me'i khams yod do zhes bya bar shes so // de bzhin du gzhan la yang ci rigs par sbyar ro /
translated: Therefore, one knows that the fire element exists in it.

original: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: The same should be applied in the appropriate way to the other elements.

original: gzhan dag na re chu la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas dro ba yod par khong du chud do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chu la grang ba'i khyad par gyi sgo nas dro ba yod par khong du chud do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dpal len te /
translated: Bhadanta Śrīlāta says that the existence of fire in water is understood through the difference in the degree of cold.

original: gang gi phyir chu grang ba dang shin tu grang ba dang ches shin tu grang ba dag dmigs pa de'i phyir de la me chung ba dang shin tu chung ba dang ches shin tu chung ba 'byung bas grang ba'i khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chu grang ba dang shin tu grang ba dang ches shin tu grang ba dag dmigs pa de'i phyir de la me chung ba dang shin tu chung ba dang ches shin tu chung ba 'byung bas grang ba'i khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because cold, very cold, and extremely cold water is observed, therefore, in it, fire arises in a small, very small, and extremely small way, and so the difference in the degree of cold occurs.

original: des na de la me'i khams yod par shes so //
analyzed: des na de la me'i khams yod par shes so //
translated: Therefore, one knows that the fire element exists in it.

original: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhung lugs de slob dpon sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ma 'dres kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzhung lugs de slob dpon sun 'byin par byed pa yin te /
translated: The master Buddhapalita refutes this scriptural system with the words, “Even though they are not mixed,”

original: dper na dgra la rdzas gzhan dang 'dres shing 'khrugs par gyur pa med kyang khyad par yang yod de /
analyzed: dper na dgra la rdzas gzhan dang 'dres shing 'khrugs par gyur pa med kyang khyad par yang yod de /
translated: just as, for example, an enemy is not mixed with and confused with other substances, but there is a difference between them.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis sgra gsal ba dang shin tu gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal ba yod pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gis sgra gsal ba dang shin tu gsal ba dang ches shin tu gsal ba yod pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as there is a difference between clear, very clear, and extremely clear sounds due to their intrinsic nature, so it is here.

original: yang dper na tshor ba rdzas gzhan ci dang yang 'dres pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: yang dper na tshor ba rdzas gzhan ci dang yang 'dres pa ma yin yang /
translated: Also, for example, feeling is not mixed with any other substance,

original: @113b ngo bo nyid gsum gyi khyad par gyis shin tu dang ches shin tu khyad par yang yod pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: @113b ngo bo nyid gsum gyi khyad par gyis shin tu dang ches shin tu khyad par yang yod pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bas /
translated: but there is a difference between very and extremely, due to the difference in their intrinsic natures.

original: 'dis ni me yod pa nyid du shes par mi 'gyur te /🔽chu de dag nyid kha cig ni grang ba yin la /
