analyzed: 'dis ni me yod pa nyid du shes par mi 'gyur te / chu de dag nyid kha cig ni grang ba yin la /
translated: This does not prove that fire exists,🔽because some of those waters are cold,🔽some are very cold,

original: kha cig ni shin tu grang ba yin /
analyzed: kha cig ni shin tu grang ba yin /
translated: and some are extremely cold.

original: kha cig ni ches shin tu grang ba yin par zad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ches shin tu grang ba yin par zad do //
translated: Some say that the hells are extremely cold.🔽Others say that the seeds of these exist there.

original: gzhan dag na re de dag la de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dag la de dag sa bon gyi sgo nas yod kyi zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say that the seeds of these exist there,🔽but not their actual entities.🔽The seeds exist there in the sense that their potentialities exist there.

original: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas te /🔽mthu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i sgo nas te / mthu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term “potentiality” is “power.”

original: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The actual entities do not exist there. The meaning of the term “actual entity” is “substance.”

original: de la ni gang gis na rnal 'byor pa dag mos pa'i khyad par gyis gser gyi khams dang / dngul gyi khams dang / zangs kyi khams zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i khams dag byed par 'gyur ba nus pa kho na yod do //
analyzed: de la ni gang gis na rnal 'byor pa dag mos pa'i khyad par gyis gser gyi khams dang / dngul gyi khams dang / zangs kyi khams zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i khams dag byed par 'gyur ba nus pa kho na yod do //
translated: In this regard, the yogis, through the power of their imagination, can transform the elements, such as the element of gold, the element of silver, and the element of copper.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shing gi phung po 'di la khams rnam pa sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because the Buddha said, “In this mass of wood there are various elements.”

original: der ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khams kyi nus pa la de skad ces bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: der ni bcom ldan 'das kyis khams kyi nus pa la de skad ces bshad pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān explained the term dhātu in terms of the potential of the elements.

original: de la gser dang / dngul la sogs pa'i khams mang po dag rang gi ngo bor yod pa'i go skabs ni med do //
analyzed: de la gser dang / dngul la sogs pa'i khams mang po dag rang gi ngo bor yod pa'i go skabs ni med do //
translated: There is no opportunity for many elements such as gold, silver and so on to exist in their essence.🔽How can wind have color?

original: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kho na la brgal ba yin no //
analyzed: rlung la kha dog ji ltar yod ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kho na la brgal ba yin no //
translated: This is a question for Vaibhasikas alone.

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //
translated: If one asserts that a subtle particle devoid of sense faculties and sound has eight substances,

original: ces nges par byas pa /
analyzed: ces nges par byas pa /
translated: it is ascertained that

original: ji ltar rlung la kha dog yod ces dmigs kyis sel bar byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar rlung la kha dog yod ces dmigs kyis sel bar byed de /
translated: how can wind have color?

original: de la ni kha dog ji ltar yang mi dmigs so //🔽don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni kha dog ji ltar yang mi dmigs so // don 'di ni dad par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Color is not observed in it at all.🔽Vaibhasikas say that this meaning should be accepted with faith,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams yin te /
translated: but it should not be inferred.

original: don 'di ni yid ches pa dam pa dag gis bshad pa yin pas yid ches par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di ni yid ches pa dam pa dag gis bshad pa yin pas yid ches par bya ba yin gyi rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This point is explained by those of firm conviction, so it should be accepted with firm conviction, but it should not be inferred.🔽Or, because it apprehends a mixed smell.

original: yang na 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na rjes su dpag pa yang yod do zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dres par dri 'dzin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na rjes su dpag pa yang yod do zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: In one sense, it is taught that there is also inference.

original: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'bral ba las rlung gi dri dmigs la dri de yang kha dog la 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: dri dang ldan pa'i rdzas dang 'bral ba las rlung gi dri dmigs la dri de yang kha dog la 'khrul pa med de /
translated: The smell of wind is perceived when separated from a substance possessing smell, and that smell is not mistaken for color.

original: gang gi dri yod pa de na kha dog yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi dri yod pa de na kha dog yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is smell, there is color.

original: 'dir sgrub pa'i tshig ni rlung ni kha dog dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa'i tshig ni rlung ni kha dog dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the syllogism is: The wind possesses color.

original: dri dang ldan pa'i @114a * //
analyzed: dri dang ldan pa'i @114a * //
translated: Because it possesses smell.

original: phyir sna ma'i me tog lta bu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyir sna ma'i me tog lta bu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Like a jasmine flower.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro dag med par bshad pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni dri dang ro dag med par bshad pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is explained that smell and taste do not exist in the form realm.

original: dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
translated: Smell, taste, nose, and tongue

original: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The tongue consciousness element is not included.

original: des na de na yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rdzas drug dang bdun dang brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na de na yod pa'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rdzas drug dang bdun dang brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the atoms that exist there possess six, seven, or eight substances.

original: de na yod pa ni de na yod pa dag go //
analyzed: de na yod pa ni de na yod pa dag go //
translated: Those that exist there are those that exist in the second absorption.

original: de na yod pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag gi dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de na yod pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab dag gi dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: They are from the perspective of atoms that exist there, such as atoms of form.

original: 'di na dbang po yang med sgra yang med pa rdzas brgyad par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni de na rdzas drug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di na dbang po yang med sgra yang med pa rdzas brgyad par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni de na rdzas drug pa yin la /
translated: The atoms that exist there possess six substances, because the eight substances that are explained to exist here, such as form and so on, do not exist there.

original: lus kyi dbang po dang rdzas dgu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang rdzas dgu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas bdun pa yin no //
translated: The atoms that exist there possess seven substances, because the nine substances that exist here, such as form and so on, do not exist there.

original: dbang po gzhan dang yang ldan pa rdzas bcu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan dang yang ldan pa rdzas bcu pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas brgyad pa yin no //
translated: The atoms that exist there possess eight substances, because the ten substances that exist here, such as form and so on, do not exist there.

original: yang 'di dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni rdzas bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'di dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni rdzas bdun pa dang brgyad pa dang dgu pa yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If they are accompanied by sound, then they are the seventh, eighth, and ninth substances.🔽Because they are similar to what has already been explained, they are not explained again.

original: bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad zin pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir yang mi bshad do zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that because they are similar to what has already been explained, they are not mentioned again.🔽Do only substances refer to substances in this context?

original: yang ci 'dir rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ngam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos kyi tshul gyis gang la rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de la rdzas su gzung ngam 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas kyi dbang du byas
analyzed: yang ci 'dir rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ngam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dngos kyi tshul gyis gang la rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de la rdzas su gzung ngam 'on te skye mched kyi rdzas kyi dbang du byas
translated: The meaning of this question is: Do only substances that exist by way of their own characteristics refer to substances, or do sense spheres also refer to substances?

original: pa yin / skye mched la yang spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir rdzas shes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: pa yin / skye mched la yang spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir rdzas shes brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Since sense spheres also have general and specific characteristics, it is impossible to say that they are substances.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni des na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni des na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, what fault would there be?

original: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su bzung na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas la rdzas su bzung na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ha cang nyung
analyzed: gal te rdzas kho na la rdzas su bzung na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdzas la rdzas su bzung na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ha cang nyung
translated: If one were to apprehend only substance as substance, then this statement that the eight substances exist would be too few,

original: bar smras pa yin te kha cig la ci rigs par rdzas gzhan dbyibs dang yang ba nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar smras pa yin te kha cig la ci rigs par rdzas gzhan dbyibs dang yang ba nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because some have other substances, such as shape, lightness, heaviness, smoothness, roughness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: de lta yin dang rdzas brgyad pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas dgu pa yin pa nas rdzas bcu bzhi pa'i bar yin par 'gyur bas rdzas brgyad pa'i nges pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rdzas brgyad pa gang yin pa de ni rdzas dgu pa yin pa nas rdzas bcu bzhi pa'i bar yin par 'gyur bas rdzas brgyad pa'i nges pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then whatever is an eight substance would be a nine substance and so on up to a fourteen substance, and the assertion of eight substances would fail.

original: rdzas dgu pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas dgu pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, this should be applied to those possessing nine substances and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzugs @114b kyi khams na yang rdzas drug dang bdun dang brgyad pa'i nges pa nyams par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs @114b kyi khams na yang rdzas drug dang bdun dang brgyad pa'i nges pa nyams par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: So too, in the form realm, the restriction of possessing six, seven or eight substances should be understood to be relinquished.

original: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rdzas bzhi dang ldan pa zhes brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: One should say that they possess four substances.

original: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te //
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te //
translated: Because it is said that tactile objects are of two types,

original: zhes 'byung bas sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin pa de'i phyir 'dod pa na sgra med pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rdzas bzhi pa yin la sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas lnga pa yin🔽no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas sa la sogs pa 'byung ba rnams kyang reg bya'i skye mched yin pa de'i phyir 'dod pa na sgra med pa ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya zhes bya ba rdzas bzhi pa yin la sgra dang bcas na ni rdzas lnga pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: the primary elements such as earth are the source of touch. Therefore one should say that in the desire realm, those who do not possess sound possess four substances: form, smell, taste and tactility. But if they possess sound, they possess five substances.

original: rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: Those that are the basis are the four such as earth.

original: rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig go //🔽de ltar na dbyibs kyang gzugs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir la yang ba nyid la sogs pa yang reg bya yin pas 'di ha cang nyung bar smras pa ma yin la rten du gyur pa rnams reg bya'i skye mched kyi nas phyung ste /
analyzed: rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig go // de ltar na dbyibs kyang gzugs kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir la yang ba nyid la sogs pa yang reg bya yin pas 'di ha cang nyung bar smras pa ma yin la rten du gyur pa rnams reg bya'i skye mched kyi nas phyung ste /
translated: That which is a support is the form, smell, taste, and one part of tactility.🔽Thus, since shape is included in form and lightness, etc., are types of tactility, it is not said that this is too few.

original: rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir ha cang mangs pa yang ma yin yo //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir bstan pa'i phyir ha cang mangs pa yang ma yin yo //
translated: Since the support is extracted from the base of tactility, it is not said that this is too many, since it is taught as four types.

original: de lta bas na 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams mang por 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'byung ba'i rdzas rnams mang por 'gyur te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung la /
translated: Thus the substances of the primary elements would be many.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha'i ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sngon po'am ser po gcig gi rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang yin pa de nyid rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan dri'am ro'i rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha'i ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs sngon po'am ser po gcig gi rten 'byung ba bzhi tshan gang yin pa de nyid rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gzhan dri'am ro'i rten ni ma yin no //
translated: The Sautrantikas say: The four primary elements that are the basis of one derivative form, such as blue or yellow, are not the basis of another derivative form, such as smell or taste.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de'i rten ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The support of the other four great elements is the other four great elements.

original: 'dir ni rigs la rdzas su bzung ste //
analyzed: 'dir ni rigs la rdzas su bzung ste //
translated: Here, the type is taken as a substance.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs la rdzas su bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ni 'byung ba bzhi tshan gyi rigs la rdzas su bzung ste /
translated: Here, the type of the four great elements is taken as a substance.

original: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gcig gi rigs ji lta ba de las ni mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi tshan gzhan dag kyang 'byung ba bzhi tshan gcig gi rigs ji lta ba de las ni mi 'da'o //
translated: The other four great elements do not go beyond the type of the one set of four great elements.🔽Why is it necessary to make such a distinction?

original: de ltar 'bad de bye brag tu bshad ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ste /🔽rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bad de bye brag tu bshad ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'dir cung zad cig ni rdzas kho na la rdzas su gzung ste / rten du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, that which is a support is taken as a substance.

original: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas su gzung ste /🔽rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad cig ni skye mched kyi rdzas su gzung ste / rten can du gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is supported is taken as a substance of the sense bases.

original: rten can du gyur pa de yang de'i rigs la gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rten can du gyur pa de yang de'i rigs la gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is supported should be taken as the type of that.

original: tshig ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par byas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshig ni 'dun pa ste /🔽'dod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas ci de rnams nges par @115a * //
analyzed: tshig ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas don la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas par byas pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshig ni 'dun pa ste / 'dod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin pas ci de rnams nges par @115a * //
translated: Since the words that follow the brief and extensive explanations are intentions,

original: lhan cig skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes de dag gi don la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba yin nam ma yin zhes de dag gi don la brtag par bya'o //
translated: since they are engaged by way of desire, the meaning of those should be investigated, “Do they definitely arise together or not?

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa sems par byed pa dag ni bsags par gnas pa dag la 'byung ba dang 'gyur ba las gyur pa rnams nges par brjod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa sems par byed pa dag ni bsags par gnas pa dag la 'byung ba dang 'gyur ba las gyur pa rnams nges par brjod do //
translated: The Yogācāras, who reflect on this, say that the elements that are stored arise from the elements that are transformed.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: smras pa / 'dus pa las 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dus pa las 'byung ba gcig las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: They say: There is that which arises from one element, which is derived from the elements that are stored.

original: 'di lta ste bong rdog skams pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bong rdog skams pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a dry lump of clay.

original: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba gnyis las gyur pa yang yod de /
translated: There is that which arises from two elements,🔽which is derived from the elements that are transformed.

original: de nyid gsher ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsher ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, that same lump of clay when wet.

original: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de //
analyzed: 'byung ba gsum las gyur pa yang yod de //
translated: There is that which arises from three elements,🔽which is derived from the elements that are transformed.

original: de nyid dro ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid dro ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, that same lump of clay when warm.

original: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa'i bar yang yod de bong rdog gsher ba dang dro ba de nyid 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad las gyur pa'i bar yang yod de bong rdog gsher ba dang dro ba de nyid 'gro ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: There is also that which is derived from all the elements, such as a lump of clay that is moist and warm when it is the abode of living beings.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'dus pa gang la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhig dmigs pa de ni de la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la yang 'dus pa gang la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gang zhig dmigs pa de ni de la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: As for derived form, it should be understood that wherever derived form is found, there it exists.

original: 'dus pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dus pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gcig dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a collection that possesses one type of derived form.

original: 'di lta ste 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'od lta bu'o //
translated: For example, light.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa yang yod de 'di lta ste rlung sgra dang dri dang bcas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis dang ldan pa yang yod de 'di lta ste rlung sgra dang dri dang bcas pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is a collection that possesses two types of derived form. For example, wind that possesses sound and smell.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gsum dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a collection that possesses three types of derived form.

original: 'di lta ste du ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste du ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, smoke.

original: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'i khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs dang dri dang reg bya'i khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is distinguished by the particularities of form, smell, and tactility.

original: 'di la reg bya'i khyad par ni yang ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la reg bya'i khyad par ni yang ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The particularity of tactility should be understood as lightness.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bzhi dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who possess four derivative forms.

original: 'di lta ste aa ga ru'i sdong bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste aa ga ru'i sdong bu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a piece of agarwood.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs lnga dang ldan pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who possess five derivative forms.🔽For example, that very piece of agarwood together with its sound.

original: 'di lta ste de nyid sgra dang bcas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste de nyid sgra dang bcas pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The remaining topics should be explained.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag gi'o //🔽sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces bya ba ni sems kyang sems las byung ba dag med par mi skye la sems las byung ba dag kyang sems med par mi skye'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin gyi sems thams cad kyang sems las byung
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag gi'o // sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / ces bya ba ni sems kyang sems las byung ba dag med par mi skye la sems las byung ba dag kyang sems med par mi skye'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ba yin gyi sems thams cad kyang sems las byung
translated: The remaining topics are those of the mind, mental factors, and those not associated with the mind.🔽The phrase “the mind and mental factors definitely arise together” means that the mind does not arise without mental factors and mental factors do not arise without the mind.🔽This is a definitive statement, but it is not a definitive statement that all minds arise together with all mental factors,

original: ba thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ba thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: or that all mental factors arise together with all minds.

original: sems las byung ba thams cad kyang sems thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yang ma @115b yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad kyang sems thams cad dang nges par lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yang ma @115b yin no //
translated: It is not that all mental factors arise simultaneously with all minds.🔽All are with the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni de thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa de dag dang gdon mi za bar lhan cig skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba ni de thams cad ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa de dag dang gdon mi za bar lhan cig skyes pa yin no //
translated: All those are definitely simultaneously generated with the characteristics of the conditioned, such as arising.

original: de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: gzugs sam sems sam sems las byung ba dag gam ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang rung gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzugs sam sems sam sems las byung ba dag gam ldan pa ma yin pa dag kyang rung gang cung zad skye ba de thams cad ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Whatever arises, whether form, mind, mental factors, or non-psychophysical aggregates, all that is...

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes gong nyid du smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba med pa kho na'o zhes gong nyid du smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been stated above that the unconditioned has no arising.🔽The word or is stated for the purpose of differentiation.

original: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so zhes bya ba ni kha cig ni thob pa dang lhan cig skye ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so zhes bya ba ni kha cig ni thob pa dang lhan cig skye ste /
translated: Some arise simultaneously with obtainment,

original: sems can du bgrang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: those that are counted as sentient beings.

original: kha cig ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi skye ste /
translated: Some do not arise,

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bye brag tu bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o zhes bye brag tu bya ba yin no //
translated: those that are not counted as sentient beings.

original: so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dag la yang thob pa yod mod kyi de dag skye bar ni mi 'gyur bas de gnyis ma smos te /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dag la yang thob pa yod mod kyi de dag skye bar ni mi 'gyur bas de gnyis ma smos te /
translated: Although there is acquisition of analytical and non-analytical cessations, they do not arise, so they are not mentioned.

original: 'di ni nges par lhan cig skye ba las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par lhan cig skye ba las brtsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of co-arisen acquisition.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa la thob pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa la thob pa med do zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason that there is no acquisition of what is not counted as a sentient being?

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not common to all sentient beings.

original: lhan cig skye ba'i thob pa kho na dang thob pa dang ldan pa lhan cig skye ba'i dus snga ma dang phyis skye ba dang ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i thob pa kho na dang thob pa dang ldan pa lhan cig skye ba'i dus snga ma dang phyis skye ba dang ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there is only co-arisen acquisition and one who possesses acquisition is only born simultaneously or earlier, not later.

original: go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go skabs kyi yul te zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The domain of opportunity is synonymous with the domain of birth.

original: sa mang po pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir mang po pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sa mang po pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir mang po pa nyid yin no //
translated: The universal mental factors are so called because they occur in all minds.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag ni sems kyi skad cig thams cad la tshogs par 'byung ngo zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag ni sems kyi skad cig thams cad la tshogs par 'byung ngo zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is well known that these ten factors occur in every moment of mind.

original: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “known” indicates that this is the opinion of others.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs ni 'dun pa la sogs pa sems thams cad la mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs ni 'dun pa la sogs pa sems thams cad la mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: According to our own system, aspiration and so on do not occur in all minds.

original: 'di ltar slob dpon 'dis phung po lnga'i nang du 'dun pa gang zhe na /🔽bsams pa'i dngos po la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon 'dis phung po lnga'i nang du 'dun pa gang zhe na / bsams pa'i dngos po la mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Thus this master Vasubandhu wrote:🔽What is aspiration? It is the desire for a considered object.

original: mos pa gang zhe na nges pa'i dngos po de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bris so //
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na nges pa'i dngos po de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bris so //
translated: What is resolute belief? It is the firm apprehension of a considered object as certain.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu g-yo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems rab tu g-yo bar byed pa ste /
translated: Mental activity is the mental factor that activates the mind.

original: rab tu g-yo bar @116a * //
analyzed: rab tu g-yo bar @116a * //
translated: It is like a stirring,

original: byed pa bzhin du rab tu g-yo bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa bzhin du rab tu g-yo bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and it is called a stirring because it stirs up the mind.

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul gyi khyad par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The apprehension of the sign of an object is the apprehension of the distinguishing characteristics of an object.🔽Contact is the contact that arises from the union of object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa ni reg pa dang 'dra bar reg pa yin te /
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las skyes pa'i reg pa ni reg pa dang 'dra bar reg pa yin te /
translated: Contact is like a touching, and it is called a touching because it touches the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: gang dang ldan pas yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun reg pa bzhin du reg pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun reg pa bzhin du reg pa yin no //
translated: It is called contact because the object, faculty, and consciousness are united as if they were touching each other.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa 'am /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa 'am /
translated: It is the full discernment of phenomena.🔽It is the full discernment of phenomena because it fully discerns phenomena.

original: 'dis rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'gyur bas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //🔽gang gis na chos 'dres pa lta bu rnams la me tog dag ltar 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis rab tu rnam par 'byed par 'gyur bas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o // gang gis na chos 'dres pa lta bu rnams la me tog dag ltar 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The discernment of phenomena is the discernment of phenomena because it discerns phenomena or it discerns through that.

original: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'o //🔽'di dag ni gzugs can no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zag pa med pa'o // 'di dag ni gzugs can no //
translated: It discerns phenomena that are mixed together, like flowers, in the way that one discerns flowers, thinking, “These are with-outflows, these are without-outflows,

original: 'di dag ni gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa ste /🔽dmigs kyis sel bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gzugs can ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar rab tu rnam par 'byed par byed pa ste / dmigs kyis sel bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: these are material, these are not material,” and so on.

original: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of phenomena because it discerns phenomena.

original: grags pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab ces brjod par bya ba las tshig le'ur byas pa las tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par blo gros zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: grags pa yin pa'i phyir shes rab ces brjod par bya ba las tshig le'ur byas pa las tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par blo gros zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it should be called wisdom. But it is called intelligence in the verse because it is well known by that name.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas yid kyis dmigs pa mi brjed pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa mi brjed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas yid kyis dmigs pa mi brjed pa ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the non-loss of an object. It is that by which the mind does not lose the object.

original: de mngon par brjod pa lta bu de ni dran pa yin no //
analyzed: de mngon par brjod pa lta bu de ni dran pa yin no //
translated: It is like a reminder.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems 'jug cing gtod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la sems 'jug cing gtod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attention is the directing of the mind. It is that by which the mind is directed to an object.

original: yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa'am /
translated: Attention is the action of attending or the one who attends.

original: yid la byed cing gtod par byed pas na yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed cing gtod par byed pas na yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the directing of the mind to an object.

original: 'dod pa ni de'i dmigs pa la yon tan du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni de'i dmigs pa la yon tan du nges par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Desire is the ascertainment of the virtues of its object.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Desire is the desire for an object.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa sems par byed pa dag ni ji ltar nges pa bzhin 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar sems so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa sems par byed pa dag ni ji ltar nges pa bzhin 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar sems so //
translated: Yogacārins who reflect on this think that the latter is the way to apprehend it.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of the mind.

original: rtse dang dmigs pa zhes bya @116b ba ni don gcig ste /
analyzed: rtse dang dmigs pa zhes bya @116b ba ni don gcig ste /
translated: The terms peak and object have the same meaning.

original: gang dang ldan pas sems dmigs pa gcig la rgyun chags su 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas sems dmigs pa gcig la rgyun chags su 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Concentration is that by which the mind engages in continuous flow on one object.🔽If concentration exists for all minds, why is effort made to attain the absorptions?

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la yod na ci'i phyir bsam gtan dag la 'bad par byed ce na stobs dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la yod na ci'i phyir bsam gtan dag la 'bad par byed ce na stobs dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to attain powerful concentration.

original: ji ltar sems gcig la sems las byung ba mtshan nyid tha dad pa bcu yod pa nyid du shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems gcig la sems las byung ba mtshan nyid tha dad pa bcu yod pa nyid du shes she na /
translated: How do you know that there are ten mental factors with different characteristics in one mind?

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, the Abhidharmakosa says, “The distinction of minds and mental factors is subtle.”

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi khyad par de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang brtags par dka' na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos re zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams te lus can rnams la
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi khyad par de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang brtags par dka' na dus kyi mtha'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos re zhig sman la sogs pa gzugs can rnams te lus can rnams la
translated: It is difficult to examine the difference between minds and mental factors even in relation to their continua, so what need is there to speak of the characteristics of the final moment of time?🔽Even in relation to physical things such as medicine,

original: yang aa ru ra la sogs pa ro mang po kha cig gi ro'i khyad par dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang aa ru ra la sogs pa ro mang po kha cig gi ro'i khyad par dbang pos gzung bar bya ba ste /
translated: it is difficult to ascertain the difference in taste of some things with many tastes that are apprehended by the sense faculty,

original: lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams nges par gzung bar dka' zhing yongs su gcad par dka' ba yin na chos gang dag gzugs can ma yin zhing blos gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: lce'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba rnams nges par gzung bar dka' zhing yongs su gcad par dka' ba yin na chos gang dag gzugs can ma yin zhing blos gzung bar bya ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: that is, apprehended by the tongue sense faculty. What need is there to speak of those phenomena that are not physical and are apprehended by the mind?

original: de lta bas na yid ches pas bstan pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du yid ches par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yid ches pas bstan pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na bzhin du yid ches par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since this is taught by one who is trustworthy, you should believe it just as it is.

original: dad pa ni sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pas sems nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas rnyog pa dangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pa ni sems dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pas sems nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pas rnyog pa dangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one possesses faith, the mind becomes clear, free from the turbidity of the mental afflictions and the secondary mental afflictions.

original: nor bu chu'i dang byed dang ldan pas chu bzhin no //🔽gzhan dag na re bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi dang dkon mchog gsum dang las dge ba dang mi dge ba dag dang 'bras bu 'dod pa
analyzed: nor bu chu'i dang byed dang ldan pas chu bzhin no // gzhan dag na re bden pa dang dkon mchog dang las dang 'bras bu rnams la mngon par yid ches pa yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi dang dkon mchog gsum dang las dge ba dang mi dge ba dag dang 'bras bu 'dod pa
translated: It is like a gem that purifies water, because it makes the water clear.🔽Others say that faith is a clear comprehension of the truths, the Three Jewels, karma, and its results.🔽They say that faith is the clear comprehension and clear understanding that the Four Noble Truths, the Three Jewels, virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, and their results, which are desirable and undesirable, exist.

original: dang mi 'dod pa dag la 'di dag ni yod pa kho na'o snyam du mngon par yid ches shing mngon par rtogs pa ni dad pa yin no zhes dad pa ni de lta bu'i rnam pa yin par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dang mi 'dod pa dag la 'di dag ni yod pa kho na'o snyam du mngon par yid ches shing mngon par rtogs pa ni dad pa yin no zhes dad pa ni de lta bu'i rnam pa yin par ston pa yin no //
translated: This is how they explain the nature of faith.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Conscientiousness is the cultivation of virtuous entities.

original: sgom pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: sgom pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The term “cultivation” is explained as follows:

original: rnyed dang rten zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rnyed dang rten zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Acquisition and reliance”

original: dge ba 'dus byas sgom pa'o //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i chos @117a * //
analyzed: dge ba 'dus byas sgom pa'o // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dge ba'i chos @117a * //
translated: means the cultivation of virtuous things.

original: rnams rnyed pa dang bsten pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnams rnyed pa dang bsten pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Because this is stated, the virtues are the essence of acquisition and reliance.

original: de ji ltar sems las byung ba bag yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sems las byung ba bag yod pa zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that heedfulness is a mental factor?

original: gang zhig yod na rnyed pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa de yod pa de ni bag yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na rnyed pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa de yod pa de ni bag yod pa ste /
translated: When there is heedfulness, there is the cultivation of acquisition and reliance.

original: gces su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gces su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of cherishing.

original: de'i phyir de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag nyid la gces su 'dzin pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is just that cherishing itself.

original: de lta yin par bsgom pa'i rgyu la sgom pa nye bar gdags pa ni byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin par bsgom pa'i rgyu la sgom pa nye bar gdags pa ni byas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the cultivation of the cause is designated as cultivation.

original: sems kun du srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dag las sems kun du srung ba de ni bag yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kun du srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dag las sems kun du srung ba de ni bag yod pa yin no //
translated: “It is the complete protection of the mind” means that when there is heedfulness, the mind is completely protected from the afflictions.

original: sems las su rung ba nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas sems las su rung bar 'gyur pa de ni sems las su rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: sems las su rung ba nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas sems las su rung bar 'gyur pa de ni sems las su rung ba nyid de /
translated: pliability of mind is that by possessing which the mind becomes pliable.

original: sems yang ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems yang ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the lightness of mind.🔽Isn’t physical pliancy also mentioned in the sutras?

original: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gnyis su 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gnyis su 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the enumeration of the enlightenment factor of pliancy?

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod la sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod la sems shin tu sbyangs pa yang yod do //
translated: There is physical pliancy and there is mental pliancy.

original: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa de yang mngon par shes pa dang rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur pa yin la sems shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la lus shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang yin pa de yang mngon par shes pa dang rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur pa yin la sems shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa gang dag byang chub kyi yan lag de yang mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: That pliancy which is physical pliancy is the enlightenment factor of pliancy that is an actual basis of the higher perceptions, complete enlightenment and nirvana.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That pliancy which is mental pliancy is the enlightenment factor of pliancy that is an actual basis of the higher perceptions, complete enlightenment and nirvana.

original: ji ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gcig kho na brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gcig kho na brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said that pliancy is mental flexibility alone?

original: de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that it should be understood like physical feeling.

original: ji ltar tshor ba sems las byung ba yin yang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang po la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ba ltar shin tu sbyangs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba sems las byung ba yin yang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang po la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya ba ltar shin tu sbyangs pa 'di yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as feeling, though it arises from the mind, is called bodily because it is based on the sense faculty which is an aggregation of subtle matter, so you should understand this pliancy.🔽How can it be a factor of enlightenment?

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa yin no //🔽'o na der ni lus las su rung ba kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par @117b 'byung ba ni mdo der ni lus nyam nga ba med pa kho na lus las su rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag tu rung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa yin no // 'o na der ni lus las su rung ba kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par @117b 'byung ba ni mdo der ni lus nyam nga ba med pa kho na lus las su rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: He asks this because the five collections of consciousness are not equipoise.🔽In that sutra, only physical pliancy is called physical pliancy,

original: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
analyzed: yid dga' na lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i khyad par dga' bas drangs pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no //
translated: because it is said, “When the mind is delighted, the body becomes pliant,” and it is a special element induced by delight.

original: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa so so na 'dug pa'i phyir dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar na byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa so so na 'dug pa'i phyir dang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They are not suitable to be called limbs because they are not in a state of assembly and they possess the contaminants.🔽The Buddha spoke of joy and the phenomena that are the basis of joy as the limb of correct joy,

original: dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: dga' ba dang dga' ba'i gnas lta bu'i chos rnams dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gsungs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mu stegs can rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams la 'di skad ces /
translated: because tīrthikas said to the Bhagavān’s śrāvakas,

original: khyed la dge slong goo ta mas 'di skad du dge slong dag khyed tshur sheg sgrib pa lnga po sems 'khrug par byed pa shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dag spong la /
analyzed: khyed la dge slong goo ta mas 'di skad du dge slong dag khyed tshur sheg sgrib pa lnga po sems 'khrug par byed pa shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dag spong la /
translated: “The bhikṣu Gautama says to you, ‘Bhikṣus, come here. Abandon the five hindrances that agitate the mind and weaken wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms shig ces bshad do zhes grag ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms shig ces bshad do zhes grag ste /
translated: Meditate on the seven limbs of enlightenment.’

original: kho bo cag kyang de skad du smra na /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de skad du smra na /
translated: We also say this.

original: de la kho bo cag dang dge sbyong goo ta mar chos ston pa la khyad par ci zhig yod ces smras so //
analyzed: de la kho bo cag dang dge sbyong goo ta mar chos ston pa la khyad par ci zhig yod ces smras so //
translated: What is the difference between us and the ascetic Gautama in teaching the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la lnga yod pa las bcur 'gyur ba dang bcu yod pa las lngar rnam par gzhag pa 'di bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la lnga yod pa las bcur 'gyur ba dang bcu yod pa las lngar rnam par gzhag pa 'di bstan te /
translated: The Bhagavān taught them this: “From five, ten arise; from ten, five are posited.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khong khro ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu yang gnod sems kyi sgrib par bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khong khro ba dang / de dang mthun pa'i phyir khong khro ba'i rgyu mtshan kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhi dgu yang gnod sems kyi sgrib par bshad do //
translated: The Bhagavān explained that the nine bases of malice are the obscurations to non-malice, because they are the causes of malice and are concordant with it.

original: de bzhin du dga' ba dang de dang mthun pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan yang zhes bya ba'i dbye ba 'dis bdun yod pa las bcu bzhir 'gyur la bcu bzhi yod pa bdun du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dga' ba dang de dang mthun pa'i phyir dga' ba'i rgyu mtshan yang zhes bya ba'i dbye ba 'dis bdun yod pa las bcu bzhir 'gyur la bcu bzhi yod pa bdun du rnam par gzhag pa 'di yang yod do //
translated: Similarly, there is this: “From seven, fourteen arise; from fourteen, seven are posited,” because the causes of joy are concordant with joy.

original: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtog pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de gnyis shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rtsol ba dag shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtog pa dang brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de gnyis shes rab kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Conceptualization and striving are not the nature of wisdom.

original: gang gi tshe lam la tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po zhes phung po gsum du mdzad pa na ni shes rab kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam la tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po zhes phung po gsum du mdzad pa na ni shes rab kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: When the path is divided into three aggregates—the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of meditative stabilization, and the aggregate of wisdom—wisdom is taught to be the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o zhes shes rab kyi phung po bstan pa de'i nang @118a * //🔽du bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba'o zhes shes rab kyi phung po bstan pa de'i nang @118a * // du bshad do //
translated: The aggregate of wisdom is right view, right thought, and right effort.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas sems lhun gyis grub par mnyam par 'dug pa de ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas sems lhun gyis grub par mnyam par 'dug pa de ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Equanimity is the sameness of mind.

original: 'du byed kyi btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called equanimity of volition.

original: btang snyoms ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Equanimity is threefold:

original: tshor ba'i btang snyoms dang / 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i btang snyoms dang / 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / tshad med pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: equanimity of feeling, equanimity of volition, and equanimity of the immeasurables.🔽Isn’t it explained that the distinction of these is difficult to understand?

original: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi bye brag ni shes par dka'o zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi bye brag ni phra bas de ni re zhig rgyun rnams la yang yongs su gcad par dka' na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The distinction of minds and mental factors is subtle. It is difficult to discern even in a continuum, much less in a single moment.🔽It is difficult to understand, therefore, that contact and so on can exist without contradiction in a single moment of mind.

original: shes par bya ba dka' ba ni shes par dka' ba ste sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la reg pa la sogs pa chos kyi khyad par mi 'gal ba yod par shes par dka' ba yang shes par yod kyi sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la rtsol ba
analyzed: shes par bya ba dka' ba ni shes par dka' ba ste sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la reg pa la sogs pa chos kyi khyad par mi 'gal ba yod par shes par dka' ba yang shes par yod kyi sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la rtsol ba
translated: It is difficult to understand that contact and so on can exist without contradiction in a single moment of mind.

original: dang rtsol ba med pa dag yod pa gang 'gal bzhin du yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni shin tu shes par dka' ste rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: dang rtsol ba med pa dag yod pa gang 'gal bzhin du yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni shin tu shes par dka' ste rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: It is very difficult to understand how there is no contradiction in the existence of both effort and non-effort, which are mutually exclusive.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag yod pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig la bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag yod pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see pleasure and pain, which are mutually exclusive, existing in a single moment of mind.

original: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba yang dmigs pa gzhan la 'byung la rtsol ba med pa yang gzhan du 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rtsol ba yang gzhan du 'byung la zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba yang dmigs pa gzhan la 'byung la rtsol ba med pa yang gzhan du 'byung bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Effort occurs in one place, and non-effort occurs in another place, so there is no contradiction.

original: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs gzhan yang 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i rigs te dper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di las 'di lta bu'i rigs gzhan yang 'byung bas zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i rigs te dper na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: Other types of contradictions can also occur, such as the contradiction between investigation and analysis.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: Their characteristics are as follows:

original: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib dag /
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib dag /
translated: Investigation and analysis are coarseness and subtlety.

original: ces 'byung ba'i phyir rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba nyid yin la dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa nyid yin te de dag kyang gcig la yod pa 'gal lo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba'i phyir rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba nyid yin la dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa nyid yin te de dag kyang gcig la yod pa 'gal lo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is explained that conception is the coarseness of mind and discernment is the subtlety of mind, and that they are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de 'di la yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs kyis 'byung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngang tshul gang yin pa de 'di la yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs kyis 'byung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The mode of these two should be understood as the mode of these two.🔽Shame and embarrassment will be explained later.🔽Shamelessness and lack of embarrassment are the opposites of shame and embarrassment.🔽Shamelessness is the lack of embarrassment about offending others.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Lack of embarrassment is the lack of embarrassment about offending others.

original: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //🔽kha na ma thos 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med // kha na ma thos 'jigs mi lta //
translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of shame, and lack of embarrassment is the opposite of embarrassment.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir bzlog ste smos pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni gti mug med pa de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'o //

original: shes @118b rab ni sa mang po pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes @118b rab ni sa mang po pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of shame, and lack of embarrassment is the opposite of embarrassment.

original: blo gros dran zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros dran zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Shamelessness

original: 'di dge ba'i sa mang po kho na yin par ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dge ba'i sa mang po kho na yin par ni mi brjod do //
translated: It is not said that these are only virtuous mental factors.

original: 'o na ci zhe na ni dge ba'i sa chen po la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na ni dge ba'i sa chen po la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: But they are also great virtuous mental factors.

original: rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par mi byed pa de ni sems las byung ba rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas gzhan la rnam par tho 'tshams par mi byed pa de ni sems las byung ba rnam par mi 'tshe ba ste rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Non-violence is the mental factor that, when possessed, prevents one from harming others. It is the antidote to violence.

original: sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba bya ba la mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus yin no //
analyzed: sems mngon par spro ba'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba bya ba la mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus yin no //
translated: Exertion is the mental factor that is the enthusiasm for virtuous action.

original: mi dge ba bya ba la sems mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bya ba la sems mngon par spro ba gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus ma yin te /
translated: The enthusiasm for non-virtuous action is not exertion.

original: de ni 'bying ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gsung rab las le lo kho na yin par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni 'bying ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gsung rab las le lo kho na yin par 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is the nature of laziness, it is taught in the scriptures as laziness.

original: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān said:🔽“What is laziness?

original: 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni le lo kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de ni le lo kho na yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The effort of non-Buddhists is only laziness.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'og nas /
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'og nas /
translated: Delusion is ignorance means that below it says:

original: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun phyogs chos gzhan //
translated: The opposite of knowledge is a separate phenomenon.

original: ma rig ces bya ba rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ma rig ces bya ba rnams 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is called ignorance. This will be explained later.

original: sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos so zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa med pa tsam zhig yin par rtogs par gyur na mi rung bas /
analyzed: sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos so zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa med pa tsam zhig yin par rtogs par gyur na mi rung bas /
translated: The opposite of meditation is a separate phenomenon means that if it is understood to be just the absence of meditation, it is not suitable.

original: sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes smos te /
analyzed: sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says the opposite of meditation is a separate phenomenon.

original: le lo la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: Laziness and so on should be explained in the same way.

original: lus lci ba nyid dang sems lci ba nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin no //
analyzed: lus lci ba nyid dang sems lci ba nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos yin no //
translated: The heaviness of the body and the heaviness of the mind are phenomena that are opposites of pliancy.

original: lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshor ba sems las byung ba kho na yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi yin par rnam par bshad pa ltar lus kyi rmugs pa yang de dang 'dra ste
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar tshor ba sems las byung ba kho na yin yang dbang po gzugs can la brten pa'i phyir lus kyi yin par rnam par bshad pa ltar lus kyi rmugs pa yang de dang 'dra ste
translated: just as feeling, although it is only a mental factor, is called bodily because it is based on a physical faculty, so too torpor of the body is explained.

original: / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rmugs pa ni lus kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rmugs pa ni lus kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Torpor that is concomitant with the five collections of consciousness is called bodily.🔽Excitement is a mental factor that is the opposite of calm abiding.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhib zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rgod pa bro gar dang / glu dang steg pa dang / cha byad dang / rgyan la sogs pa'i gzhi byed pa'i las can yin no //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhib zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rgod pa bro gar dang / glu dang steg pa dang / cha byad dang / rgyan la sogs pa'i gzhi byed pa'i las can yin no //
translated: It has the function of serving as a basis for the distraction of mind.🔽It is not derived from that,

original: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa de las so //
analyzed: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa de las so //
translated: it is not derived from that Abhidharma.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi 'dod pa shes pa ni ma yin @119a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi 'dod pa shes pa ni ma yin @119a * //
translated: It is a transformation of the gods, not a transformation of desire.

original: no zhes bya ba ni yi ge las 'byung ba tshad mar byed pa tsam gyis nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'gyur ba 'di kho na shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi slob dpon rnams kyi 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: no zhes bya ba ni yi ge las 'byung ba tshad mar byed pa tsam gyis nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa bcur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i 'gyur ba 'di kho na shes pa ni lha rnams dga' ba yin gyi slob dpon rnams kyi 'dod pa ste /
translated: The gods delight in the mere knowledge of the transformation of the ten universal mental factors into the ten afflictions, by taking the mere letters as authoritative.

original: bsam pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the masters do not accept this.

original: lha rnams dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that the gods delight in?

original: kha cig na re drang po'i rang bzhin can ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te /🔽g-yon can ni lha rnams dga' ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re drang po'i rang bzhin can ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te / g-yon can ni lha rnams dga' ba ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The gods delight in the honest,🔽but not in the dishonest.

original: gzhan dag na re blun po ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re blun po ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
translated: Others say: The gods delight in fools,

original: gang zhig dbang phyug rnams dga' ba de ni gtams shing ma bslabs pa blun po yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dbang phyug rnams dga' ba de ni gtams shing ma bslabs pa blun po yin no //
translated: for one who delights the powerful is a fool, uncultured and untrained.

original: dper na gti mug med pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sa mang po pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag gi dge ba'i sa mang po pa kho na yin par ni nges par mi
analyzed: dper na gti mug med pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sa mang po pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag gi dge ba'i sa mang po pa kho na yin par ni nges par mi
translated: But it is not definitely ascertained to be a universal of virtue alone,🔽and therefore it is not included among the universals of virtue.

original: gzung ste / de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa de bzhin du brjed ngas pa la sogs pa lnga yang sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na dag yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par🔽mi gzung ste /
analyzed: gzung ste / de'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa de bzhin du brjed ngas pa la sogs pa lnga yang sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa kho na dag yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par mi gzung ste /
translated: Similarly, the five such as forgetfulness are universals because they are universal mental states, but it is not definitely ascertained that they are universals of affliction alone.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag gi nang du mi gdon to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag gi nang du mi gdon to //
translated: Therefore they are not included among the universals of affliction.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na brjed ngas  pa yin la ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa can kho na rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dran pa nyon mongs pa can kho na brjed ngas  pa yin la ting nge 'dzin nyon mongs pa can kho na rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Forgetfulness is afflicted mindfulness alone and distraction is afflicted concentration alone.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Such as these.

original: la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na shes bzhin ma yin pa yin la /🔽yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes rab nyon mongs pa can kho na shes bzhin ma yin pa yin la / yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can kho na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The words such as these indicate that only afflicted wisdom is non-introspection.🔽Only afflicted attention is improper attention.

original: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho na log par mos pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mos pa nyon mongs pa can kho na log par mos pa yin no zhes ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Only afflicted resolve is wrong resolve.🔽That is why it is said in full: Those that are universal are also the great grounds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sa mang po pa yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar dran pa la sogs pa brjed ngas pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa ste de dag la ma gtogs pa med pa de nyid
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang dag sa mang po pa yin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar dran pa la sogs pa brjed ngas pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag pa ste de dag la ma gtogs pa med pa de nyid
translated: Since mindfulness, etc., are established as forgetfulness, etc., and they are not excluded from those,

original: kyi phyir mu bzhi pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: kyi phyir mu bzhi pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: that is why the four possibilities occur.🔽Those that are universal are also the great grounds.

original: gang dag sa mang po pa yin pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin nam zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gyis kun du 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag sa mang po pa yin pa de dag nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin nam zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gyis kun du 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This is an indirect question.

original: mu bzhi ni sa chen po pa yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ma yin pa @119b dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: mu bzhi ni sa chen po pa yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa ma yin pa @119b dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are four possibilities: There are those that are great grounds but not great grounds of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yin la sa chen po pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yin la sa chen po pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those that are great grounds of affliction but not great grounds.

original: sa chen po pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yang yin pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sa chen po pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yang yin pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those that are great grounds and also great grounds of affliction.

original: sa chen po pa yang ma yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yang ma yin pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa chen po pa yang ma yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa chen po pa yang ma yin pa dag kyang yod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There are those that are neither great grounds nor great grounds of affliction.

original: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa la sogs pa lnga ji skad bshad pa gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni brjed ngas pa la sogs pa lnga ji skad bshad pa gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: The third is the five beginning with mindfulness, which are the five explained as forgetfulness and so on.

original: de dag ni sa mang po pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sa mang po pa yang yin la nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yang yin no //
translated: They are great grounds and also great grounds of affliction.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan te /
translated: The fourth is those not included in those types, which are other phenomena not included in the explanation.

original: dge ba'i sa mang po pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sa mang po pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The wholesome factors, the universal factors, etc., are mental factors. Form, etc., are not mental factors.🔽The four possibilities are not so.

original: de dag gi mu bzhi ba ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba mu gnyis par gzhag par bya'i mu gsum par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mu bzhi ba ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba mu gnyis par gzhag par bya'i mu gsum par ni ma yin no //
translated: Distraction is to be placed in the second possibility, not in the third.

original: des na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this should be stated:

original: mu dang po ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mu dang po ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The first possibility is as before.

original: gnyis pa ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang ma rig pa dang rgod pa dang bag med pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang ma rig pa dang rgod pa dang bag med pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The second is lack of faith, laziness, ignorance, excitement, non-conscientiousness, and distraction.

original: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs pa bzhi ste /🔽brjed ngas  pa dang shes bzhin ma yin pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par smos pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dran pa la sogs pa bzhi ste / brjed ngas  pa dang shes bzhin ma yin pa dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / log par smos pa'o //
translated: The third is the four beginning with mindfulness.

original: mu bzhi pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The fourth is as before.

original: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ste //
translated: Dullness does not occur here.

original: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan par 'dod pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
