translated: In order to respond to that, he says, because lethargy is asserted to be concomitant with all the root afflictions and all the branch afflictions.🔽Who is at fault for not including it among the afflictions?

original: de nyon mongs pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes zhes bya ba ni ci de las rmugs pa 'di ni mi 'byung ba kho bos nyes sam ci chos mngon pa pas nyes zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa dag gi nang du ma bton pa su zhig gis nyes zhes bya ba ni ci de las rmugs pa 'di ni mi 'byung ba kho bos nyes sam ci chos mngon pa pas nyes zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Is it the fault of the one who does not extract it, or is it the fault of the Abhidharma?

original: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ni chos mngon pa byed pa kho nas nyes pa yin gyi kho bos ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ni chos mngon pa byed pa kho nas nyes pa yin gyi kho bos ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because lethargy is asserted to be concomitant with all the root afflictions and all the branch afflictions, this is the fault of the author of the Abhidharma alone, it is not my fault.🔽This is said: although it should be extracted,

original: 'di skad du gdon par bya ba yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa rnams kyis bstan bcos de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gdon par bya ba yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa rnams kyis bstan bcos de las rmugs pa mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs smras pa yin no //
translated: the reason why lethargy is not extracted in that treatise is stated by the Abhidharma masters.

original: shin tu myur bar med par 'gyur gyi rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu myur bar med par 'gyur gyi rgod pa spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that this is the opinion of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: @120a * // grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni yid mi ches par ston pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ting nge 'dzin dkar po dang mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @120a * // grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni yid mi ches par ston pa yin no // ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ting nge 'dzin dkar po dang mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: The word “it is said” shows that this is not the opinion of the author of the treatise.🔽How can a defiled factor, namely, torpor, be favorable to samādhi?

original: zhum pa dang rgod pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lam gcod pa yin na de ji ltar lam gcod pa nyid mthun pa yin /
analyzed: zhum pa dang rgod pa dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyi lam gcod pa yin na de ji ltar lam gcod pa nyid mthun pa yin /
translated: How can it be favorable to the path, since torpor and restlessness both interrupt the path?🔽These two never abandon their common character of being defiled.

original: 'di dag ni nam du yang lhan cig spyod pa nyid 'dor bar mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang rgod pa 'di dag ni res 'ga' yang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos nyid mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nam du yang lhan cig spyod pa nyid 'dor bar mi 'gyur mod kyi zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang rgod pa 'di dag ni res 'ga' yang lhan cig spyod pa'i chos nyid mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Torpor and restlessness never abandon their common character of being defiled.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig gang la shas che ba zhes bya ba ni de lta yin mod kyi rmugs pa'am rgod pa gang zhig gang zag gang la shas che ba'i gang zag de ni de spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig gang la shas che ba zhes bya ba ni de lta yin mod kyi rmugs pa'am rgod pa gang zhig gang zag gang la shas che ba'i gang zag de ni de spyod pa ste /
translated: However, it is true that some are predominant for some.

original: rmugs pa spyod pa 'am rgod pa spyod pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa spyod pa 'am rgod pa spyod pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that the person for whom torpor or excitation is predominant is one who engages in torpor or one who engages in excitation.

original: tshogs la lar chos 'ga' zhig shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs la lar chos 'ga' zhig shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In some assemblies, some dharmas become predominant.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In others, they do not, referring to virtue and so on.🔽In nonvirtue, it is shamelessness and absence of abashment.

original: mi dge ba la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du bya ba'am mi dge ba kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du bya ba'am mi dge ba kho na la'o zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The word “or” indicates that shamelessness and absence of abashment are either distinguished or definitely ascertained as nonvirtuous alone.

original: nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams zhes bya ba la chung ngu ni chung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams zhes bya ba la chung ngu ni chung ba'o //
translated: The words “those on the level of the small afflictions” mean small is lesser.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /🔽ma rig pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na / ma rig pa tsam ste /
translated: What is that?🔽It is mere ignorance.

original: ma rig pa nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is only ignorance.

original: ma rig pa tsam de dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa tsam de dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ma yin pa'o //
translated: “That alone” means that ignorance alone is the root of anger, not other afflictions such as attachment.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spangs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang // zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spangs par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: “To be abandoned by the path of cultivation” means that they are not to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: yid kyi sa pa kho na dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa kho na dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dang ma yin pa ste /
translated: “Of the mental faculty alone” means that they are not of the five collections of consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag yid kyi sa pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir 'di kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khro ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag yid kyi sa pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir 'di kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pas nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Because these secondary afflictions such as anger are of the mental faculty alone, they are called “afflictions of the stage of minor defilement” because they are associated with that mental faculty alone.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs la ni gdon mi za bar ma rig pa yod par 'gyur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa chung ngu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshogs la ni gdon mi za bar ma rig pa yod par 'gyur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa chung ngu ma yin no //
translated: Because ignorance is found in the collection of attachment and so on, they are not minor defilements such as attachment.

original: de ltar na gang zag sems can thams cad la 'byung pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag sems can thams cad la 'byung pa de dag ni sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: Thus, those that occur in all sentient beings are called “universal mental factors.”

original: gang dag dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin @120b no //
analyzed: gang dag dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin @120b no //
translated: Those that occur only in the wholesome are called the great ground of wholesomeness.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa can bsgribs pa dang mi dge ba las 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa can bsgribs pa dang mi dge ba las 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: Those that occur in the afflicted and obscured and unwholesome are called the great ground of affliction.

original: gang dag mi dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mi dge ba kho na la 'byung ba de dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin no //
translated: Those that occur only in the unwholesome are called the great ground of unwholesomeness.

original: gang dag nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag nyon mongs pa chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la 'byung ba de dag ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that occur in the mind concomitant with the small affliction are called the small affliction ground.

original: 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gi nang nas ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas bstan pa las so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag gi nang nas ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas bstan pa las so //
translated: These will be explained among the secondary afflictions, in the chapter on the proclivities.

original: ma nges pa gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni gang dag res 'ga' ni sems dge ba la 'byung la /
analyzed: ma nges pa gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni gang dag res 'ga' ni sems dge ba la 'byung la /
translated: Others are indeterminate means those that sometimes occur in the wholesome mind,

original: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba la 'byung /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi dge ba la 'byung /
translated: sometimes in the unwholesome mind,🔽and sometimes in the neutral mind.

original: res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la 'byung ba'o //
translated: Sometimes they occur in indeterminate states.

original: gnyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dga' ba dang glal byed pa dang zas kyi drod mi zin pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ma nges pa🔽nyid yin par sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dga' ba dang glal byed pa dang zas kyi drod mi zin pa la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams ma nges pa nyid yin par sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: Sleepiness, etc. The term “etc.” includes the secondary passions of dejection, yawning, indigestion, etc., and the passions of attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig tu nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not definitely associated with any of the five modes of consciousness, nor are they definitely associated with any of the six consciousnesses.

original: sems can thams cad la med pa'i phyir sa mang po dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la med pa'i phyir sa mang po dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not universal mental activities, because they do not exist in all minds.

original: de dge ba la med pa'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dge ba la med pa'i phyir dge ba'i sa mang po dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not good mental activities, because they do not exist in all good minds.

original: de nyon mongs pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not mental activities that are found only in passions, because they do not exist in all passions.

original: khong khro ba dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags med la /
analyzed: khong khro ba dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags med la /
translated: A mind that is angry does not have attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang khong khro ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang khong khro ba med do //
translated: A mind that is attached does not have anger.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other defilements.

original: 'dir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here, Master Vasubandhu has composed a summary verse:

original: rtog dang dpyod dang 'gyod pa dang // gnyid dang khong khro chags pa dang // yid dang the tshom zhes bya ba //🔽brgyad ni nges pa min par bshad //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang 'gyod pa dang // gnyid dang khong khro chags pa dang // yid dang the tshom zhes bya ba // brgyad ni nges pa min par bshad //
translated: Reflection, investigation, regret, sleep, anger, attachment, doubt,

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: these eight are said to be indeterminate.

original: brgyad ma nges par bshad pa 'di ni rnar mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: brgyad ma nges par bshad pa 'di ni rnar mi 'ong ngo //
translated: This statement that eight are indeterminate is not acceptable.

original: lta ba dag kyang ci'i phyir ma nges pa yin par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: lta ba dag kyang ci'i phyir ma nges pa yin par mi 'dod de /
translated: Why is it not accepted that the views are also indeterminate?

original: log par lta ba ni khong khro ba dang bcas pa'am the tshom dang bcas pa'i sems la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni khong khro ba dang bcas pa'am the tshom dang bcas pa'i sems la mi 'byung ste /
translated: Wrong views do not occur in a mind that is angry or doubtful.

original: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan la'ang @121a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan la'ang @121a * //
translated: Nonvirtuous minds with views

original: nyi shu 'byung //
analyzed: nyi shu 'byung //
translated: have twenty.

original: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa ste ni nyi shu gcig //🔽ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa ste ni nyi shu gcig // ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The four afflictions, anger, etc., and regret are the twenty-one.

original: de lta bas gyi na zhig bshad pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de lta bas gyi na zhig bshad pa yin par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is just a brief explanation.🔽The desire realm has five types of minds.

original: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba gcig dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis te ma 'dres pa ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba ni dge ba gcig dang mi dge ba rnam pa gnyis te ma 'dres pa ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: One virtuous mind, two unvirtuous minds—unmixed with ignorance alone and mixed with other afflictions such as attachment,

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and two neutral minds—obscured neutral minds concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view and unobscured neutral minds such as those arisen from karmic maturation.

original: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan par byas pa'i don gyi chos de ni sems las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: ngan par byas pa'i ngo bo ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni ngan par byas pa'i don gyi chos de ni sems las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mi sbyar ro //
translated: This means that the object of regret is a phenomenon that is a mental factor.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ni 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ni 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, here the root text states, “a phenomenon that is the object of regret.”

original: rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: yid la gcags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, “remorse.”

original: gal te 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag kyang 'gyod pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gyod pa la dmigs pa'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag kyang 'gyod pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If regret is called remorse for a phenomenon that is the object of regret, then the other mental factors that are associated with regret would also be remorse.

original: de dag ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not the principal one.

original: yid la gcags pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'gyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems las byung ba ngan par byas pa'i rnam pa can shas che ba yin gyi sems las byung ba gzhan dag ni de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yid la gcags pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'gyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems las byung ba ngan par byas pa'i rnam pa can shas che ba yin gyi sems las byung ba gzhan dag ni de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yin te /
translated: In a state of remorse, the mental factor that has the characteristic of regret and the aspect of having done something badly is the principal one. The other mental factors are secondary and follow after it.

original: chos 'ga' kho na zhig tshogs pa la lar gtso bo yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos 'ga' kho na zhig tshogs pa la lar gtso bo yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: In some collections, a certain factor is the principal one.🔽The gate of liberation that has emptiness as its object is called emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la stong pa nyid ces bya ba zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams la nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu dang bral ba nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la
translated: The gate of liberation that has the aggregates as its object, which is the concentration that is distinguished by the absence of a personal self, is called emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par bam pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gyod pa la dmigs pa la 'gyod pa @121b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba dang / rnam par bsngos pa dang / rnam par bam pa la sogs pa mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i ma chags pa la mi sdug pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang sems las byung ba'i chos 'gyod pa la dmigs pa la 'gyod pa @121b zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the absence of attachment that has the repulsive, such as a bloated corpse, as its object is called the repulsive, so too here the absence of attachment that has regret as its object is called regret.

original: grong thams cad lhags so //
analyzed: grong thams cad lhags so //
translated: The entire village has come.🔽The entire country has come.

original: yul thams cad lhags so zhes gnas kyis gnas pa ston zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul thams cad lhags so zhes gnas kyis gnas pa ston zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way, the place indicates the person.

original: grong ni sa khyon lhas dang bcas pa sbyin yin te /
analyzed: grong ni sa khyon lhas dang bcas pa sbyin yin te /
translated: A village is a piece of land together with its inhabitants.

original: gnas pa mi rnams lhags na smra ba po grong thams cad lhags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa mi rnams lhags na smra ba po grong thams cad lhags so zhes zer ro //
translated: When people come to the place where the speaker is, they say, “The speaker has come to the village.”

original: de bzhin du yul thams cad lhags so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul thams cad lhags so zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, they say, “All the regions have come.”

original: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang yid la gcags pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yid la gcags pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Regret is also a basis for remorse, because it is the object of remorse.

original: de lta bas na de ltar bstan du rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar bstan du rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to teach it in this way.

original: yang 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu ni 'gyod pa yin la /🔽'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa yin no //🔽'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di ni 'bras bu la rgyu btags pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rgyu ni 'gyod pa yin la / 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa yin no // 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: This is a case of calling the result by the name of the cause, because regret is the cause and remorse is the result.🔽Remorse is called regret, because it is a result that is similar to its cause.🔽The term for the cause is figuratively used for the result.

original: rgyu rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni 'bras bu la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni 'bras bu la bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term for the cause is used for the result.

original: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin zhes bya ba ni dper na mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched dag ni sngon gyi las tshe rabs snga ma la byas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa las de dag la las nye
analyzed: dper na reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag ni sngon gyi las yin zhes bya ba ni dper na mig la sogs pa reg pa'i skye mched dag ni sngon gyi las tshe rabs snga ma la byas pa'i 'bras bu yin pa las de dag la las nye
translated: For example, “these six bases of contact are karma from the past” is like the six bases of contact such as the eye are the result of karma that was performed in previous lives.

original: bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bar 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Karma is imputed in relation to them.🔽But if it is not done, how can there be regret?

original: 'o na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa de ji ltar 'gyod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang ma byas pa de ni byas pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na gang ma byas pa la dmigs pa de ji ltar 'gyod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang ma byas pa de ni byas pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas rgol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: One might argue, thinking that if it is not done, it is not done.🔽But even if it is not done, it is called done.

original: ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba yod de zhes bya ba ni don ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba yod de zhes bya ba ni don ma byas pa la yang byas pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “done” is used even for an object that is not done.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ma legs pa byas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de ni byas pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ma legs pa byas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni de ni byas pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Whatever I have not done, that is badly done” is like that, because it is similar to what is done.

original: dge ba ma byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba ma byas nas gdung zhing yid la gcags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste de ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ma byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba ma byas nas gdung zhing yid la gcags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste de ni dge ba yin no //
translated: Regret is virtuous when it is distress over not having done virtue, such as generosity and so on.

original: mi dge ba byas nas zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba byas nas zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is it when one says, “Regret is nonvirtuous when one has done nonvirtue”?

original: gdung ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa de yang dge ba yin no //
analyzed: gdung ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa de yang dge ba yin no //
translated: The context is “distress.” Regret is also virtuous when one is distressed over having done nonvirtue, such as taking life and so on.🔽The opposite of that is nonvirtuous regret.

original: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba ma byas pa dang dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba ma byas pa dang dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous regret is distress over not having done nonvirtue and over having done virtue.

original: mi dge ba ma byas nas yid la gcags par 'gyur ba gang @122a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba ma byas nas yid la gcags par 'gyur ba gang @122a * //
translated: What is it when one says, “I regret not having done nonvirtue”?🔽What is it when one says, “I regret having done virtue”?🔽I have not done what I should not have done.

original: yin pa bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis ma legs par byas so snyam pa de yang 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: yin pa bdag gis ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni bdag gis ma legs par byas so snyam pa de yang 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin la /
translated: I have done what I should not have done.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba byas nas yid la gcags pa gang yin pa gang sbyin pa la sogs pa byas pa ni bdag gis ma legs par byas so snyam pa de yang 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba byas nas yid la gcags pa gang yin pa gang sbyin pa la sogs pa byas pa ni bdag gis ma legs par byas so snyam pa de yang 'gyod pa mi dge ba yin la /
translated: Regret is nonvirtuous when it is remorse for having done virtue such as generosity.

original: de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na 'gyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba de gnyi ga yang dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang gnyi ga la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis na 'gyod pa dge ba dang mi dge ba de gnyi ga yang dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyi ga la brten pa yin no //
translated: Both are dependent on both, because both virtuous and nonvirtuous regret are dependent on both virtue and nonvirtue, in the manner already explained.

original: ma 'dres zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa las logs shig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'dres zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa las logs shig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Unmixed means distinct from attachment and so on.

original: lta dang ldan la'ang zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi dge ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta dang ldan la'ang zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi dge ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also means that it is also nonvirtuous.

original: 'di ltar sa mang po pa kho na'i shes rab kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la lta ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog par byed pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lta ba yin la de yang 'dir mi dge ba yin par yongs su
analyzed: 'di ltar sa mang po pa kho na'i shes rab kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig la lta ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog par byed pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lta ba yin la de yang 'dir mi dge ba yin par yongs su
translated: That wisdom which is a decisive conception is a view, and that is held to be nonvirtuous here.

original: gzung ngo // de lta bas na log par lta ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzung ngo // de lta bas na log par lta ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “wrong view,” and so on.

original: 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / ces bya ba 'dir ni 'gyod pa dang yang zhes bya ba mi mngon par bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / ces bya ba 'dir ni 'gyod pa dang yang zhes bya ba mi mngon par bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the statement, “Regret and the twenty-one,” the word “and” should be supplied to indicate that regret is also included.

original: chos mngon pa rnams na re nyon mongs bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs par so sor tshig yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa rnams na re nyon mongs bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs par so sor tshig yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The Abhidharma masters say that the words of each of the four root afflictions and so on should be understood to be complete.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that attachment and so on are not mutually concomitant.

original: nyon mongs pa de dang ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu'o zhes bya ba ni sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa zhes bya ba nyi shu dang nyon mongs pa de ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dang ma 'dres par bshad pa nyi shu'o zhes bya ba ni sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa zhes bya ba nyi shu dang nyon mongs pa de ste /
translated: The twenty are the ten universal mental factors, the six root afflictions, the two nonvirtuous universal mental factors, and investigation and analysis.🔽The twenty-one are the twenty mental factors and one of the afflictions, such as attachment, anger, pride, or doubt.

original: 'dod chags sam khong khro ba'am nga rgyal lam the tshom gang yang rung ba zhig dang nyi shu rtsa gcig yin te nyi shu rtsa gcig yin pa kho na'o zhes yin par nges par 'dzin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags sam khong khro ba'am nga rgyal lam the tshom gang yang rung ba zhig dang nyi shu rtsa gcig yin te nyi shu rtsa gcig yin pa kho na'o zhes yin par nges par 'dzin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that there are only twenty-one.

original: khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
translated: Also in a mind concomitant with anger and so on, there are twenty-one.🔽Anger, enmity, dissimulation,

original: phrag dog tshig 'chab ser sna dang / sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni //
analyzed: phrag dog tshig 'chab ser sna dang / sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni //
translated: envy, concealment, avarice,

original: @122b zhes bya ba 'di dag dang ldan pa'i sems la yang snga ma bzhin du ma 'dres par bshad pa de dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de ste khro ba'am rnam par 'tshe ba'i bar las gang yang rung ba zhig dang sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @122b zhes bya ba 'di dag dang ldan pa'i sems la yang snga ma bzhin du ma 'dres par bshad pa de dag dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de ste khro ba'am rnam par 'tshe ba'i bar las gang yang rung ba zhig dang sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: When the mind is endowed with these, the twenty-one mental factors occur, as previously explained, and one of the secondary afflictions, from anger to malice.

original: 'gyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang sngar bshad pa rnams dang 'gyod pa de dang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang sngar bshad pa rnams dang 'gyod pa de dang nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ste /
translated: When the mind is associated with regret, the previously mentioned mental factors occur, plus regret itself, making twenty-one.

original: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa gcig rkya thub pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa gcig rkya thub pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Regret is also asserted to be a single independent affliction.

original: mdor na mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi dge ba'i sems ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi dge ba lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang nyi shu 'byung la mi dge ba
analyzed: mdor na mi dge ba'i sems ma 'dres pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi dge ba'i sems ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi dge ba lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa la yang nyi shu 'byung la mi dge ba
translated: In brief, twenty mental factors occur in a nonvirtuous mind that is not concomitant with ignorance, and twenty occur in a nonvirtuous mind concomitant with view.

original: nyid nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyid nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni nyi shu rtsa gcig 'byung ngo //
translated: When it is associated with other root or secondary afflictions, twenty-one mental factors occur.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa //
translated: Obscured-neutral

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas bsgribs la dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas bsgribs la dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: means obscured by affliction, but neutral in that it is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous.

original: ma bsgribs pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: Unobscured-neutral means unobscured and neutral.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas skabs dang / sprul pa pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas skabs dang / sprul pa pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the maturational birth, the demeanor, the skill in arts and crafts, and the emanation.🔽The Aparāntakas assert that regret is neutral.

original: nyi 'og pa dag ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod de zhes bya ba ni kha che'i yul las gzhan pa'i yul na 'khod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyi 'og pa'o //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa dag ni 'gyod pa lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod de zhes bya ba ni kha che'i yul las gzhan pa'i yul na 'khod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyi 'og pa'o //
translated: Those who live in lands other than Kashmir are called Aparāntakas.

original: bcu gsum 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kha cig la bcu gsum pa 'gyod pas lhag par bsnan pas so //
analyzed: bcu gsum 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kha cig la bcu gsum pa 'gyod pas lhag par bsnan pas so //
translated: The phrase “thirteen can occur” means that regret can increase to thirteen in some unobstructed indeterminate states.

original: gnyid ni rmi rmi'i gnas skabs sam rmi lam rmi ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni rmi rmi'i gnas skabs sam rmi lam rmi ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Sleep is when one is in a state of sleep or in a state of dreaming.🔽Because it is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mentioned in the treatises.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What does it say?🔽It says:

original: gnyid dge ba yin par brjod par bya ba'am /🔽mi dge ba yin par brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: gnyid dge ba yin par brjod par bya ba'am / mi dge ba yin par brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: Should sleep be called virtuous,🔽should it be called nonvirtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na /🔽dge ba yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin par brjod par bya zhe na / dge ba yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: or should it be called indeterminate?🔽It should be called virtuous.

original: mi dge ba yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be called nonvirtuous.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin par yang brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin par yang brjod par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It should be called indeterminate.

original: gang la nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang la sems las byung ba @123a * //
analyzed: gang la nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung ba de la ni nyi shu rtsa gsum mo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang la sems las byung ba @123a * //
translated: If twenty two mental factors occur, then twenty three occur.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar bshad pa der ni gnyid de nyi shu rtsa gsum pa yin te nyi shu rtsa gsum du kha skong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar bshad pa der ni gnyid de nyi shu rtsa gsum pa yin te nyi shu rtsa gsum du kha skong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If twenty two mental factors are explained to occur, then sleep is the twenty third.

original: gang la nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ba ni //🔽la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
analyzed: gang la nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ba ni // la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
translated: If twenty three mental factors occur,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: then regret is added in some cases.🔽If twenty three mental factors are explained to occur, then sleep is the twenty fourth.🔽If twelve mental factors occur,

original: de la ni gnyid de nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du /🔽lung ma bstan /🔽gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: de la ni gnyid de nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa yin no // de bzhin du / lung ma bstan / gzhan la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
translated: then sleep is the thirteenth.

original: ces bya ba 'dir ni gnyid bcu gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dir ni gnyid bcu gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod par bya ste /
translated: If twelve mental factors are explained to occur, then sleep is the thirteenth.

original: nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs ltar 'gyod pas bsnan na ni gnyid bcu bzhi pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs ltar 'gyod pas bsnan na ni gnyid bcu bzhi pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If regret is added according to the tradition of the Aparāntakas, then sleep is the fourteenth.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni ji skad bshad pa las zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba lhan cig nges par 'byung ba ji skad brjod pa de las so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni ji skad bshad pa las zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba lhan cig nges par 'byung ba ji skad brjod pa de las so //
translated: In the first absorption, there is no regret and no sleep, as previously explained.

original: 'gyod pa dang gnyid rnam pa thams cad du med ces bya ba ni dge ba yang med la lung du ma bstan pa yang med na mi dge ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang gnyid rnam pa thams cad du med ces bya ba ni dge ba yang med la lung du ma bstan pa yang med na mi dge ba lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: Regret and sleep do not exist in any way, that is, they are neither virtuous nor neutral, let alone nonvirtuous.

original: 'gyod pa dang gnyid ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang gnyid ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Regret and sleep do not exist in any way.

original: g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for deceit, pretense and arrogance.

original: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po ni //
analyzed: 'dod dang bsam gtan dang po ni //
translated: Desire realm and first absorption

original: g-yo sgyu tshangs pa 'drid phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu tshangs pa 'drid phyir ro //
translated: deceit and pretense, because they deceive Brahma.

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
translated: Lethargy, excitation and arrogance exist in the three realms.

original: zhes 'byung bas de dag ma gtogs te de na da dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas de dag ma gtogs te de na da dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since this is stated, they do not exist there because they exist there.

original: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'brel lo zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems la ni nyi shu 'byung ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'brel lo zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems la ni nyi shu 'byung ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In a wholesome thought of the realm of immateriality, there are twenty mental factors, as in the first pure thought.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma 'dres pa dang lta ba dang ldan pa la yang bco brgyad 'byung ste 'dod pa'i khams bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma 'dres pa dang lta ba dang ldan pa la yang bco brgyad 'byung ste 'dod pa'i khams bzhin no //
translated: In a defiled thought of the realm of desire, there are eighteen mental factors, as in the realm of desire.🔽In a defiled thought of the realm of fine-materiality, there are nineteen mental factors, as in the realm of desire, plus one wholesome faculty.🔽In a defiled thought of the realm of immateriality, there are eighteen mental factors, as in the realm of desire.🔽In a non-defined thought of the realm of desire, there are twelve mental factors, namely: the ten generally permeating factors, plus contact and mental volition.

original: gzhan nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni bcu dgu 'byung ste /🔽de la ni de dag nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bcu dgu 'byung ngo //🔽ma bsgribs la lung du bstan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam dang sprul pa la ni bcu gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa g-yo dang sgyu dang rgyags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la ni bcu dgu 'byung ste / de la ni de dag nyon mongs pa'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bcu dgu 'byung ngo // ma bsgribs la lung du bstan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam dang sprul pa la ni bcu gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: In a non-defined thought of the realm of fine-materiality, there are thirteen mental factors, as above, plus one wholesome faculty.🔽In a non-defined thought of the realm of immateriality, there are twelve mental factors, as in the realm of desire.🔽In a thought of the realm of desire associated with initial inquiry and investigation, there are twenty mental factors, as in the first pure thought.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In a thought of the realm of desire associated with investigation but not with initial inquiry, there are nineteen mental factors, as in the first pure thought, minus initial inquiry.🔽In a thought of the realm of desire associated with neither initial inquiry nor investigation, there are eighteen mental factors, as in the realm of desire.

original: rtog pa'am bsam gtan khyad par can //
analyzed: rtog pa'am bsam gtan khyad par can //
translated: In a thought of the realm of fine-materiality associated with initial inquiry and investigation, there are twenty-one mental factors, as in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽In a thought of the realm of fine-materiality associated with investigation but not with initial inquiry, there are twenty mental factors, as in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽In a thought of the realm of fine-materiality associated with neither initial inquiry nor investigation, there are twenty mental factors, as in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang mi dge ba rnams kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang mi dge ba rnams kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word also in the verse refers to regret, sleep and nonvirtue.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What does it refer to?

original: med do zhes bya @123b bar skabs dang sbyar ro //🔽rtog pa med kyi lhag ma dang ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bya @123b bar skabs dang sbyar ro // rtog pa med kyi lhag ma dang ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It refers to the phrase they do not exist.🔽They do not exist in the formless realm, but the remaining afflictions are like those in the form realm.

original: ji skad bkag pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang mi dge ba dang rtog pa dag med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dpyod pa dang yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni g-yo dang sgyu yang med do zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba las /
analyzed: ji skad bkag pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa dang gnyid dang mi dge ba dang rtog pa dag med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dpyod pa dang yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni g-yo dang sgyu yang med do zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba las /
translated: The phrase they do not exist refers to regret, sleep, nonvirtue and investigation.🔽The word also in the verse refers to guile and deceit.🔽The word also should be stated in the verse, but it is not stated.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra lhag mas ni don lhag pa yin te don gzhan de na g-yo dang sgyu yang med do zhes bya ba 'di yang yin par 'gyur ro /🔽// / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra lhag mas ni don lhag pa yin te don gzhan de na g-yo dang sgyu yang med do zhes bya ba 'di yang yin par 'gyur ro / // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: The word also in the commentary refers to the additional meaning of guile and deceit.

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
translated: Lethargy, excitation and arrogance exist in the three realms.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i shugs kyis na rgyags pa ni ma gtogs pa la ma yin no //🔽lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ma gtogs pa nyi shu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i shugs kyis na rgyags pa ni ma gtogs pa la ma yin no // lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ma gtogs pa nyi shu 'byung ngo //
translated: The force of this passage indicates that arrogance does not occur in those free of attachment.🔽The remaining are the same as those just explained.

original: ma 'dres pa dang lta pa dang ldan pa la yang bcu drug 'byung ngo //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyags pa dang ldan pa la yang /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa dang lta pa dang ldan pa la yang bcu drug 'byung ngo // 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyags pa dang ldan pa la yang /
translated: Twenty mental factors occur in those possessing view, excluding investigation and analysis.🔽Sixteen mental factors occur in those possessing attachment and so on, excluding anger and so on.

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa de'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bcu bdun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa de'am nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bcu bdun 'byung ngo //
translated: Seventeen mental factors occur in those possessing the branch afflictions, such as arrogance and so on, because ten universal mental states, six root and branch afflictions, and that affliction or branch affliction itself occur.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las sa mang po bcu kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las sa mang po bcu kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya bar brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: It should be calculated that ten universal mental states alone occur in those possessing unobscured neutral states.

original: tshangs pa'i bar du sgyu yod par 'byung gi zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni g-yo yang sgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de na yod par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bar du sgyu yod par 'byung gi zhes bya bar rgyas par 'byung ba ni g-yo yang sgyu sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de na yod par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Since deceit is preceded by deception, it is included in the realm of desire.🔽“There is none above, because there is no retinue.”

original: 'khor dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'khor yod pa de dag la 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir g-yo dang sgyu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor dang 'brel ba ma yin pa'i phyir gong na ni med do zhes bya ba ni gang dag la 'khor yod pa de dag la 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir g-yo dang sgyu 'byung ngo //
translated: Deception and pretense occur where there is a retinue, because the retinue is included in the retinue of the Buddha.

original: 'khor ni brgyad du 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor ni brgyad du 'byung ste /
translated: The retinue is eightfold:

original: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor dang / bram ze'i 'khor dang / khyim bdag gi 'khor dang / dge slong gi 'khor dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi 'khor dang / sum cu rtsa gsus pa'i 'khor dang / bdud kyi 'khor dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor dang / bram ze'i 'khor dang / khyim bdag gi 'khor dang / dge slong gi 'khor dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi 'khor dang / sum cu rtsa gsus pa'i 'khor dang / bdud kyi 'khor dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor ro //
translated: the retinue of the warrior class, the retinue of the priest class, the retinue of the householder, the retinue of monks, the retinue of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the retinue of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the retinue of Māra, and the retinue of Brahmā.

original: 'di'i gong na ni de dag las 'ga' yang med pas g-yo ngang sgyu med do //
analyzed: 'di'i gong na ni de dag las 'ga' yang med pas g-yo ngang sgyu med do //
translated: Since there is none above that, there is no deceit or pretense.

original: tshangs pa la ni 'khor yod de /
analyzed: tshangs pa la ni 'khor yod de /
translated: Brahmā has a retinue.

original: de lta bas na bshad pa de ni rang gi 'khor gyi nang du 'dug pa la dge slong rta thul tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du son pas 'byung ba chen po 'di dag ma lus par @124a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na bshad pa de ni rang gi 'khor gyi nang du 'dug pa la dge slong rta thul tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du son pas 'byung ba chen po 'di dag ma lus par @124a * //
translated: Thus, when he was seated in the midst of his retinue, the bhikṣu Aśvajit, who had attained the world of Brahmā, asked, “Where do these four great elements cease without remainder?”

original: gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / mi shes shing 'byung ba chen po bzhi gzugs med pa'i khams su ma lus par 'gag go zhes bya bar khong du ma chud pas gtam rlung bskur ba'i gtam gyi skabs byas so //
analyzed: gang du 'gag par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang / mi shes shing 'byung ba chen po bzhi gzugs med pa'i khams su ma lus par 'gag go zhes bya bar khong du ma chud pas gtam rlung bskur ba'i gtam gyi skabs byas so //
translated: Since he did not know, he did not understand that the four great elements cease without remainder in the formless realm. He was at a loss for words and so he said, “I am Brahmā.”

original: kho bo ni tshangs pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la tshangs pa'o zhes smras nas tshangs pa chen po'o zhes smras pa ni tshangs pa gzhan dag pas bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo ni tshangs pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la tshangs pa'o zhes smras nas tshangs pa chen po'o zhes smras pa ni tshangs pa gzhan dag pas bdag nyid khyad par du 'phags par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having said, “I am Brahmā,” he said, “I am the Great Brahmā,” in order to demonstrate that he is superior to other Brahmas.

original: dbang phyug ni dbang byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //🔽byed pa po'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni dbang byed pa'i ngang tshul can no // byed pa po'o //
translated: He is the lord because he has the nature of being the lord.🔽He is the maker.

original: sprul pa po'o //
analyzed: sprul pa po'o //
translated: He is the creator.

original: 'byin pa po'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs sam phyi ma phyi mas rnam par bshad pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'byin pa po'o zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs sam phyi ma phyi mas rnam par bshad pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is the method of explanation by way of synonyms or later terms.

original: pha dang 'dra ba ni pha lta bu'o //
analyzed: pha dang 'dra ba ni pha lta bu'o //
translated: Like a father is a father-like one.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: dngos po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of things.🔽It has already been explained is the extensive explanation.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa de dang sems de dang sems las byung ba de snyed pa de ni bshad zin pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sa de dang sems de dang sems las byung ba de snyed pa de ni bshad zin pa yin no //
translated: That is the extent of the level, the mind, and the mental factors that have already been explained.

original: gzhung las sems las byung ba kha cig ni tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung las sems las byung ba kha cig ni tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Some mental factors are mentioned separately in the treatise.

original: kha cig ni de las 'byung ba zhes 'don te /
analyzed: kha cig ni de las 'byung ba zhes 'don te /
translated: Some are mentioned in that.

original: don ni de kho nar zad do //
analyzed: don ni de kho nar zad do //
translated: The meaning is just that.

original: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dang ldan pas rang dang gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dang / gang zag yon tan can cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dag la gus par mi byed pa de ni ma gus pa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dang ldan pas rang dang gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa dang / gang zag yon tan can cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dag la gus par mi byed pa de ni ma gus pa nyid do //
translated: Respect is the absence of disrespect. The absence of respect is the absence of respect for those who possess good qualities and for those who possess persons who possess good qualities, such as loving kindness and compassion, and for persons who possess good qualities, such as being endowed with proper conduct and proper behavior.

original: 'di la gus pa med pa yod pas na ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gus pa med pa yod pas na ma gus pa'o //
translated: It is called absence of respect because it is the absence of respect in this case.

original: de'i ngo bo ni ma gus pa nyid de sems las byung ba'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni ma gus pa nyid de sems las byung ba'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The nature of that is absence of respect, which is a specific mental factor.

original: de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rnam grangs bkur ba med pa nyid dang 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam grangs bkur ba med pa nyid dang 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The synonyms are lack of veneration and lack of control through fear.

original: slob ma la dbang byed pas na bkur ba ste /
analyzed: slob ma la dbang byed pas na bkur ba ste /
translated: Veneration is the control of a disciple.

original: bla ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bla ma lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like a guru.

original: 'di la bkur sti med pa yod pas na bkur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bkur sti med pa yod pas na bkur ba med pa'o //
translated: It is called lack of veneration because it is the absence of veneration in this case.

original: de'i ngo bo ni bkur ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni bkur ba med pa nyid de /
translated: The nature of that is lack of veneration, which is a specific mental factor.

original: ngo bo brjod pas ni sems las byung ba yin pas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo brjod pas ni sems las byung ba yin pas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is a mental factor, it is to be apprehended.

original: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin no //🔽'di la 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos yin no // 'di la 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba'o //
translated: Fear is a mental factor.🔽It is the state of being controlled by fear.

original: 'jigs pas @124b dbang sgyur ba med pa ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pas @124b dbang sgyur ba med pa ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba'o //
translated: The absence of being controlled by fear is the absence of being controlled by fear.

original: de'i ngo bo ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni 'jigs pas dbang mi sgyur ba nyid de /
translated: Its nature is the absence of being controlled by fear.

original: de kho na ngo tsha med pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ngo tsha med pa yin no //
translated: That is shamelessness.

original: 'di la ngo tsha med pa yod pas na ngo tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la ngo tsha med pa yod pas na ngo tsha med pa'o //
translated: It is shamelessness because it exists in the absence of shame.

original: de'i ngo bo ni ngo tsha med pa nyid de gus pa dang bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i chos yin gyi de med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni ngo tsha med pa nyid de gus pa dang bcas pa'i mi mthun pa'i chos yin gyi de med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Its nature is shamelessness. It is a quality that is contrary to respect, but it is not merely the absence of that.

original: khrel med kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: khrel med kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: Shamelessness is the absence of fear of wrongdoing.

original: zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni brjod du mi rung ba ste de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba ni brjod du mi rung ba ste de'i phyir kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The term “blameworthy” means “reprehensible,” and thus the root text states, “because it is despised by the holy ones.”

original: de la 'jigs par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi lta ba ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi lta ba ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The root text states, “The absence of dread toward that is lack of shame.” This means that it is the failure to view blameworthiness as having undesirable consequences.

original: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi zad par byed pa yin par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi zad par byed pa yin par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The root text states, “Because it is the source of dread.” This establishes that the term “dread” is a synonym for “undesirable consequence.”

original: de lta bas na 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi lta ba ni zhes bya pa'i 'bras bu la bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can du mi lta ba ni zhes bya pa'i 'bras bu la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “the failure to view blameworthiness as having undesirable consequences” should be understood as referring to the failure to view blameworthiness as having undesirable consequences that are to be dreaded.

original: 'jigs pa med par lta ba 'jigs par mi lta ba yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te re zhig 'di skad du 'jigs pa yin la 'di la mi 'jigs par lta ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs par mi lta'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par lta ba 'jigs par mi lta ba yin nam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te re zhig 'di skad du 'jigs pa yin la 'di la mi 'jigs par lta ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs par mi lta'o //
translated: If it is said that it is the view that is not the view of fear because it is the nature of the view that is fear,

original: de'i ngo bo ni mi 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya bar bshad na ni shes rab yin par shes par 'gyur te shes rab kyis ni mi 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni mi 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya bar bshad na ni shes rab yin par shes par 'gyur te shes rab kyis ni mi 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: then it is understood to be wisdom, because wisdom views without fear.

original: 'on te 'di skad du 'di la 'jigs par lta ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad du 'di la 'jigs par lta ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na 'jigs par lta ba'o //
translated: But if it is said that it is the view that is not the view of fear because it is the nature of the view that is fear,

original: 'jigs par mi lta bas na mi 'jigs par lta'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi lta bas na mi 'jigs par lta'o //
translated: then it is the view that is not the view of fear because it views without fear.

original: de'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The nature of that is the view that is not the view of fear.

original: yang na 'jigs par lta ba'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na 'jigs par lta ba'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par lta ba nyid do //
translated: Or, the nature of the view that is fear is the view that is fear.

original: 'jigs par mi lta ba'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya bar bshad na ni ma rig pa yin par shes par 'gyur te ma rig pa dang ldan pas 'jigs par lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi lta ba'i ngo bo ni 'jigs par mi lta ba nyid do zhes bya bar bshad na ni ma rig pa yin par shes par 'gyur te ma rig pa dang ldan pas 'jigs par lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is explained that the essence of not viewing fear is not viewing fear, then it would be understood as ignorance, because one who possesses ignorance does not view fear.

original: lta ba yang lta ba nyid ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni shes rab kyang ma yin la ma rig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba yang lta ba nyid ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni shes rab kyang ma yin la ma rig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: View is not view itself, and so on, means that wisdom is not view and ignorance is not view.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: shes rab dang ma rig pa de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jigs par mi lta ba yin no //🔽de ni khrel @125a * //🔽med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis khrel yod par byed pas na khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ma rig pa de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jigs par mi lta ba yin no // de ni khrel @125a * // med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dis khrel yod par byed pas na khrel yod pa'o //
translated: The proximate factor of instability that is the sign of both wisdom and ignorance is not viewing fear.🔽That is called shamelessness.🔽Shamelessness is that by which one is not ashamed.

original: khrel yod pa ma yin pa ni khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa ma yin pa ni khrel med pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of shame.

original: yang gzhan dag ngo tsha shes pa yang 'dzem pa yin la khrel yod pa yang 'dzem pa yin pas skad kyi byings don gcig pa 'di dag ji ltar don tha dad par rjod par byed pa nyid yin snyam nas ma rangs te bdag la ltos nas zhes bya
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ngo tsha shes pa yang 'dzem pa yin la khrel yod pa yang 'dzem pa yin pas skad kyi byings don gcig pa 'di dag ji ltar don tha dad par rjod par byed pa nyid yin snyam nas ma rangs te bdag la ltos nas zhes bya
translated: Still others are displeased, thinking, “Shame is also avoidance and conscience is also avoidance. Since these verbal roots have the same meaning, how can they be said to have different meanings?”

original: ba rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: ba rgyas par smras so //
translated: They say, “Shame is avoidance in relation to oneself” and so on.🔽Still, how could two simultaneous relations be established?

original: de lta na yang ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni klan ka pas phyogs 'di la yang cig car ltos pa gnyis mi srid do zhes bya bar mthong nas smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni klan ka pas phyogs 'di la yang cig car ltos pa gnyis mi srid do zhes bya bar mthong nas smras pa yin no //
translated: This is said by the opponent, who sees that even in this position, two simultaneous relations are impossible.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs 'di yang skyon chags pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phyogs 'di yang skyon chags pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: The word “still” in the phrase “still, how could” is stated because this position is also flawed.

original: sems gcig la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: sems gcig la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas ltos pa gnyis cig car ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed do //
translated: The response is, “How could two things that are mutually exclusive occur simultaneously?”🔽The text continues, “We do not say that shamelessness and lack of integrity occur simultaneously in relation to self and others.”

original: bdag dang gzhan la ltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag rnam grangs kyis 'byung ngo zhes ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la ltos pa cig car ro zhes ni mi zer ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'di dag rnam grangs kyis 'byung ngo zhes ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This passage indicates that these two occur in different ways.

original: kha cig la ni bdag la ltos nas kyang nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa 'byung la kha cig la ni gzhan la ltos nas 'byung ngo //🔽bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la re zhig rtog pa dang po /
analyzed: kha cig la ni bdag la ltos nas kyang nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa 'byung la kha cig la ni gzhan la ltos nas 'byung ngo // bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la re zhig rtog pa dang po /
translated: Some people are ashamed of their misdeeds in relation to themselves, while others are ashamed in relation to others.🔽The opposite of shamelessness and lack of integrity is shame and integrity.

original: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
translated: The first theory is that disrespect is shamelessness and lack of integrity.

original: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: The second theory is that shamelessness and lack of integrity are fear of the consequences of misdeeds.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ltar na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ltar na'o //
translated: The third theory is that shamelessness and lack of integrity are the opposite of shame and integrity.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la kha na ma tho ba dag la 'jigs par lta ba nyid ni khrel yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jigs par lta ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni khrel yod pa yin no zhes

translated: Shame is the very fear of wrongdoing.
