translated: Shamelessness is the opposite of shame.🔽Shamelessness is the opposite of shame

original: kha cig dga' ba dang gus pa @125b dag gcig pa nyid du sems te de lta bas na de dag gi tha dad du bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dga' dad ces bya ba mos te /
analyzed: kha cig dga' ba dang gus pa @125b dag gcig pa nyid du sems te de lta bas na de dag gi tha dad du bya ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dga' dad ces bya ba mos te /
translated: Some think that joy and faith are the same. Therefore, in order to demonstrate their difference, he says: “joy and faith are different.”

original: dga' ba kho na dad pa yin gyi gus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba kho na dad pa yin gyi gus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Joy is not faith, but respect is.

original: dga' ba dang dad pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba dang dad pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: Joy is not faith alone,

original: de'i phyir dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: therefore he says: “joy is of two kinds: afflicted and unafflicted.”

original: dad pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: There is faith that is not joy. This is the fourth alternative.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la ni mngon par yid ches pa'i ngo bo dad pa kho na yin gyi dga' ba ni ma yin te dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la ni mngon par yid ches pa'i ngo bo dad pa kho na yin gyi dga' ba ni ma yin te dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faith is only the nature of clear belief in the truths of suffering and origin, but it is not joy, because they are not delightful.

original: dga' ba yin la dad pa ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i ngo bo'i sred pa yin gyi mngon par yid ches pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin pas dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba yin la dad pa ma yin pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i ngo bo'i sred pa yin gyi mngon par yid ches pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin pas dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is craving that has the nature of joy, but it is not faith because it does not have the nature of clear belief.

original: gnyi ga yin pa ni dad pa yang yin la dga' ba yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa ni dad pa yang yin la dga' ba yang yin pa ste /
translated: Both is the four joys and the four faiths.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag mngon par yid ches par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag mngon par yid ches par bya ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are both joy and faith because they have the nature of clear belief and joy in the truths of cessation and path.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba gzhan dag dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: Neither is the four joys and the four faiths that are excluded from those.

original: de ltar chos la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang dad pa'i mu bzhi pa sbyar nas gang zag la dmigs pa'i mu bzhi pa sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar chos la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang dad pa'i mu bzhi pa sbyar nas gang zag la dmigs pa'i mu bzhi pa sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having applied the four possibilities of joy and faith that focus on phenomena, in order to apply the four possibilities of joy and faith that focus on persons, it says:🔽Joy in a person is faith.

original: gang zag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gang zag la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: He says:🔽Those who are called companions and disciples are those who live together and those who are close to the guru.

original: de la lhan cig gnas pas na lhan cig gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la lhan cig gnas pas na lhan cig gnas pa dag ste /
translated: Those who live together are companions because they live together.

original: rab tu byung ba'i slob ma gang dag yin pa'o //🔽bla ma dang nye bar gnas pas nye gnas dag ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i slob ma gang dag yin pa'o // bla ma dang nye bar gnas pas nye gnas dag ste /
translated: They are the guru’s disciples who are renunciates.🔽Those who are close are disciples who are near because they are close to the guru.

original: gnas 'char ba dang 'don pas 'brel ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'char ba dang 'don pas 'brel ba dag yin no //
translated: They are connected through the guru’s teachings and recitations.

original: bu la sogs pa de dag la ni dga' ba kho na yin gyi gus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa de dag la ni dga' ba kho na yin gyi gus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are only affectionate toward their sons and so on, but they are not respectful.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: They are either afflicted or unafflicted, as is appropriate.

original: gus pa ni dga' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gus pa ni dga' ba ma yin te /
translated: Respect is not affection.

original: gus nyid ngo tsha shes zhes bya ba mtshan nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gus nyid ngo tsha shes zhes bya ba mtshan nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: The definition of respect is shame.

original: gus pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa ni gus par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa yin la dga' ba ma yin pa ni gus par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Respect is not affection because it is the basis of respect.

original: gnyi ga yin pa ni dga' ba dang gus pa ste de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa ni dga' ba dang gus pa ste de gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both is affection and respect, which is to say, they have the nature of both.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa @126a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa @126a * //
translated: Neither is

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye bo gzhan 'brel pa med cing yon tan med pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni skye bo gzhan 'brel pa med cing yon tan med pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Except for those aspects means except for those who are unrelated to others and who have no good qualities.

original: de la ni dga' ba dang gus pa med do //
analyzed: de la ni dga' ba dang gus pa med do //
translated: There is no joy or respect for them.🔽The master says that joy is the joy that precedes confidence in good qualities.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ni dga' ba yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon na re yon tan la yid ches pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ste de ni dga' ba yin te de lta bas na dad pa nyid dga' ba ma yin no zhes
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ni dga' ba yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon na re yon tan la yid ches pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dga' ba ste de ni dga' ba yin te de lta bas na dad pa nyid dga' ba ma yin no zhes
translated: That is joy. Therefore, faith is not joy.

original: zer ro // gus nyid ngo tsha shes zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zer ro // gus nyid ngo tsha shes zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa ste /
translated: Respect is shame. Shame is as previously explained.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: It is having respect.

original: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid dang 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bshad pa'i ngo tsha shes pa gang yin pa de ni gus pa yin no //
analyzed: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid dang 'jigs pas dbang sgyur ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bshad pa'i ngo tsha shes pa gang yin pa de ni gus pa yin no //
translated: It is having honor, having control through fear, and having shame.

original: de ltar na dga' ba ni dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni yin la gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes de dag gi tha dad du bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dga' ba ni dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni yin la gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes de dag gi tha dad du bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, joy is the characteristic of faith, and respect is the characteristic of conscience. This explains the difference between them.

original: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa yang de bzhin du chos dag dang gang zag dag la ngo tsha shes pa yin no //
analyzed: bkur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha shes pa yang de bzhin du chos dag dang gang zag dag la ngo tsha shes pa yin no //
translated: The same applies to being respected. Conscience is also like this, in that it is conscience with regard to the teachings and with regard to persons.

original: gang dag gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa de dag de na med do zhes bya ba ni gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa gang dag gcig nyid yin par sems pa dag gi dbang du byas pa yin
analyzed: gang dag gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa de dag de na med do zhes bya ba ni gang zag la dmigs pa'i dad pa dang ngo tsha shes pa gang dag gcig nyid yin par sems pa dag gi dbang du byas pa yin
translated: Faith and conscience that focus on persons do not exist there. This refers to those who think that faith and conscience that focus on persons are the same.

original: te / de dag kho na gzugs med pa'i khams na med la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na yod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: te / de dag kho na gzugs med pa'i khams na med la 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na yod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that only those that focus on the teachings exist in the formless realm, while those that focus on persons exist in the desire and form realms.

original: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid de dag dang ldan pas rtsing ba yang yin la zhib pa yang yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhes bya ba ni sems de nyid de dag dang ldan pas rtsing ba yang yin la zhib pa yang yin par mi rung ste /
translated: How can those two be concomitant in a single mind?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for that mind itself to be both coarse and subtle, because that is contradictory.

original: bor ba zhes bya ba ni ba sgyur te bor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ha cang mi 'khyag pa ni te bor sra bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bor ba zhes bya ba ni ba sgyur te bor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ha cang mi 'khyag pa ni te bor sra bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The term “discarded” is a past passive participle, meaning “discarded.”🔽Not too cold means not discarded and hard.

original: ha cang mi 'ju ba ni te bor rkyang rkyang por mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang mi 'ju ba ni te bor rkyang rkyang por mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not too hot means not discarded and soft.

original: ha cang zhib par yang mi 'gyur ba la ha cang rtsing bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bar mar gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ha cang zhib par yang mi 'gyur ba la ha cang rtsing bar yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bar mar gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not too subtle and not too coarse means remaining in the middle.🔽If that is so, then since they are the reasons for that,

original: de lta na 'o na ni rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar chu dang nyi ma dag mar sar 'khyag pa dang 'ju ba dag gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin gyi de dag gi ngo bo nyid de
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar chu dang nyi ma dag mar sar 'khyag pa dang 'ju ba dag gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin gyi de dag gi ngo bo nyid de
translated: just as water and sunlight are the reasons for the melting and freezing of butter, they are not the essence of that.

original: 'khyag pa nyid dang 'ju ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dag ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib @126b pa nyid dag gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin gyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kyi🔽ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khyag pa nyid dang 'ju ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dag ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib @126b pa nyid dag gi rgyu mtshan du gyur pa yin gyi rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, investigation and analysis are the reasons for the coarseness and subtlety of mind, but they are not the essence of coarseness and subtlety.

original: des na 'di skad du sems rtsing ba nyid kyi rgyu ni rtog pa yin la sems zhib pa nyid kyi rgyu ni dpyod pa yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du sems rtsing ba nyid kyi rgyu ni rtog pa yin la sems zhib pa nyid kyi rgyu ni dpyod pa yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it must be said that the cause of a coarse mind is investigation and the cause of a subtle mind is analysis.

original: khyod khas len pas 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes zer na de'i phyir nyes pa gzhan rtsing ba dang zhib pa ni ltos pa can yang yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: khyod khas len pas 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes zer na de'i phyir nyes pa gzhan rtsing ba dang zhib pa ni ltos pa can yang yin pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: If you say, “This is not a fault because it is accepted by us,” then another fault is that coarseness and subtlety are also dependent.

original: sa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni sa'i bye brag dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis te re zhig sa'i bye brag gis ni bsam gtan dang po la ltos na 'dod pa'i khams mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i🔽phyir rtsing ba yin la /🔽'dod pa'i khams la ltos na bsam gtan dang po mngon par 'du bya ba chung ngus bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhib pa yin te rab tu zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni sa'i bye brag dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis te re zhig sa'i bye brag gis ni bsam gtan dang po la ltos na 'dod pa'i khams mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rtsing ba yin la / 'dod pa'i khams la ltos na bsam gtan dang po mngon par 'du bya ba chung ngus bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhib pa yin te rab tu zhib pa yin no //
translated: In terms of the distinction of level, the desire realm is coarse in comparison to the first meditative absorption because it is accomplished through great effort.🔽In comparison to the desire realm, the first meditative absorption is subtle because it is accomplished through little effort.

original: yang de nyid bsam gtan gnyis pa la ltos na rtsing ba yin te srid pa'i rtse mo phra ba yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang de nyid bsam gtan gnyis pa la ltos na rtsing ba yin te srid pa'i rtse mo phra ba yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In comparison to the second meditative absorption, the first meditative absorption is coarse, and so on up to the peak of cyclic existence, which is the most subtle.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag gis kyang sa de nyid na rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag ltos pa can yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag gis kyang sa de nyid na rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag ltos pa can yin te /
translated: In terms of the distinction of type, even within a single level, coarseness and subtlety are relative.

original: dper na 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi nyon mongs pa rnams sam yon tan rnams kyi rnam pa'i gzhi gsum po de dag ste /
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi nyon mongs pa rnams sam yon tan rnams kyi rnam pa'i gzhi gsum po de dag ste /
translated: For example, the three bases of the aspects of affliction or qualities from the desire realm to the summit of existence are small, medium and great.

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gang dag yin pa de dag las nyon mongs pa chen po rtsing ba yin zhing chung ngu ni zhib pa yin la nyon mongs pa las bzlog pa ni yon tan dag yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po gang dag yin pa de dag las nyon mongs pa chen po rtsing ba yin zhing chung ngu ni zhib pa yin la nyon mongs pa las bzlog pa ni yon tan dag yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, great affliction is coarse and small affliction is subtle. Qualities are the opposite of affliction.

original: de ltar na rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis ltos pa can nyid kyang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni 'dod
analyzed: de ltar na rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis ltos pa can nyid kyang yin pas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag yod par 'gyur ba zhig na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni 'dod
translated: Thus, since coarseness and subtlety are distinguished by their specific states, they are also dependent. Therefore, coarseness and subtlety would exist up to the summit of existence.

original: pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir de yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir de yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But this is unacceptable because investigation and analysis exist in the desire realm and the level of the first absorption.

original: rtsing pa dang zhib pa nyid kyi rang bzhin tha dad par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa yang gzhan yin la dpyod pa la yang gzhan yin no zhes rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rang bzhin tha dad par 'dod do //
analyzed: rtsing pa dang zhib pa nyid kyi rang bzhin tha dad par yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa yang gzhan yin la dpyod pa la yang gzhan yin no zhes rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag rang bzhin tha dad par 'dod do //
translated: It is not reasonable that they have different natures of coarseness and subtlety.🔽It is asserted that investigation and analysis are different in nature, since investigation is one thing and analysis is another.

original: rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid kyis ni go rims bzhin du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ngo bo nyid tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid kyis ni go rims bzhin du rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ngo bo nyid tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that investigation and analysis have different natures of coarseness and subtlety, respectively.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes rang bzhin tha dad pa dag ni rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid du 'gyur te /🔽rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kho nas ni de dag @127a * //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes rang bzhin tha dad pa dag ni rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid du 'gyur te / rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid kho nas ni de dag @127a * //
translated: Feeling and discernment, which are different in nature, are coarse and subtle, respectively.

original: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not different in nature merely because of being coarse and subtle.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: myong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa yin te /
translated: They are different in nature because they have the characteristics of experience and the characteristics of apprehending signs.

original: de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not characteristics.🔽Others say:

original: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa rnams so //
translated: The Sūtra school says:

original: ngag mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngag mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The formation of speech is the instigation of speech.

original: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'i ma brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig smra bar bya'o snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra'i ma brtags ma dpyad par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig smra bar bya'o snyam pa yin no //
translated: One speaks words after investigating and analyzing, not without investigating and analyzing.

original: de la rtsing ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa'i rtog pa yin te las kyis ngo bo nyid bstan gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du rab tu bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: de la rtsing ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa'i rtog pa yin te las kyis ngo bo nyid bstan gyi rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du rab tu bstan par mi nus so //
translated: The coarse ones among these are the investigation of the formation of speech, because the nature of action is taught, but its own characteristic cannot be taught separately.

original: de bzhin du zhib pa gang dag ni dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhib pa gang dag ni dpyod pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the subtle ones are analysis.

original: rtog pa 'di la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag spyi'i ngo bo dang rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di la ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag spyi'i ngo bo dang rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba yin te /
translated: In this conception, conception and discernment occur in general and in specific ways.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs dag kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs dag kun nas slong bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the motivating factors of the aggregate of mind and the aggregate of mental factors.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say: If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?

original: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhes smras pas de'i phyir bye brag tu smra bas /
analyzed: sems gcig la de gnyis ji ltar ldan zhes smras pas de'i phyir bye brag tu smra bas /
translated: If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?

original: gal te sems gcig la rtsing ba yang chos gzhan yin zhib pa yang chos gzhan yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te sems gcig la rtog pa rags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang chos gzhan yin zhing dpyod pa zhib pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la🔽/ de dag kyang go rims bzhin du sems rtsing pa dang zhib pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sems gcig la rtsing ba yang chos gzhan yin zhib pa yang chos gzhan yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te sems gcig la rtog pa rags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang chos gzhan yin zhing dpyod pa zhib pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang gzhan yin la🔽/ de dag kyang go rims bzhin du sems rtsing pa dang zhib pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid dag ces bya'o //
translated: If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant in a single mind?🔽If coarseness is one dharma and subtlety is another dharma, then how could they be concomitant

original: yang na sems la rtsing pa yod pas na sems rtsing ba'o //🔽sems rtsing pa'i ngo bo ni sems rtsing ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sems la rtsing pa yod pas na sems rtsing ba'o // sems rtsing pa'i ngo bo ni sems rtsing ba nyid do //
translated: Or else, the mind is gross, because it is associated with grossness.🔽The nature of the mind is grossness.🔽The mind is subtle, because it is associated with subtlety.

original: sems zhib pa nyid kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems zhib pa nyid kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the mind is subtlety.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: gal te rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du rigs tha dad pa zhig yin na ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag tshor ba dang 'du shes bzhin du rigs tha dad pa zhig yin na ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: If discursiveness and intellection were different in kind from feeling and ideation, there would be no contradiction.

original: tshor ba ni rtsing ba yin la 'du shes ni zhib pa yin te /🔽de dag la ni rigs tha dad pa yod bas rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yod kyang sems gcig la 'byung ba 'gal ba med kyi rigs gcig pa dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i mtshan nyid can kha cig gis gcig pa nyid du yang gzung ba la ni chung
analyzed: tshor ba ni rtsing ba yin la 'du shes ni zhib pa yin te / de dag la ni rigs tha dad pa yod bas rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yod kyang sems gcig la 'byung ba 'gal ba med kyi rigs gcig pa dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i mtshan nyid can kha cig gis gcig pa nyid du yang gzung ba la ni chung
translated: Feeling is gross, ideation is subtle.🔽Since they are different in kind, it is not contradictory for them to occur in the same mind, even though they are gross and subtle, respectively.

original: ngu dang chen po nyid de rtsing ba dang @127b zhib pa'i mtshan nyid cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: ngu dang chen po nyid de rtsing ba dang @127b zhib pa'i mtshan nyid cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: But it is impossible for both grossness and subtlety, i.e., smallness and largeness, to occur simultaneously in a single thing, which is undifferentiated and has a single nature.

original: shugs kyis na cig car ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: shugs kyis na cig car ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: But if they are simultaneous, then they would not be mutually gross and subtle.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba'am chos gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba'am chos gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Thus, feeling and other dharmas

original: rnam grangs kyis ni chung ngu nyid dang chen po nyid bsten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis ni chung ngu nyid dang chen po nyid bsten par 'gyur ro //
translated: are gross or subtle in a secondary sense.🔽But if that is so, they are not clearly distinguished.

original: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not clearly distinguished?

original: rigs tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'o //
translated: They are not clearly distinguished as to type.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs re re la yang chung ngu dang chen po yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs re re la yang chung ngu dang chen po yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because each type has both gross and subtle forms.

original: ltos pa'i bye brag gi tshor ba ni rtsing ba yang yin la zhib pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa'i bye brag gi tshor ba ni rtsing ba yang yin la zhib pa yang yin no //
translated: Feeling is both gross and subtle, depending on the distinction of its basis.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽tshor ba ni 'du shes la ltos na ni rtsing ba yin la gzugs la ltos na ni zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / tshor ba ni 'du shes la ltos na ni rtsing ba yin la gzugs la ltos na ni zhib pa yin no //
translated: How is that?🔽Feeling is gross in relation to discernment, but subtle in relation to form.

original: de bzhin du 'du shes kyang 'du byed la ltos na ni rtsing ba yin la tshor ba la ltos na ni zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du shes kyang 'du byed la ltos na ni rtsing ba yin la tshor ba la ltos na ni zhib pa yin no //
translated: Discernment is gross in relation to formations, but subtle in relation to feeling.

original: yang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa nyid dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rtog pa dang dpyod pa nyid dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Or, they are like investigation and analysis.

original: khyed kyi ltar na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni rtsing ba yin la bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag ni zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi ltar na yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni rtsing ba yin la bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dag ni zhib pa yin no //
translated: Even according to you, applied thought and sustained thought in the desire realm are gross, and those of the first absorption are subtle.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni ches zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni ches zhib pa yin no //
translated: The sustained thought of the special first absorption is subtler.

original: de ltar na rigs re re la chung ngu dang chen po yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs re re la chung ngu dang chen po yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, each type has a small and a great stage.

original: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te chung ngu dang chen po nyid kyis rigs gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal bar mi 'gyur te chung ngu dang chen po nyid kyis rigs gsal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But if that is so, they are not clearly distinguished, because the type is not clearly distinguished by the small and great stages.

original: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang na re mthu'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir sems gcig kho na la rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag 'byung ba 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon 'dus bzang na re mthu'i dus tha dad pa'i phyir sems gcig kho na la rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid dag 'byung ba 'gal ba med de /
translated: Here, Master Saṅghabhadra says: Because the time of their power is different, it is not contradictory for both grossness and subtlety to occur in a single mind.

original: gang gi tshe sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la rtog pa bya ba la shas che bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni sems rtsing ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs la rtog pa bya ba la shas che bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni sems rtsing ba yin la /
translated: When the collection of minds and mental factors is dominated by the function of applied thought, then the mind is gross.

original: gang gi tshe dpyod pa shas che ba de'i tshe ni zhib pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dpyod pa shas che ba de'i tshe ni zhib pa yin no //
translated: When investigation is predominant, it is subtle.

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug spyod par tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug spyod par tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the conventional expressions “one who engages passion” and “one who engages delusion.”

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug cig car 'byung mod kyi de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig bya ba la shas che ba dang ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags spyod pa'am gti mug spyod pa'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug cig car 'byung mod kyi de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig bya ba la shas che ba dang ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags spyod pa'am gti mug spyod pa'o zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar blta bar
translated: Even though passion and delusion occur simultaneously, one who possesses a predominance of either passion or delusion in action is called one who engages passion or one who engages delusion.

original: bya'o // 'di la bdag ni tshogs pa kha cig la chos 'ga' zhig bya ba la shas che ba ni yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye bas 'di ni gyi na'o zhes smra'o //🔽rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi mtshan nyid sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid yin par bshad pa ma @128a * //
analyzed: bya'o // 'di la bdag ni tshogs pa kha cig la chos 'ga' zhig bya ba la shas che ba ni yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'di gnyis kyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye bas 'di ni gyi na'o zhes smra'o // rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi mtshan nyid sems rtsing ba nyid dang zhib pa nyid yin par bshad pa ma @128a * //
translated: In this regard, we say that although in some collections of aggregates, one of these two is predominant in action, still, since the characteristics of these two have not been distinguished, this is not satisfactory.

original: yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn’t it explained that the characteristics of investigation and analysis are the coarseness and subtlety of mind?

original: bshad pa ni bden na rigs re re la yang rtsing ba dang zhib pa yod pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa ni bden na rigs re re la yang rtsing ba dang zhib pa yod pa'i phyir de dag gi mtshan nyid rtsing ba dang zhib pa nyid yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that is explained in that way, then it is not correct that the characteristics of those two are coarseness and subtlety, because coarseness and subtlety exist for each type of reasoning.

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin pas 'dis ni bdag rangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bu yin pas 'dis ni bdag rangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is as we have explained, we are not satisfied with that explanation.

original: gzhan dag na re sems gcig la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes zer ro zhas bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems gcig la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag mi 'byung ba nyid do zhes zer ro zhas bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: Others say: Contemplation and discernment do not occur in a single mind.

original: gzhung lugs 'di la ni ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhung lugs 'di la ni ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the master's system, because in this system the faults just explained do not occur.

original: rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba 'di gnyis la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these two, which occur by way of synonyms?

original: 'di la sngon gyi slob dpon na re rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la sngon gyi slob dpon na re rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: Here past masters say: What is contemplation?

original: sems pa'am shes rab la brten nas go rims bzhin du gtan la mi 'bebs pa dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yid kyi brjod pa kun du tshol bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa'am shes rab la brten nas go rims bzhin du gtan la mi 'bebs pa dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yid kyi brjod pa kun du tshol bar byed pa yin te /
translated: It is mental expression that seeks out the object in the two states of not determining and determining the object in reliance on intention or wisdom.

original: de yang sems rtsing ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang sems rtsing ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is also coarse analysis.

original: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is investigation?

original: sems pa'am shes rab la brten nas go rims bzhin du gtan la mi 'bebs pa dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yid kyi brjod pa so sor rtog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa'am shes rab la brten nas go rims bzhin du gtan la mi 'bebs pa dang gtan la 'bebs pa'i gnas skabs dag na yid kyi brjod pa so sor rtog par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is mental expression that investigates the object in the two states of not determining and determining the object in reliance on intention or wisdom.

original: de yang sems zhib pa nyid yin no zhes 'chad de /
analyzed: de yang sems zhib pa nyid yin no zhes 'chad de /
translated: It is also subtle analysis.

original: phyogs 'di ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba yin la kun du tshol ba dang so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa tsam gyis tha dad pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa 'dus pa'i ngo bo rnam grangs kyis 'byung ba yin la kun du tshol ba dang so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa tsam gyis tha dad pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: This position asserts that investigation and analysis have the same nature and are synonyms that occur in a series and are differentiated by their aspects of seeking out and investigating.

original: 'dir dpe ni kha cig na re 'di lta ste bum pa mang po zhig yod pa las thal mos bsnun te /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni kha cig na re 'di lta ste bum pa mang po zhig yod pa las thal mos bsnun te /
translated: Some say: For example, if there are many pots and one strikes them with one's palm,

original: 'di'i nang na gang ni sra gang ni 'phan yod ces smra ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i nang na gang ni sra gang ni 'phan yod ces smra ba gang yin pa de ni rtog pa yin la /
translated: one wonders, What is hard? What is soft?

original: mjug tu 'di'i nang na 'di snyed cig ni 'phan yod do zhe'am sra'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mjug tu 'di'i nang na 'di snyed cig ni 'phan yod do zhe'am sra'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni dpyod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: And finally, one ascertains, There are this many that are soft or hard.🔽Now, how is the first absorption explained as having five branches?

original: da ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po yan lag lnga par bshad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas ba dben pa las skyes
analyzed: da ni ji ltar bsam gtan dang po yan lag lnga par bshad ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas ba dben pa las skyes
translated: It is secluded from desire realm objects and secluded from negative nonvirtuous states. It possesses investigation and analysis and is born from seclusion.

original: pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i mdo 'di las yan lag lnga par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'i mdo 'di las yan lag lnga par gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and he abides having attained the first meditative concentration that possesses investigation and analysis and is born of seclusion, and is accompanied by delight and joy that arises from seclusion.🔽The five branches are mentioned in this sutra, but not in the Abhidharma.

original: sa las de yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang @128b po'i sa res 'ga' ni rtog pa dang ldan la res 'ga' ni dpyod pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: sa las de yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang @128b po'i sa res 'ga' ni rtog pa dang ldan la res 'ga' ni dpyod pa dang ldan te /
translated: Vasubandhu says, “The Abhidharma explains that the first meditative concentration has five branches, but not that each moment has five branches. The first meditative concentration is sometimes associated with investigation and sometimes with analysis.

original: de lta bas na rgyud kyi dbang du mdzad nas yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig ma'i dbang du mdzad pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyud kyi dbang du mdzad nas yan lag lnga par bshad kyi skad cig ma'i dbang du mdzad pa ni ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of five branches is made from the perspective of a continuum, not from the perspective of a moment. There is no fault.

original: pha rol po las gang yang rung ba'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas zhes bya ba ni pha rol po las yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin pa'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas bdag ni dpa' bo nor dang ldan no //
analyzed: pha rol po las gang yang rung ba'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas zhes bya ba ni pha rol po las yang dag pa'am yang dag pa ma yin pa'i khyad par zhig yongs su brtags nas bdag ni dpa' bo nor dang ldan no //
translated: The opponent imagines some kind of distinction, either real or unreal, and thinks, “I am a hero, I am wealthy.”

original: tshul khrims dang ldan no //🔽blo phun sum tshogs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan no // blo phun sum tshogs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal zhes bya ba sems las byung ba'i chos yin no //
translated: He is endowed with morality.🔽He is endowed with wisdom.🔽He is endowed with generosity.🔽He is endowed with patience.🔽He is endowed with effort.

original: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par du bya ba'i don tam /
analyzed: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o // zhes bya ba la / ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni khyad par du bya ba'i don tam /
translated: He is endowed with concentration.🔽He is endowed with wisdom.

original: rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: He is endowed with the perfections.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyags pa ni rang gi chos rnams kho na la chags pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
