original: sems yongs su gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na rang gi chos gzugs dang dpa' ba la sogs pa kho na la chags pas sems yongs su gtugs shing kun du 'gags par 'gyur ba de ni 'dod chags rgyu mthun pa'i rgyags pa yin no //
analyzed: sems yongs su gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis na rang gi chos gzugs dang dpa' ba la sogs pa kho na la chags pas sems yongs su gtugs shing kun du 'gags par 'gyur ba de ni 'dod chags rgyu mthun pa'i rgyags pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the factors of enlightenment.🔽He is endowed with

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni rang gi chos rnams kho na la chags pa'i sems rgyags pa dge ba'i chos bya ba dag las yongs su gtugs shing phyir log pa de ni rgyags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re ni rang gi chos rnams kho na la chags pa'i sems rgyags pa dge ba'i chos bya ba dag las yongs su gtugs shing phyir log pa de ni rgyags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says: It is the inflated mind that is attached to its own qualities, and it is the complete exhaustion and reversal of virtuous qualities.🔽Arrogance is a specific type of joy that arises from attachment.

original: rgyags pa yang 'dod chags las skyes pa kun du dga' ba'i bye brag yin no zhes bya ba ni yid dga' ba nyon mongs pa can yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyags pa yang 'dod chags las skyes pa kun du dga' ba'i bye brag yin no zhes bya ba ni yid dga' ba nyon mongs pa can yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the afflicted mental satisfaction.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod de /🔽'di ltar yid bde ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar na yod la rgyags pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod de / 'di ltar yid bde ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar na yod la rgyags pa ni /
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert this because:

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //
translated: Mental satisfaction exists up to the second absorption, but arrogance exists in the three realms,

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir khams gsum pa yin no //
translated: because it is said, “Drowsiness, excitation, and arrogance exist in the three realms.”

original: sems las 'byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te rnam par re re nas bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni sems ni re zhig / rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
analyzed: sems las 'byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te rnam par re re nas bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni sems ni re zhig / rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa //
translated: The mental factors have been explained in detail along with the mind.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa re re nas bshad zin la sems las byung ba dag kyang rang gi @129a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa re re nas bshad zin la sems las byung ba dag kyang rang gi @129a * //
translated: The nature of each of these is explained in terms of their individual characteristics, their classification as aggregates, elements, and bases, and their classification as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on.

original: mtshan nyid dang phan tshun gyi khyad par dang rang sems kyi grangs nges par gzung ba dang / 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang phan tshun gyi khyad par dang rang sems kyi grangs nges par gzung ba dang / 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas bshad zin to //
translated: The mental factors have also been explained in terms of their individual characteristics, their mutual distinctions, the certainty of their number, their classification as belonging to the desire realm, the first meditative stabilization, and so on.

original: don gcig ces bya ba ni sems gang yin pa de nyid yin la /🔽de nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don gcig ces bya ba ni sems gang yin pa de nyid yin la / de nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term “same meaning” means that the mind itself is consciousness.🔽This is the same as the mind.

original: 'di la don gcig pa yod pas na don gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la don gcig pa yod pas na don gcig pa yin no //
translated: It is called consciousness because it has the same meaning as the mind.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi khyad par ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi khyad par ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: The specific term should be explained.

original: 'byed pas na sems so zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byed pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'byed pas na sems so zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba 'byed pas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The mind is so called because it divides, i.e., it divides into virtue and nonvirtue.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na de ltar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na de ltar grub pa yin no //
translated: This is established by the method of etymology.

original: shes pas ni yid do zhes bya ba ni yid ces pa'i skad kyi byings 'di ni shes pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: shes pas ni yid do zhes bya ba ni yid ces pa'i skad kyi byings 'di ni shes pa'i don yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is so called because it is the knower. The verbal root man means to know.

original: dmigs pa rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is so called because it is the knower of the object.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag gis bsags pas na sems so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i gzhung lugs dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung lugs kyis ni bag chags gnas pa'i tshul gyis na sems yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i khams dag gis bsags pas na sems so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i gzhung lugs dang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung lugs kyis ni bag chags gnas pa'i tshul gyis na sems yin no //
translated: The mind is so called because it is accumulated by the elements of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: rten du gyur pa ni yid do //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa ni yid do //
translated: The mental faculty is the support.🔽Consciousness is the supported.

original: brten par gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos po la ltos pa ni yid yin te /
analyzed: brten par gyur pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni rten gyi dngos po la ltos pa ni yid yin te /
translated: The mental faculty is the support because it is the basis of the six consciousnesses.

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The immediately preceding six are the mental faculty.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: Consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: zhes bya ba'i don yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: brten pa'i dngos po la ltos pa ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: brten pa'i dngos po la ltos pa ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: Consciousness is dependent on the support,

original: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis la brten nas rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, “Consciousness arises in dependence on two.”🔽Mind and mental factors🔽have a support, object, aspect,

original: sems dang sems byung dang // rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang // mtshungs par ldan pa 'ang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung dang // rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang // mtshungs par ldan pa 'ang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and concomitance.🔽The word “also” in the verse indicates that they are associated with the mind and mental factors.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa na don gcig dang sbyar ba'i phyir te sems dang sems byung zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dir brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid rten bcas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis brjod par bya ba yin te dmigs pa dang bcas pa
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa na don gcig dang sbyar ba'i phyir te sems dang sems byung zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dir brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag nyid rten bcas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis brjod par bya ba yin te dmigs pa dang bcas pa
translated: The word “also” is connected with the word “one,” because the words “mind and mental factors” are expressed in this verse and the words “having a support” are expressed by this verse.🔽They also have an object,

original: dag dang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dag dang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: an aspect, and concomitance.

original: de la dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag yin te skye mched drug la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag yin te skye mched drug la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are associated with a basis because they are supported on a faculty, i.e., they are supported on the six sense faculties.

original: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: They are associated with an object because they grasp an object-field.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni dmigs pa med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni dmigs pa med par skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For mind and mental factors do not arise without an object.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod @129b pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod @129b pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag ste /
translated: They are associated with an aspect because they individually discriminate that very object.

original: gang gis na de dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la rnam pa re re nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis na de dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa de la rnam pa re re nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated with an object because they grasp that object individually through an aspect.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam par shes pas ni sngon po'am ser po'i dngos po rnam par shes te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni sngon po'am ser po'i dngos po rnam par shes te /
translated: Consciousness is aware of the entity of blue or yellow,

original: dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: i.e., it becomes the object.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po de nyid ni tshor bas ni nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i dngos po de nyid ni tshor bas ni nyams su myong ngo //
translated: Feeling experiences that very object that is the object of consciousness.

original: 'du shes kyis ni yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis ni yongs su gcod do //
translated: It is determined by ideation.

original: sems pas ni mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems pas ni mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is conditioned by intention.

original: yang na dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par shes pas ni spyi'i ngo bor dmigs par bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin la /🔽bye brag gi ngo bo ni tshor bas ni myong bar bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par shes pas ni spyi'i ngo bor dmigs par bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin la / bye brag gi ngo bo ni tshor bas ni myong bar bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin to //
translated: Or else, consciousness apprehends the object-field in the manner of a general characteristic;🔽sensation apprehends it in the manner of an agreeable or disagreeable experience;

original: 'du shes kyis ni yongs su gcad par bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin to zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis ni yongs su gcad par bya ba'i tshul du 'dzin to zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ideation apprehends it in the manner of a specific characteristic.

original: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go zhes bya ba ni phan tshun mnyam par mi 'bral bas na mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go zhes bya ba ni phan tshun mnyam par mi 'bral bas na mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are associated because they are associated through a sameness of five factors: support, object-field, aspect, time, substance.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni rten gang gis sems skye ba'i rten de nyid kyi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa skye la /
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni rten gang gis sems skye ba'i rten de nyid kyi tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa skye la /
translated: The feeling, discernment, intention, etc. that arise in a given support arise in the same support in which the mind arises.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa gang gis sems skye ba de nyid kyis tshor ba la sogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa gang gis sems skye ba de nyid kyis tshor ba la sogs pa skye'o //
translated: Similarly, the feeling, etc. that arise in a given object field arise in the same object field in which the mind arises.

original: rnam pa gang gis sems skye ba de nyid kyis tshor ba la sogs pa skye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis sems skye ba de nyid kyis tshor ba la sogs pa skye ste /
translated: The feeling, etc. that arise in a given aspect arise in the same aspect in which the mind arises.

original: gal te sems sngon po'i rnam pa can yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa sngon po'i rnam pa can kho nar skye'o //
analyzed: gal te sems sngon po'i rnam pa can yin na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa tshor ba la sogs pa sngon po'i rnam pa can kho nar skye'o //
translated: If the mind has the aspect of blue, then the feeling, etc. that are concomitant with it arise only having the aspect of blue.

original: sems dus gang du skye ba de kho nar tshor ba la sogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: sems dus gang du skye ba de kho nar tshor ba la sogs pa skye'o //
translated: The feeling, etc. that arise at the same time as the mind arise at the same time as the mind.

original: ji ltar sems rdzas gcig kho nar skye ba de bzhin du tshor ba yang rdzas gcig kho nar skye'i gnyis sam gsum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sems rdzas gcig kho nar skye ba de bzhin du tshor ba yang rdzas gcig kho nar skye'i gnyis sam gsum ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the mind arises as a single substance, so too feeling arises as a single substance, not as two or three.

original: 'du shes kyi rdzas dang sems pa'i rdzas kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rdzas dang sems pa'i rdzas kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The same applies to the substances of ideation and the substances of volition.

original: de'i phyir tha ma de kho na rtogs par dka' bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha ma de kho na rtogs par dka' bas /
translated: Therefore, since the last is difficult to understand,

original: ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang rdzas re re yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang rdzas re re yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: just as the mind is a single substance, so too the mental factors are single substances.

original: slob dpon ldan pa ma yin pa bshad par 'dod nas gleng slong bar byed de /
analyzed: slob dpon ldan pa ma yin pa bshad par 'dod nas gleng slong bar byed de /
translated: The master Bhadanta Vasumitra, wishing to explain the non-associated factors, raises the question:

original: sems dang sems la las byung ba rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag ni bstan zin to //🔽da ni mtshungs @130a * //
analyzed: sems dang sems la las byung ba rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag ni bstan zin to // da ni mtshungs @130a * //
translated: The mind and mental factors have been explained in detail with their divisions.

original: par ldan pa ma yin pa dag gi skabs la bab pas brjod par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: par ldan pa ma yin pa dag gi skabs la bab pas brjod par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Now, since the time has come to discuss the non-associated factors, they should be explained.

original: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dag go //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag ces bya ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dag go //
translated: The phrase with their divisions means that the expansion and division are the expansion and division.

original: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dag dang lhan cig 'dug pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dag dang lhan cig 'dug pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: “Along with the elaboration and the analysis” means “along with the elaboration and the analysis.

original: yang na rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: ” Or, “elaboration and analysis” means “elaboration and analysis.

original: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang lhan cig pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang lhan cig pa ni rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: ” “Along with the elaboration and the analysis” means “along with the elaboration and the analysis.

original: de la re zhig sems ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig sems ni /
translated: ” Among them, first, the mind is taught along with the elaboration and the analysis,

original: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang bcas par bstan zin to //
translated: as in the statement, “Consciousness is the individual awareness, and it is also the mental sense-sphere.🔽”

original: sems las byung ba dag kyang /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag kyang /
translated: The mental factors are also taught in detail,

original: tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba myong ba zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: as in the statement, “Feeling is the experience.🔽”

original: sems byung rnam lnga zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: Up to the statement, “There are five kinds of mental factors.🔽”

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang //
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang //
translated: The collection of names, etc., are also taught,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: as in the statement,🔽“The collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ldan pa ma yin pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni de lta bu dang mthun pa'i ldan pa ma yin pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “and so on” indicates that this is the pattern for other non-concomitant things.

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa rdzas su 'dod de /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa rdzas su 'dod de /
translated: The Saṅgha’s schism and so on are asserted to be substantial entities that are not concomitant with the mind.

original: bstan bcos las kyang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa yang zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang gang dag de lta bu dang mthun pa yang zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge also explains that “and so on” includes other such things.

original: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The term “not concomitant with the mind” means

original: sems smos pa ni sems dang rigs mthun pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te sems dang mi ldan pa ni sems dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems smos pa ni sems dang rigs mthun pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te sems dang mi ldan pa ni sems dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that the mind is not their type. The phrase “not concomitant with the mind” means that they are not similar to the mind.

original: 'di dag gi sems dang rigs mthun pa nyid gang yin zhe na /🔽'di dag gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi sems dang rigs mthun pa nyid gang yin zhe na / 'di dag gzugs can ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is their similarity to the mind?🔽They are not physical.

original: gzugs ni ldan pa ma yin pa nyid yin yang gzugs can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzugs ni ldan pa ma yin pa nyid yin yang gzugs can yin pa nyid kyi phyir ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: Although form is not concomitant with the mind, it is not called a non-concomitant because it is physical.

original: yang na 'di dag ni ming gi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag gi ming nyid de sems dang rigs mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di dag ni ming gi ngo bo nyid yin pa de dag gi ming nyid de sems dang rigs mthun pa yin no //
translated: Or else, these are the intrinsic nature of names, and their name is that which is similar to mind.

original: sems las byung ba dag kyang sems dang rigs mthun pa yin mod kyi dmigs pa la sems dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas de dag las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag kyang sems dang rigs mthun pa yin mod kyi dmigs pa la sems dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas de dag las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Although mental factors are similar to mind, they are associated with mind in relation to the object. Therefore, in order to distinguish them from that, it says “not associated.”

original: 'dus ma byas kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis de dag dang rigs mthun pa yin pas de bsal pa'i phyir 'du @130b byed ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis de dag dang rigs mthun pa yin pas de bsal pa'i phyir 'du @130b byed ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Also, the unconditioned is similar to those in being without an object. Therefore, in order to exclude that, it says “conditioned.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, these conditioned factors are not associated with mind and are not the nature of form. Therefore, they are called “not associated with mind.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tshig gi phrad dam dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Here, “that” is a verbal prefix or an exception.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa yin no //
translated: The word “some” indicates a sequence.

original: thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Obtainment is acquisition and possession.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming yin no //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming yin no //
translated: Obtainment is a general term.

original: rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ming yin no //🔽rnyed pa dang so sor rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyi ming yin no // rnyed pa dang so sor rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Acquisition and possession are specific terms.🔽Acquisition and individual acquisition have the same meaning.

original: ldan pa dang kun du ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //🔽so sor rnyed pa zhes bshad na ni kun du ldan pa ma bsdus par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ldan pa dang kun du ldan pa zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no // so sor rnyed pa zhes bshad na ni kun du ldan pa ma bsdus par 'gyur la /
translated: Possession and complete possession have the same meaning.🔽If individual acquisition is explained, complete possession is not included.

original: kun du ldan pa zhes bshad na ni so sor rnyed pa ma bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: kun du ldan pa zhes bshad na ni so sor rnyed pa ma bsdus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If complete possession is explained, individual acquisition is not included.

original: thob pa zhes bshad na ni gnyi ga bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa zhes bshad na ni gnyi ga bsdus pa yin te /
translated: But if obtainment is explained, both are included.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Obtainment is twofold:

original: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang thob nas ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang thob nas ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: acquisition from not obtaining and from degeneration and possession after obtaining.

original: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa ste rnyed pa ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa ste rnyed pa ni ma thob pa dang rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa'o //
translated: That which is obtained and that which is lost is obtained and lost. That which is obtained is obtained from that which is not obtained and that which is lost.

original: ma thob pa las ni 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa las ni 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is obtained from that which is not obtained is, for example, the receptivity to the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering.

original: rnam par nyams pa las ni 'di lta ste 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa 'dod chags dang bral bas bor ba khams su phyir 'ong ba'am yongs su nyams pas so sor rnyed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa las ni 'di lta ste 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa 'dod chags dang bral bas bor ba khams su phyir 'ong ba'am yongs su nyams pas so sor rnyed pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is obtained from that which is lost is, for example, the receptivity to the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering that is obtained by one who has fallen from the fruit of stream-entry and by one who has fallen from the fruit of non-returning.

original: thob nas ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: thob nas ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ldan pa yin te /
translated: One who has obtained it is endowed with it in the second moment and so on,

original: de rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is subsequently maintained.

original: so sor rnyed pa gang yin pa dang kun du ldan pa gang yin pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang thob pa yin te thob pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rnyed pa gang yin pa dang kun du ldan pa gang yin pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang thob pa yin te thob pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Both that which is obtained and that which is maintained are obtained, because the term “obtained” is applied to both that which is obtained and that which is maintained.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par 'dod na ni thob pa dang so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par brjod par 'dod na ni thob pa dang so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa zhes bya ba don gcig ste /
translated: If you assert that they are not different, then obtainment, acquisition and possession have the same meaning.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa so sor rnyed pa yin par 'dod la de yang kun du ldan pa zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa thob pa so sor rnyed pa yin par 'dod la de yang kun du ldan pa zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the first moment, the obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is asserted to be acquisition and it is also called possession.

original: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan pa /
analyzed: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan pa /
translated: One possessing the faculty producing complete knowledge

original: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma dang po la gnas @131a * //
analyzed: bcu gsum dag dang ldan pa yin // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma dang po la gnas @131a * //
translated: possesses thirteen.

original: pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because this passage exists, the first moment of an ārya person abiding in the result of stream entry is called one possessing perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: ji ltar 'di mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mtshan nyid du bstan pa yin //
translated: How is this taught as a definition?

original: thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is obtainment?

original: so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa'o zhes tha dad par brjod par 'dod kyang rnam grangs kyi tshig gis ni mtshan nyid du bstan par mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: so sor rnyed pa dang kun du ldan pa'o zhes tha dad par brjod par 'dod kyang rnam grangs kyi tshig gis ni mtshan nyid du bstan par mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Although it is stated separately, “Obtainment is of two kinds: individual obtainment and possession,” it is not suitable to teach it as a characteristic by means of a term that is a synonym.

original: rnam grangs kyi tshig yin yang res 'ga' mtshan nyid du rung bar 'gyur te me ni du ba can no //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi tshig yin yang res 'ga' mtshan nyid du rung bar 'gyur te me ni du ba can no //
translated: Even though it is a synonym, sometimes it is suitable as a characteristic, like saying “Fire is smoky”

original: me ni rtags kyis go ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me ni rtags kyis go ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and “Fire is understood through a reason.”🔽Also a sutra states:

original: mdo las kyang ma rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las kyang ma rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance?

original: gang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: It is not knowing the prior limit, not knowing the later limit, and so on.🔽Obtainment is established as the opposite of nonobtainment.

original: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa kho nas ma thob pa grub pa'i phyir 'di'i don du mdo mi bya'o zhes bya bar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa'o zhes bya bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa kho nas ma thob pa grub pa'i phyir 'di'i don du mdo mi bya'o zhes bya bar bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is the thought: Since nonobtainment is established as the opposite of obtainment alone, a sutra should not be cited as a meaning of this term.

original: bzlog pa kho nas ma thob pa ni so sor ma rnyed pa dang kun du mi ldan pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gsum shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa kho nas ma thob pa ni so sor ma rnyed pa dang kun du mi ldan pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gsum shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nonobtainment is threefold: nonobtainment of what has not been obtained, nonobtainment of what has been obtained and lost, and nonpossession.

original: de bzhin du so sor ma rnyed pa dang kun du mi ldan pa dag ni ma thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor ma rnyed pa dang kun du mi ldan pa dag ni ma thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ming yin no //
translated: Nonobtainment of what has not been obtained and nonpossession are general terms.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad du ma thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad du ma thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore it should be said that nonobtainment is twofold:

original: sngon ma thob pa rnams so sor ma rnyed pa dang thob ste rnam par nyams pa rnams dang kun du mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽yang na so sor ma rnyed pa dang rnam par nyams pa dang po ma thob pa ni so sor ma rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon ma thob pa rnams so sor ma rnyed pa dang thob ste rnam par nyams pa rnams dang kun du mi ldan pa zhes brjod par bya'o // yang na so sor ma rnyed pa dang rnam par nyams pa dang po ma thob pa ni so sor ma rnyed pa yin no //
translated: nonobtainment of what has not been obtained and nonobtainment of what has been obtained and lost.🔽Or it should be said that nonobtainment of what has not been obtained and nonobtainment of what has been obtained and lost is nonobtainment,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni kun du mi ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni kun du mi ldan pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and nonpossession is nonobtainment of what has been obtained and lost in the second moment and so on.

original: thob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //
translated: Obtainment and nonobtainment exist in one’s own mindstream.

original: gtogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dag ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dus byas dag kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gtogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dag ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'dus byas dag kho na'i yin gyi gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dag ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “those that are included” means that acquisition and non-acquisition are only of conditioned entities that are included in one’s own mind-stream, and not of those that are included in the mind-streams of others.

original: sems can gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i chos rnams rang gi rgyud la thob pa dang ma thob pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i chos rnams rang gi rgyud la thob pa dang ma thob pa dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is a definitive statement that the entities that are included in the mind-streams of other sentient beings are neither acquired nor not acquired in one’s own mind-stream.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “No one possesses those that are not included in a mind-stream.”

original: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “nor of those that are not included in a mind-stream” means that they are not of those that are not included in a sentient being’s mind-stream.

original: de'i phyir sems can du mi bgrang ba @131b dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can du mi bgrang ba @131b dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is a definitive statement that no one possesses those that are not counted as sentient beings.

original: me tog phreng dang rgyan la sogs pa dang shing dang rtsig pa la sogs pa la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog phreng dang rgyan la sogs pa dang shing dang rtsig pa la sogs pa la yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: Form, etc. that exist in garlands, ornaments, etc., and in trees, walls, etc. are not counted as sentient beings.

original: mig la sogs pa ni sems can du bgrang ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni sems can du bgrang ba yin no //
translated: The eye, etc. are counted as sentient beings.

original: sgra la sogs pa yang dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel ba'i phyir sems can du bgrang ba kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa yang dbang po gzugs can dang 'brel ba'i phyir sems can du bgrang ba kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Sound, etc. should be understood as only counted as sentient beings because they are related to material faculties.

original: de la phan pa dang gnod pas 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan pa dang gnod pas 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are affected by benefit and harm.

original: 'di ltar dbang po gzugs can la gnod pa la skra la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba skya bo la sogs pa snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po gzugs can la gnod pa la skra la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba skya bo la sogs pa snang la /
translated: Thus, when the material faculties are harmed, changes such as graying of the hair, etc. appear.

original: sman bcud kyis len zos pa'i phan pa las skya bo la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba snang ngo //
analyzed: sman bcud kyis len zos pa'i phan pa las skya bo la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba snang ngo //
translated: And when they are benefited by taking a medicinal elixir, the graying, etc. disappears.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni thob pa sems can du bgrang ba thams cad kyis kyang yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni thob pa sems can du bgrang ba thams cad kyis kyang yang yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The conclusion is that all acquisitions of sentient beings are also sentient beings.

original: 'gog gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dag sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dag gi yang yin no //
analyzed: 'gog gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang ma thob pa dag sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa so sor brtags pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dag gi yang yin no //
translated: The two cessations refers to the attainment and nonattainment of the two cessations: analytical and nonanalytical.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ni sems can thams cad rkyen ma tshang ba ji lta ba bzhin du ldan no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang ni sems can thams cad rkyen ma tshang ba ji lta ba bzhin du ldan no //
translated: Nonanalytical cessation is possessed by all sentient beings, in accordance with the incompleteness of conditions.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for those who possess all the bonds and abide in the first moment.

original: skad cig ma dang po ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The first moment is the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: de la gnas pa ni skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'o //🔽'di dag la 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pas na /🔽'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'o // 'di dag la 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pas na / 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Abiding in that is abiding in the first moment.🔽They possess all the bonds because they have not abandoned all the aspects of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ma spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa thams cad ma spangs pa yin no //
translated: They possess all the bonds because they have not abandoned all the aspects of the afflictions.

original: de dag ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yang yin la skad cig dang po la gnas pa yang yin pas 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'o //🔽de dag ma gtogs pa 'phags pa thams cad de de dag ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yang yin la skad cig dang po la gnas pa yang yin pas 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'o // de dag ma gtogs pa 'phags pa thams cad de de dag ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang ldan no //
translated: All āryas other than those who possess all the bonds abide in the first moment.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni mi ldan te /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa skad cig ma dang po la gnas pa'i 'phags pa rnams ni mi ldan te /
translated: Those āryas who possess all the bonds and abide in the first moment do not possess it.🔽The treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni /
translated: The path that is about to cease

original: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spongs //
analyzed: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spongs //
translated: completely abandons its obscurations.

original: zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs de ni bzod pas gzhom par bya ba'i @132a * //🔽nyon mongs pa rnams 'chad kyi chad pa ni ma yin no //🔽de'i 'gog pa yang 'thob kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnas skabs de ni bzod pas gzhom par bya ba'i @132a * // nyon mongs pa rnams 'chad kyi chad pa ni ma yin no // de'i 'gog pa yang 'thob kyi /
translated: Therefore, in that state, the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are severed, but the obtainment of the state of an ārya is not severed.

original: thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cessation of the afflictions is obtained, but the obtainment of the cessation of the afflictions is not obtained.

original: rnam pa gcig spangs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas skabs de na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'gog pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig spangs pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa'i gnas skabs de na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'gog pa dang ldan no //
translated: At the time of the noble ones who have abandoned one type of affliction and so on, they possess the cessation obtained by the mundane path.

original: de phan chad skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'gog pa dang yang ldan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de phan chad skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'gog pa dang yang ldan pa kho na'o //
translated: From then on, in the second moment and so forth, they possess the cessation obtained by the uncontaminated path.

original: so so'i skye bo kha cig kyang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo kha cig kyang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some ordinary beings also possess it.

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med de zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med de zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No one possesses space, because there is no connection.

original: 'gog pa dag dang ni 'brel pa yod de /
analyzed: 'gog pa dag dang ni 'brel pa yod de /
translated: But there is a connection with the cessations.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha'i thob pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha'i thob pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no obtainment of space.

original: gang la thob pa med pa de la ni ma thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gang la thob pa med pa de la ni ma thob pa yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin no //
translated: And if there is no obtainment, there is also no nonobtainment. This is the tenet of the Vaibhasikas.

original: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang mig la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'dri ba yin no //
translated: It is asked why it is not like form, etc., or the eyes, etc., in being perceived in terms of its own nature or its effect.

original: mdo las te zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba lung gis sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las te zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba lung gis sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: From a sutra means that the Vaibhasikas prove it by scriptural authority.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The ten qualities of no more learning, etc.

original: mi slob pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The ten qualities of no more learning are the eight branches of the arya path of no more learning, right liberation and right knowledge.

original: de dag skyed cing mngon du gyur cing so sor rnyed cing dang po ra thob cing kun du ldan pas na phis thob pas na'o //
analyzed: de dag skyed cing mngon du gyur cing so sor rnyed cing dang po ra thob cing kun du ldan pas na phis thob pas na'o //
translated: One possesses them because they are generated, manifest, obtained individually, first attained and conjoined.

original: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa ni yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa ni yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Abandoning five branches is synonymous with abandoning five branches.

original: yan lag lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems so //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems so //
translated: The five branches are the afflicted view of the self, the esteeming of morality and ascetic practices, doubt, desire for sensual pleasure, and malice.

original: bdag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa na de dag spangs so zhes bya bar ni mi rung gi / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa yan lag lnga po 'di dag spangs par ni rung ngo zhes bya bar blta ste /
analyzed: bdag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa na de dag spangs so zhes bya bar ni mi rung gi / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa yan lag lnga po 'di dag spangs par ni rung ngo zhes bya bar blta ste /
translated: It is not correct to say that the non-returner has abandoned these five branches when he obtains the fruit of non-returner; but it is correct to say that he has abandoned the five branches that are called attachment to the realm of fine-materiality, attachment to the realm of immateriality, conceit, desire for sensual pleasure, and malice.

original: dgra bcom pas 'dra ba thob pa'i phyir tha mal bar 'dug pa na yang 'phags pa @132b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas 'dra ba thob pa'i phyir tha mal bar 'dug pa na yang 'phags pa @132b zhes bya'o //
translated: When he is in the ordinary state, he is called an ārya because he has obtained the status of the perfected being.

original: 'dir sgrub pa ni kun du ldan pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa ni kun du ldan pa ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: Here the proof is: The possession of the branches exists as a real entity,

original: mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rdzas bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rdzas bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is mentioned in the sūtra, like the real entities of the sense-spheres.

original: slob dpon gyis phyir smras pa /🔽'o na ni des na sems can du mi ston pa 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa dang / sems can gzhan btsun mo rin po che la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rdzas su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis phyir smras pa / 'o na ni des na sems can du mi ston pa 'khor lo rin po che la sogs pa dang / sems can gzhan btsun mo rin po che la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang rdzas su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: The master responds:

original: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, the precious wheel and so on, which are not sentient beings, and the other sentient beings, such as the precious queen, would also be substantially existent because they appear in sūtra.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'byung zhes bya ba'i bar mdos ston par byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'byung zhes bya ba'i bar mdos ston par byed de /
translated: The sūtra teaches in detail from “king” up to “appear.”

original: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Bhikṣhus, a wheel turning king possesses seven precious substances.

original: de'i rin po'i che sna bdun ni 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i rin po'i che sna bdun ni 'di dag yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: His seven precious substances are as follows:

original: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang // bdun pa ni blon po rin po che kho na yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang / btsun mo rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang // bdun pa ni blon po rin po che kho na yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious jewel, the precious wife, the precious steward, and the precious minister.

original: mdo las ni rin po che 'di bdun dang ldan par gsungs la /
analyzed: mdo las ni rin po che 'di bdun dang ldan par gsungs la /
translated: The sutra declares that he possesses these seven jewels,

original: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: but they do not exist substantially, so this is a case of indeterminacy.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'di dam bcas pa'i skyon 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir 'di dam bcas pa'i skyon 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Or else, this is a fault in your thesis because it contradicts inference.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: smras pa / mi slob pa'i chos bcu'i ldan pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / mi slob pa'i chos bcu'i ldan pa ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We say: One who possesses the ten qualities of no longer being a trainee does not exist substantially,

original: ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor los sgyur ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: because he is the intrinsic reality of possession, like a universal monarch possessing the seven jewels.

original: 'di ni dam bcas pa chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa yin par ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bcas pa chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa yin par ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that the thesis contradicts the intrinsic reality of phenomena.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.

original: dbang nyid dga' mgur byed ces bya ba ni 'dod dgur byed pa nyid yin no //🔽der ni dbang ba nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba bstan pa'i mdo'o //🔽gzhan du ni rdzas yin zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i chos bcu dang ldan pa bstan pa'i mdo'o //
analyzed: dbang nyid dga' mgur byed ces bya ba ni 'dod dgur byed pa nyid yin no // der ni dbang ba nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'khor los sgyur ba bstan pa'i mdo'o // gzhan du ni rdzas yin zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i chos bcu dang ldan pa bstan pa'i mdo'o //
translated: The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.

original: de lta na yang mi rung ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gsung rab las dngos po rdzas su yod pa dang brtags pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bzhed na ji ltar rigs pa ma🔽yi zhes zer ba yin no //🔽slob dpon gyis mi rung ba 'di yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi rung ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gsung rab las dngos po rdzas su yod pa dang brtags pa'i yod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su bzhed na ji ltar rigs pa ma yi zhes zer ba yin no // slob dpon gyis mi rung ba 'di yod de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.

original: 'di na dngos po rdzas su yod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyis @133a * //
analyzed: 'di na dngos po rdzas su yod pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyis @133a * //
translated: The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act as one wishes.🔽The expression “mastery is the ability to act as one wishes” means that mastery is the ability to act

original: gzung bar bya ba'am rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'am rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be apprehended by perception or by inference.

original: de la mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yin te dbang po lngas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yin te dbang po lngas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is apprehended by perception is form, sound, etc., because it is apprehended by the five sense faculties.

original: yid kyis gzung bar bya ba yang cung zad cig mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis gzung bar bya ba yang cung zad cig mngon sum yin te /
translated: That which is apprehended by mental consciousness is also partially perceived,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rang rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment, hatred, etc., are known by self-awareness.🔽The eye, ear, etc., are apprehended by inference because they exist or do not exist when those exist or do not exist,

original: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa ni de dag yod dam med na de dag yod pa dang med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bya bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i
analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa ni de dag yod dam med na de dag yod pa dang med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya ba yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bya bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i
translated: because they are inferred by the activity of eye consciousness, etc.

original: phyir ro // thob pa ni mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin la rjes su dpag par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro // thob pa ni mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yang ma yin la rjes su dpag par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Obtainment is neither apprehended by perception nor by inference.

original: de grub par bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub par bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the inference that proves that is irreproachable.

original: de lta bas na rdzas kyi chos mi srid pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rdzas kyi chos mi srid pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the correct position: “It is not tenable that unconditioned states are things because substantial reality is impossible.”

original: da ni slob dpon gyis phyogs gleng zhing glengs nas sun dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir gal te chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyis phyogs gleng zhing glengs nas sun dbyung bar bya ba'i phyir gal te chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Now, in order to discuss and refute the opponent’s position, Vasubandhu states, “If you say that unconditioned states are things because they are causes of conditioned states,” and so on.

original: gang la thob pa yod pa de ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang la thob pa yod pa de ni rgyu yod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that unconditioned states are things because they are causes of conditioned states, then unconditioned states would not be unconditioned because they would have causes.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin par 'gyur te 'di ltar 'dus ma byas ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin par 'gyur te 'di ltar 'dus ma byas ni bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, unconditioned states would not be unconditioned because they would be generated.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang gang dag sa 'phos pa dang 'dod chags dang bral bas btang ba 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dag ma thob pa rnams dang gang dag sa 'phos pa dang 'dod chags dang bral bas btang ba 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang /
translated: The unconditioned states that are not obtained, such as the perseverance for Dharma knowledge regarding the truth of suffering and so on, and those that are relinquished through changing level or through freedom from attachment, such as the non-defiled states of the desire realm,

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Afflicted and unafflicted states of higher level.

original: de dag ji ltar khams su phyir 'ong ba'am yongs su nyams pas skye bar 'gyur //🔽de dag gi thob pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar khams su phyir 'ong ba'am yongs su nyams pas skye bar 'gyur // de dag gi thob pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: How do they arise in the realm through return or through complete degeneration?

original: ma skyes la 'gag pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni de dag gi skye ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: ma skyes la 'gag pa'i phyir ro // gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni de dag gi skye ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Obtainment does not exist for them because they are not generated and they cease.🔽If it is said that they are generated by the cause of coemergent obtainment, then the context is that they are called generation.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa de'i tshe skye ba gang yin pa de dag skyed par byed pa yin no zhes na /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i thob pa de'i tshe skye ba gang yin pa de dag skyed par byed pa yin no zhes na /
translated: If it is said that coemergent obtainment generates that generation,

original: de'i tshe skye ba'am skyes pa'i skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba'am skyes pa'i skye ba ci zhig byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then what function does generation or the generation of generation perform?

original: ci zhig byed pa'i ngang tshul ni ci zhig byed pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig byed pa'i ngang tshul ni ci zhig byed pa'o //
translated: What is the nature of that which performs a function?

original: skye ba ni mtshan gzhi'i chos skyed par @133b byed la /
analyzed: skye ba ni mtshan gzhi'i chos skyed par @133b byed la /
translated: Generation generates the phenomenon that is the basis of those characteristics.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni mtshan nyid skye ba de skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni mtshan nyid skye ba de skyed par byed do //
translated: The arising of arising causes the generation of the characteristic of arising.

original: des na gal te mtshan gzhi chos rnams kyi skye ba thob pa'i rgyu can yin par brjod na /
analyzed: des na gal te mtshan gzhi chos rnams kyi skye ba thob pa'i rgyu can yin par brjod na /
translated: If you say that the arising of the factors of existence is caused by the acquisition of arising,

original: de la skye ba ci zhig byed //
analyzed: de la skye ba ci zhig byed //
translated: then what does arising do?

original: 'on te mtshan nyid rnams kyi skye ba de'i rgyu can yin par brjod na /🔽de'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: 'on te mtshan nyid rnams kyi skye ba de'i rgyu can yin par brjod na / de'i phyir smras pa //
translated: If you say that the arising of the characteristics is caused by the arising of the factors of existence,

original: skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed ces rtog par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed ces rtog par byed do //
translated: then what does the arising of arising do?

original: yang na gal te khyed skye bas ni chos skyed par byed la /
analyzed: yang na gal te khyed skye bas ni chos skyed par byed la /
translated: Or, if you say that arising causes the generation of the factors of existence,

original: thob pas ni skye ba skyed par byed do zhes zer na de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pas ni skye ba skyed par byed do zhes zer na de'i phyir skye ba'i skye ba ci zhig byed ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: and acquisition causes the generation of arising, then what does the arising of arising do?

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de dag ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de dag ni 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess all the bonds are those who have not abandoned even one type of affliction.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa de dag gi nyon mongs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yang mi 'gyur te thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa de dag gi nyon mongs pa chung du dang 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yang mi 'gyur te thob pa bye brag med pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: The distinction of weak, medium, and strong afflictions would not occur for those who possess all the bonds, because there would be no distinction in their obtainment.

original: 'ching ba ma tshang ba rnams kyi thob pa ma thang ba'i phyir nyin mongs pa chung du dang 'bring po dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yongs su rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te //
analyzed: 'ching ba ma tshang ba rnams kyi thob pa ma thang ba'i phyir nyin mongs pa chung du dang 'bring po dang chen po skye ba'i khyad par du yongs su rtogs par 'gyur gyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te //
translated: The distinction of weak, medium, and strong afflictions would be understood in those who do not possess all the bonds because their obtainment is incomplete, but not for those who possess all the bonds.

original: thob pa rnams 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa rnams 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their obtainment is similar.🔽If it were due to that, then there would be a distinction in that,

original: de las de'i bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni sngon goms pa'am rgyu gzhan de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las de'i bye brag tu 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni sngon goms pa'am rgyu gzhan de las de dag gi bye brag tu 'gyur te /
translated: that distinction would be due to prior habituation or another cause.

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gi ni chen po yin la 'ga' zhig gi ni 'bring yin //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gi ni chen po yin la 'ga' zhig gi ni 'bring yin //
translated: For some who possess all the bonds, the afflictions are strong, for some they are medium, and for some they are weak.

original: 'ga' zhig gi ni chung ngu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi ni chung ngu yin no zhe na /
translated: For some, it is small.

original: nyon mongs pa chung du la sogs pa skye ba tha dad pa'i rgyu de kho na las skye ba yin te de lta bas na thob pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung du la sogs pa skye ba tha dad pa'i rgyu de kho na las skye ba yin te de lta bas na thob pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Afflictions of small, medium, and great types arise from that very cause. Therefore obtainment is not the cause of arising.

original: bye brag tu smra bas de skad du zer zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas de skad du zer zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: It is said that...

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Obtainment is the cause of the classification of sentient beings as possessing this or that.🔽If obtainment did not exist, then those possessing a mundane mind would not exist.

original: thob pa med na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la yod pas na 'jig rten pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa med na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la yod pas na 'jig rten pa yin no //
translated: Mundane means that which exists in the world.

original: yid nyid yin te 'di dag la 'jig rten pa'i yid yod pas na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid nyid yin te 'di dag la 'jig rten pa'i yid yod pas na 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is a mind, and those who possess a mundane mind are those possessing a mundane mind.

original: 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams dang so so'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams dang so so'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: Aryas and ordinary beings are called āryas and ordinary beings.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'phags pa khyad par du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa smos pa ni 'phags pa khyad par du bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase possessing a mundane mind is stated to distinguish āryas.

original: @134a * // so so'i skye bo rnams ni rtag tu 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: @134a * // so so'i skye bo rnams ni rtag tu 'jig rten pa'i yid dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Ordinary worldlings are always accompanied by the mundane mental faculty.

original: yang na 'du shes med pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo khyad par du bya ba yang srid do //🔽'phags pa dang so so'i skye bo de rnams la zhes bya ba drug pa ni dmigs kyis bsal ba 'am /

translated: Or else, in the state of non-perception and in the attainment of non-perception, ordinary worldlings are distinguished.

original: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The sixth case, “among those noble ones and ordinary worldlings,” is a locative of specification or a locative of relationship.🔽The locative of non-existence is the locative of non-possession.🔽The locative of non-possession is the locative of non-establishment.

original: de dag rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ba ni yongs su bcad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ba ni yongs su bcad pa ste /
translated: Non-establishment is the exclusion.

original: gang gis rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de ni thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de ni thob pa yin no //
translated: That by which there is establishment is possession.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dag ni 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag las zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dag ni 'phags pa yin no //
translated: The distinction between those who have abandoned the defilements and those who have not abandoned them, and those who have not abandoned them, is due to the distinction between those who have abandoned the defilements and those who have not abandoned the defilements.🔽Those who have abandoned the defilements are noble ones.

original: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dag ni so so'i skye bo yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa dag ni so so'i skye bo yin no //
translated: Those who have not abandoned the defilements are ordinary worldlings.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is their nature.

original: de nyid bye brag yin pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag yin pas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa nyid kyi bye brag ste /

analyzed: de las 'di rnam par gzhag par 'gyur bar 'os so //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo kha cig kyang nyon mongs pa spangs pa ma yin nam //

analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa der yang ji ltar 'gyur //

analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po nyams par ma byas na'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not abandoning, if the seeds are not burned in the life-cycle, or if the seeds are not destroyed.

translated: That which is abandoned and that which is not abandoned means that which is abandoned by the path of seeing from the level of the desire realm up to the summit of existence, and that which is not abandoned by the path of seeing.
