analyzed: re re zhing rnam pa bzhi ni ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment of each of the four types is not of four types.

original: de'i phyir de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽The obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is active in the desire realm is active in the desire realm.

original: 'dod @138b pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni ci rigs par 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod @138b pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni ci rigs par 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is active in the form realm is active in the form realm.🔽The obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is active in the formless realm is active in the formless realm.🔽The obtainment of nonanalytical cessation that is uncontaminated is uncontaminated.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i gzugs na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The acquisition of the cessation not attained through deliberation that pertains to the form realm, etc. is of the form realm when one is born in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i gzugs med pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i gzugs med pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: The acquisition of the cessation not attained through deliberation that pertains to the formless realm, etc. is of the formless realm when one is born in the formless realm.

original: de'i thob pa ni sems can gyi rgyud kho nas rnam par gzhag gi gang dag la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yod pa de dag gi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i thob pa ni sems can gyi rgyud kho nas rnam par gzhag gi gang dag la so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yod pa de dag gi dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: The acquisition of that is established only by the life stream of sentient beings, not by the power of those who possess the cessation not attained through deliberation.

original: gal te de lta yin par gyur na ni lam gyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin par gyur na ni lam gyi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i thob pa zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, the acquisition of the cessation not attained through deliberation on the path would be uncontaminated.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa ni med de /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang yin la zag pa med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa ni med de /
translated: The analytical cessation of the desire realm is not a cessation obtained by the path of the desire realm because it is not an antidote to the desire realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
translated: That obtained by the path of the form realm is a cessation of the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: That obtained by the path of the formless realm is a cessation of the formless realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: That obtained by the uncontaminated path is an uncontaminated cessation.

original: 'phags pas gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pas gzugs na spyod pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa yin la /
translated: That obtained by the path of the form realm by an ārya is a cessation of the form realm and an uncontaminated cessation.

original: gzugs med pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa yin te //🔽'jig rten pa yid chags bral ba'i //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa yin te // 'jig rten pa yid chags bral ba'i //
translated: That obtained by the path of the formless realm is a cessation of the formless realm and an uncontaminated cessation.🔽The uncontaminated is twofold.🔽The uncontaminated is twofold:🔽cessation and the path.

original: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated is twofold: cessation and the path.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di'i thob pa 'jig rten pa yin pa 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni zag pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di'i thob pa 'jig rten pa yin pa 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the truth of the path is uncontaminated” excludes the possibility that the acquisition of the path is mundane.

original: de ni mdor bsdus te rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdus te rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi 'byung ste /
translated: “ In brief, it is of four types” means that, in brief, the truth of the path is of four types.

original: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'o zhes bshad pa'i don bstan pa khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang zag pa med pa'o zhes bshad pa'i don bstan pa khong du chud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement that the truth of the path is of four types is that it is of four types in terms of realm: it is of the three realms and uncontaminated.

original: slob pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba /🔽slob pa'i chos ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba / slob pa'i chos ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams yin no //
translated: The phrase “the dharmas of those still training” refers to🔽the uncontaminated dharmas of those still training.

original: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i zag pa med @139a * //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i zag pa med @139a * //
translated: The phrase “the dharmas of those beyond training” refers to the uncontaminated dharmas of those beyond training.

original: pa dag yin te 'di dag kyang lam gyis bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dag yin te 'di dag kyang lam gyis bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: These should be regarded as being of the essential nature of the truth of the path.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las gzhan pa rnams ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las gzhan pa rnams ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase “those that are neither of those” refers to the dharmas that are neither of those that are still training nor of those that are beyond training.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi bar ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi bar ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par 'dod do //
translated: up to the unconditioned is neither a learner nor a nonlearner.

original: de dag gi thob pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Obtainment of these is threefold by the distinctions of learner and so on.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are learner, nonlearner and neither learner nor nonlearner.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bos thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pas thob pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bos thob pa'o //
translated: Obtainment by a nonārya is obtainment by an ordinary being.

original: de nyid slob pa'i lam gyis zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid slob pa'i lam gyis zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni slob pa'o //
translated: Obtainment by the learner path is obtainment by the ārya path.

original: mi slob pas thob pa ni mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ste /
analyzed: mi slob pas thob pa ni mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i ste /
translated: Obtainment by the nonlearner is obtainment by the path of the knowledge of elimination.

original: zad pa shes pa ni bral ba'i thob pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa ni bral ba'i thob pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of elimination is the basis of the obtainment of separation.

original: de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de ni slob pa rdo rje lta bus 'thob mod kyi /
analyzed: de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de ni slob pa rdo rje lta bus 'thob mod kyi /
translated: Although it is obtained by the learner vajra like concentration, it is called nonlearner because it is the inducer of that.

original: des thob pa nyid du brjod pa ni slob pas thob pa las mi slob pa'i thob pa khyad par du ma byas par 'gyur bas slob pa des thob pa mi slob pa zhes ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des thob pa nyid du brjod pa ni slob pas thob pa las mi slob pa'i thob pa khyad par du ma byas par 'gyur bas slob pa des thob pa mi slob pa zhes ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “obtained by that” refers to the nonlearner’s obtainment of that which is obtained by the learner, but it does not specify that it is obtained by the learner.

original: de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa de nyid 'phags pa'i lam gyis thob pa ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: That very cessation obtained by the ārya’s path is uncontaminated.

original: lam gyis bden pa'i thob pa zag pa med pa yang zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //🔽'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ci zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin nam //
analyzed: lam gyis bden pa'i thob pa zag pa med pa yang zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro // 'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i thob pa ci zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin nam //
translated: The obtainment of the truth of the path is also uncontaminated.

original: 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin /
translated: Is the obtainment of analytical cessation obtained by the ārya through the mundane path contaminated or uncontaminated?

original: smras pa gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: smras pa gnyi ga yin no //
translated: It is both.

original: de ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why is this not explained?

original: rnam par bshad pa rjes mchad pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rjes mchad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained later.🔽The treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: 'og nas // 'jig rten pa yi chags bral ba'i //
analyzed: 'og nas // 'jig rten pa yi chags bral ba'i //
translated: The obtainment of the mundane path

original: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
analyzed: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
translated: The two types of obtainment of freedom in āryas

original: zhes 'di ston par 'gyur bas mi brjod kyi 'dir ni thob pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de kho na brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'di ston par 'gyur bas mi brjod kyi 'dir ni thob pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de kho na brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since this is taught there, it is not mentioned here. But it should be understood that the obtainment that is mentioned here is only unmixed obtainment.

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de mngon par 'du bya ba med par ldan pas stobs chung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de mngon par 'du bya ba med par ldan pas stobs chung ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because they are weak means they are weak because they are possessed without being manifested.

original: mngon par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni lha'i @139b mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lung du ma bstan pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni lha'i @139b mig gi mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: The two neutral higher perceptions means the higher perception of the divine eye and the higher perception of the divine ear.🔽Except for the mind of emanation.

original: sprul ba'i sems ma gtogs pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: sprul ba'i sems ma gtogs pa ci zhe na /
translated: What?

original: lung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
analyzed: lung bstan min thob lhan cig skye //
translated: Obtained from birth and concomitant.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied.

original: de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha'i mig la sogs pa de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha'i mig la sogs pa de dag go //
translated: Because they are powerful means they are powerful because they are accomplished by the specific preparation of the divine eye and so on.

original: ci zhe na thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: ci zhe na thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: What? The obtainment arises prior to, subsequent to, and simultaneously with it.🔽It is established by the power of special preparation.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas zhes bya ba ni lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The higher perception of divine eye and so on is established by the power of special preparation.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pa de'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pa de'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is established by the power of special preparation, it is powerful.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig tu skye ba yang yin no zhes bya bar don sbyar ro //🔽bzo yi gnas pa kha cig dang // zhes bya ba ni dper na las thams cad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig tu skye ba yang yin no zhes bya bar don sbyar ro // bzo yi gnas pa kha cig dang // zhes bya ba ni dper na las thams cad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since it is powerful, its obtainment arises prior to, subsequent to, and simultaneously with it.🔽Some arts and crafts

original: spyod lam pa dper na gnas brtan rta thul lta bu shin tu goms pa'i ste /
analyzed: spyod lam pa dper na gnas brtan rta thul lta bu shin tu goms pa'i ste /
translated: Some arts and crafts are established by the power of special preparation, for example, all karmic maturation and all that is subsumed by the mind governing demeanor.🔽Demeanor is like the elder Asvajit.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni shin tu dang du gyur bar 'dod do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni shin tu dang du gyur bar 'dod do //
translated: Vaibhasikas assert that it is extremely familiar.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What?

original: thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye bar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thob pa sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye bar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The obtainment arises prior to, subsequent to, and simultaneously with it.

original: bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi 'ang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi 'ang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also form that is obscured.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don yin te lhan cig skye ba yod do zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsdu ba'i don yin te lhan cig skye ba yod do zhes sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word also has the meaning of including, and it includes that which is concomitant.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs de yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs de yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kho na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: That afflicted form should be known as the form of informative action of the first absorption level,

original: de las gzhan pa'i sa dag na ni kun nas slong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sa dag na ni kun nas slong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not motivated by other levels.🔽Also, the great motivating mind does not generate noninformative action through the great motivating mind that generates obscured informative action.

original: chen pos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems chen pos bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed slong ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi sems chen po de nyid kyis kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa slob par mi byed de de bas na stobs chung🔽ba nyid du grub po //
analyzed: chen pos kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems chen pos bsgribs pa'i rnam par rig byed slong ba'i rnam par rig byed kyi sems chen po de nyid kyis kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa slob par mi byed de de bas na stobs chung ba nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established as having little power.

original: stobs chung ba nyid du grub pa de'i phyir thob pa lhan cig skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: stobs chung ba nyid du grub pa de'i phyir thob pa lhan cig skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: Because it is established as having little power, it is obtained only through birth.

original: thob pa'i bye brag zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin la /
analyzed: thob pa'i bye brag zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni lhan cig skye ba yin la /
translated: The obtainment of unobscured neutral form such as that arisen from the ripening of karma is simultaneous with it.

original: mngon par shes pa gnyis la sogs pa'i thob pa ni sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bye brag yin no //🔽'dod pa na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gnyis la sogs pa'i thob pa ni sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skye ba yang yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bye brag yin no // 'dod pa na /
translated: The obtainment of the two higher perceptions and so on is simultaneous with it, prior to it and subsequent to it.🔽Obtainment of desire realm form

original: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba @140a * //🔽med // ces bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba @140a * // med // ces bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: does not arise prior to it.🔽This refers to the obtainment of virtuous and nonvirtuous indicative and nonindicative form that exists in the desire realm.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du sngar skye ba med de //🔽gal te dge ba'i yang rung /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni rnam pa thams cad du sngar skye ba med de // gal te dge ba'i yang rung /
translated: Obtainment never arises prior to it.

original: gal te mi dge ba'i yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba'i yang rung ste /
translated: Obtainment of virtuous or nonvirtuous form

original: med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: does not exist at all.

original: lhan cig skye ba dang phyis skye ba ni yod do zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par sbyar ba ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba dang phyis skye ba ni yod do zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par sbyar ba ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Arising simultaneously and later is possible, as appropriate.

original: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i thob pa ni thog mar lhan cig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i skad cig ma dang po'i thob pa ni thog mar lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: For example, the obtainment of the first moment of indicative and nonindicative form arises simultaneously with it.

original: med pa kho na pa la sogs pa la ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi dus phis skye ba yang yin te /
analyzed: med pa kho na pa la sogs pa la ni skad cig ma de nyid kyi dus phis skye ba yang yin te /
translated: But in the formless realm, it arises later in the second moment and so on.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gi thob pa yang lhan cig skye ba dang dus phyis skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gi thob pa yang lhan cig skye ba dang dus phyis skye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The obtainment of other moments such as the second moment and so on should be understood as arising simultaneously and later.🔽The obtainment of form belonging to the desire realm is not generated in five ways.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kho na'i thob pa lngar skye ba bkag pas bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni dus gsum du skye ba yod do zhes skabs phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs kho na'i thob pa lngar skye ba bkag pas bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni dus gsum du skye ba yod do zhes skabs phye ba yin no //
translated: The obtainment of form belonging to the absorptions and uncontaminated vows is generated in the three times.

original: ci'i phyir ma thob pa rnam pa thams cad du ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma thob pa rnam pa thams cad du ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is non-acquisition always unobscured-non-defined?

original: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ma thob pa nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur na ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa la nyon mongs pa kho na bzhin du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa rnams kyi ma thob pa nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur na ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa la nyon mongs pa kho na bzhin du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-acquisition of the defilements were defiled, then the abandonment of the defilements would not exist, just like the defilements themselves.

original: gal te dge ba yin par gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la yang med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te dge ba yin par gyur na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa la yang med par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were wholesome, then it would not exist in those who have severed the wholesome roots.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa yang zag pa med par gyur pas so so'i skye bo yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa yang zag pa med par gyur pas so so'i skye bo yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And the non-acquisition of the uncontaminated dharmas would be uncontaminated, so one would not be an ordinary being.

original: rtag tu 'phags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu 'phags pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one would always possess the dharmas of the āryas.

original: de bas na shugs kyis ma thob pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na shugs kyis ma thob pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is established by implication that non-acquisition is only unobscured-non-defined.

original: da ltar byung ba'i ma thob pa da ltar byung ba ni med do zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i chos la ni thob pa yod do //🔽de lta bas na 'di la ma thob pa de ltar byung ba med de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i ma thob pa da ltar byung ba ni med do zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i chos la ni thob pa yod do // de lta bas na 'di la ma thob pa de ltar byung ba med de /
translated: The present factor is accompanied by acquisition.

original: de la thob pa dang ma thob pa phrad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la thob pa dang ma thob pa phrad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the non-acquisition of the present does not exist in the present, for it is impossible for acquisition and non-acquisition to coexist.🔽The non-acquisition of the past and future is threefold.🔽The non-acquisition of the wholesome factors acquired through preparatory effort, of the wholesome factors not associated with thought, and of the wholesome factors innate, which have been lost, is past, future and present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yod tan ma thob pa dang / thob nas rnam par nyams pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams dang mig la sogs pa gang @140b la thob pa med pa'i ma thob pa ni 'das pa yang yod la ma 'ongs pa yang yod //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yod tan ma thob pa dang / thob nas rnam par nyams pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams dang mig la sogs pa gang @140b la thob pa med pa'i ma thob pa ni 'das pa yang yod la ma 'ongs pa yang yod //
translated: The non-acquisition of the eye, etc.

original: da ltar byung ba yang yod do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang yod do //
translated: is past, future and present.

original: de dag gi ma thob pa ni rgyun gyi tshul du skye ba yang 'gyur //🔽'gag par yang 'gyur //🔽ma 'ongs pa na 'dug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ma thob pa ni rgyun gyi tshul du skye ba yang 'gyur //🔽'gag par yang 'gyur //🔽ma 'ongs pa na 'dug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-acquisition of these factors arises, ceases and exists in the future.

original: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, those belonging to the desire realm, etc., and the uncontaminated.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” is used because it is connected with the three types.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa gtogs shig ma bral ba ni 'dod sogs gtogs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa gtogs shig ma bral ba ni 'dod sogs gtogs so //
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm, etc., and not belonging to any realm are those belonging to the desire realm, etc.

original: 'dod pa la sogs par gtogs pa rnams dang / dri ma med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs par gtogs pa rnams dang / dri ma med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The non-acquisition of those belonging to the desire realm, etc., and the uncontaminated is of three types.

original: de ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is established by the power of the basis of birth.

original: ma thob pa ni chos dang lhan cig gnas pa can ma yin pas thob pa bzhin du chos kyi dbang gis ni rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: ma thob pa ni chos dang lhan cig gnas pa can ma yin pas thob pa bzhin du chos kyi dbang gis ni rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Since non-acquisition does not coexist with the dharma, it is not established by the power of the dharma, as is acquisition.

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the non-acquisition of those belonging to the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, and the uncontaminated dharmas, is belonging to the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //
translated: That which is produced in the form realm is form-sphere.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin te /
translated: That which is produced in the formless realm is formless-sphere.

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na skye bas thob pa rnams kyi ma thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma thob pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na skye bas thob pa rnams kyi ma thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma thob pa dang /
translated: For example, the nonobtainment of the qualities derived from preparation that arise in the desire realm, the nonobtainment of those obtained from birth that arise in the state of severed virtue, the nonobtainment of the nonvirtuous and neutral states of the form and formless realms that arise in the desire realm,

original: so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir zag pa med pa rnams kyi ma thob pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: and the nonobtainment of uncontaminated states that arise in the desire realm are desire-sphere states because one is an ordinary being.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sa 'phos pas btang ba rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs nas spyod pa sa 'phos pas btang ba rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sbyor ba las byung @141a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sa 'phos pas btang ba rnams dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa yin no // de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i 'dod pa dang / gzugs nas spyod pa sa 'phos pas btang ba rnams dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sbyor ba las byung @141a * //
translated: Similarly, the nonobtainment of the qualities of the form realm that are relinquished by changing level when one is born in the form realm, the qualities of the form and formless realms that arise from preparation and the ārya dharmas because one is an ordinary being is form realm nonobtainment.🔽Similarly, the nonobtainment of the qualities of the desire and form realms that are relinquished by changing level when one is born in the formless realm, the qualities of the formless realm that arise from preparation

original: ba'i yon tan rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ba'i yon tan rnams dang / so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and the ārya dharmas because one is an ordinary being is formless realm nonobtainment.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is an ordinary being?

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba bstan bcos las 'byung ba 'dis ni ma thob pa la zag pa med pa nyid med par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba bstan bcos las 'byung ba 'dis ni ma thob pa la zag pa med pa nyid med par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This passage demonstrates that non-acquisition is not uncontaminated.🔽With regard to the question, “By which arya dharmas is there non-acquisition?”

original: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gis ma rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste /🔽zag pa med pa'i lam thams cad yin pas de'i phyir de skad du 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos gang dag gis ma rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i chos ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste / zag pa med pa'i lam thams cad yin pas de'i phyir de skad du 'dri'o //
translated: Arya dharmas are all uncontaminated paths, beginning with perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.🔽Therefore, the question is asked in that way.

original: thams cad kyi yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi yin te /
translated: The answer is, “It is the non-acquisition of all of them.”

original: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa nas mi slob pa'i ye shes la thug pa'i bar rnams kyi ma rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med par 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa nas mi slob pa'i ye shes la thug pa'i bar rnams kyi ma rnyed pa yin te /
translated: The non-acquisition of all of them, from perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering to the knowledge of nonarising, is the non-acquisition of all arya dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not specified.

original: gal te de lta na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes kyang 'phags pa'i lam lhag ma rnams kyi ma rnyed pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes kyang 'phags pa'i lam lhag ma rnams kyi ma rnyed pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then even though perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering has arisen, since the remaining arya paths have not been obtained, one would not be an ārya.

original: de lta bas na rnyed pa med par gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnyed pa med par gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: Therefore the root text says, “It is the nonobtainment of that.”

original: rnyed pa med par ma rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa med par ma rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The nonobtainment of that is called an ordinary being.🔽If that were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'phags pa'i chos rnyed kyang 'phags pa'i chos gzhan dag gi ma rnyed pa so so'i skye bo nyid yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te 'phags pa'i chos rnyed kyang 'phags pa'i chos gzhan dag gi ma rnyed pa so so'i skye bo nyid yin par 'dod na /
translated: if the nonobtainment of other arya dharmas were asserted to be an ordinary being,

original: sangs rgyas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'phags pa'i chos dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'phags pa'i chos dag dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then a buddha would not be an ārya because he does not possess the ārya dharmas that exist in the mindstreams of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ma rnyed pa 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa 'ba' zhig smos na ni 'di lta bur thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If only nonobtainment were mentioned, such a consequence would follow.

original: 'o na ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rnyed pa kho na'o zhes kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra gdon dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rnyed pa kho na'o zhes kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra gdon dgos so //
translated: But then the word “only” must be supplied, “The attainment of the noble dharmas is only the attainment of the noble path.”

original: tshig gcig pu dag kyang nges par 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig pu dag 'ba' zhig kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig gcig pu dag kyang nges par 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig pu dag 'ba' zhig kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even a single word can have the sense of “only.”

original: dper na chu 'thung ba'o //🔽rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chu kho na 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: dper na chu 'thung ba'o // rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chu kho na 'thung ba'o //
translated: For example, “drinking water”🔽and “eating wind”🔽Even though it is not said that “only water is drunk”

original: rlung kho na za ba'o zhes ma brjod kyang kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang rtogs par 'gyur ba ltar 'dir @141b yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rlung kho na za ba'o zhes ma brjod kyang kho na zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yang rtogs par 'gyur ba ltar 'dir @141b yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: and “only wind is eaten,” the sense of “only” is understood.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ni ji ltar gang zhig chu kho na 'thung bar byed pa de ni chu 'thung ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ni ji ltar gang zhig chu kho na 'thung bar byed pa de ni chu 'thung ba yin la /
translated: In one way, “drinking water” means that only water is drunk.

original: gang zhig rlung kho na za bar byed pa de ni rlung za yin no zhes 'dir kho na zhes bya ba mngon par bstan pa nyid kyi nges par 'dzin pa'i don go bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang zhig rlung kho na za bar byed pa de ni rlung za yin no zhes 'dir kho na zhes bya ba mngon par bstan pa nyid kyi nges par 'dzin pa'i don go bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the term “only” is understood to have the sense of restriction,

original: 'dir yang ma rnyed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang ma rnyed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: so here also it means “not finding anything else.”

original: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi'o zhes zer ro zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Others say: It is the non-acquisition of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering and those occurring simultaneously with it.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin no //
translated: The non-acquisition of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering and the phenomena that occur simultaneously with it, such as feeling, is the state of an ordinary being.

original: phyogs 'di la ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes kyang 'phags pa'i chos lhag ma rnams kyi ma thob pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa smras pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes kyang 'phags pa'i chos lhag ma rnams kyi ma thob pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes nyes pa smras pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this case, the error that one would not be an ārya because one would not obtain the remaining ārya dharmas even though perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering has arisen would not occur.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe 'bras bu thob pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams par nyams par 'gyur bas 'bras bu thob pa ni 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su🔽spang pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe 'bras bu thob pa de'i tshe sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams par nyams par 'gyur bas 'bras bu thob pa ni 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i nyes pa yang yongs su spang pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Objection: But when one obtains a result, one would not be an ārya because perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and that which arises simultaneously with it would degenerate.

original: de dag btang bas bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag btang bas 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag btang bas bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba de dag btang bas 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Reply: To completely abandon that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and that which arises simultaneously with it does not cause the error of not being an ārya.

original: de dag gi ma rnyed pa gtan du bcom pa'i phyir ma rnyed pa de shin tu rnam par nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ma rnyed pa gtan du bcom pa'i phyir ma rnyed pa de shin tu rnam par nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nonobtainment of those is completely destroyed and that nonobtainment is completely degenerated.

original: 'di ji ltar gtan du bcom pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gtan du bcom pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it destroyed forever?

original: de'i rgyud la yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise again in his life stream.

original: 'o na ni de dag kyang rigs gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de dag kyang rigs gsum pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin na /
translated: But then they also have three lineages, i.e., the lineages of the sravaka, pratyekabuddha, and buddha.

original: gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin //
analyzed: gang dag gi ma rnyed pa yin //
translated: Whose lineages are not obtained?

original: thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi yin no //
translated: All of them, i.e., the lineages of the sravaka, etc.

original: 'o na ni nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis kyang rigs gsum char ma rnyed pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o na ni nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyis kyang rigs gsum char ma rnyed pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But then the same fault arises, i.e., even the Buddha would not be an arya, because he does not obtain all three lineages.

original: lan yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du de ni rnyed pa med pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dper na chu 'thung ba'o rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: lan yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du de ni rnyed pa med pa gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba nas rgyas par dper na chu 'thung ba'o rlung za ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: The answer is the same as before: “That is the non-obtainment of what?” It is the non-obtainment of the three lineages of the sravaka, etc., in the life stream of the Buddha.

original: 'o na ni 'bad pa don med pa @142a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bad pa don med pa @142a * //
translated: But then striving is pointless.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i lhag ma 'phags pa'i chos gzhan gyi ma rnyed pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di spang pa'i phyir bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi ma rnyed pa rnams ni so
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'i lhag ma 'phags pa'i chos gzhan gyi ma rnyed pa yod pas 'phags pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di spang pa'i phyir bzod pa dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kyi ma rnyed pa rnams ni so
translated: The term “indeed” is stated to refute the idea that one would not be an ārya because one does not obtain the remaining ārya dharmas.

original: so'i skye bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa gang yin pa de ni don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: so'i skye bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i 'bad pa gang yin pa de ni don med par 'gyur te /
translated: The effort to prove that the nonacquisition of perseverance and the dharmas that arise simultaneously with it is the state of an ordinary being is pointless.

original: 'di ni phyogs snga ma'i nyes pa spong ba kho na la 'bad pa byed par zad do //🔽'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba ni 'di la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa yod pas na 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs snga ma'i nyes pa spong ba kho na la 'bad pa byed par zad do // 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba ni 'di la 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa yod pas na 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i rgyud ni so so'i skye bo nyid yin te /
translated: This is because the opponent is only trying to refute the fault of the former position.🔽The term “the stream in which ārya dharmas have not arisen” means that the state of an ordinary being is the stream in which ārya dharmas have not arisen because ārya dharmas have not arisen in it.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa'i phung po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with the stream in which the aggregates in which ārya dharmas have not arisen are present.

original: shugs kyis na 'phags pa'i chos rnams skyes pa'i rgyud ni 'phags pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis na 'phags pa'i chos rnams skyes pa'i rgyud ni 'phags pa nyid yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: and by implication, the stream in which the noble dharmas have arisen is noble.

original: gnas gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the transformation of the basis.

original: yang ma thob pa 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ma thob pa gleng bar byed pa yin gyi 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ma thob pa 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ma thob pa gleng bar byed pa yin gyi 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: How is it that one does not obtain this? One does not obtain all dharmas, not just the non-obtainment of the noble dharmas.

original: re zhig 'di lta ste zhes bya ba 'di ni dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di lta ste zhes bya ba 'di ni dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: For example, is an example.

original: de ni rnyed pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni rnyed pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
translated: It is lost through acquisition.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so so'i skye bo nyid de ni 'phags pa'i lam de rnyed pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so so'i skye bo nyid de ni 'phags pa'i lam de rnyed pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of an ordinary man, which is characterized by non-acquisition, is lost through the acquisition of the noble path.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid de khams gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid de khams gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: To which realm does this nature of an ordinary man belong?

original: kha cig na re khams gsum pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re khams gsum pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say it belongs to the three realms.

original: ma rnyed pa ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa ni skye ba'i rten gyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't non-acquisition established by the power of the basis of birth?

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang ma rnyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang ma rnyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: The nature of an ordinary being is not found.

original: da lta bas na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na'i so so'i skye bo nyid yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da lta bas na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la ni 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na'i so so'i skye bo nyid yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the state of an ordinary being that exists in the desire realm is only an ordinary being who exists in the desire realm, it is not an ordinary being who exists in the form and formless realms.

original: de'i phyir khams gsum pa yin pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur bas 'di ni rung ba ma yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khams gsum pa yin pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur bas 'di ni rung ba ma yin par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, since the state of an ordinary being would be impaired, it would not exist in the three realms.

original: 'on te de mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i phyir de khams gsum pa rnam par nyams so zhes nye bar btags te rtogs pa yin na ni //
analyzed: 'on te de mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i phyir de khams gsum pa rnam par nyams so zhes nye bar btags te rtogs pa yin na ni //
translated: But if you impute and understand that the state of an ordinary being is impaired because it does not arise in the three realms,

original: de ni yin du zad de 'di ni mi 'gog go /
analyzed: de ni yin du zad de 'di ni mi 'gog go /
translated: then that is so, but this is not refuted.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo gcig kho na'i thob pa yod la de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na rnam par @142b nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo gcig kho na'i thob pa yod la de ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na rnam par @142b nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: It is known that the obtainment of an ordinary being who exists in the desire realm is impaired in the state of the supreme mundane state.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu ba la spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu ba la spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Further, it is abandoned on the ninth liberated path free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'phags pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu skyes ba'i sa so na yod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi thob pa ni 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i mthu kho nas skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'phags pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu skyes ba'i sa so na yod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi thob pa ni 'phags pa'i lam thob pa'i mthu kho nas skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The obtainment of ordinary beings existing on each level in the form and formless realms is not generated by the power of obtaining the ārya path alone.

original: de dag ni so sor rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la spong par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni so sor rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa la spong par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are abandoned on the ninth liberated path.

original: sa 'phos pa las zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas te bsam gtan dang por 'phos pa de'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so sor skye bo nyid de rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa 'phos pa las zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas te bsam gtan dang por 'phos pa de'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i so sor skye bo nyid de rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Objection: When one who is free from attachment to the desire realm transfers to the first absorption, the state of an ordinary being that operates in the desire realm degenerates.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i so so'i skye bo nyid skye ba'i phyir 'phags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i so so'i skye bo nyid skye ba'i phyir 'phags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not an ārya because the state of an ordinary being of the level of the first absorption is generated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su sa 'phos pas gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su sa 'phos pas gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, when one transmigrates to the formless realm, the state of ordinary being of the form realm is lost.

original: sa gong ma nas sa 'og mar 'phos pas kyang sa gong ma ba'i so so'i skye bo rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma nas sa 'og mar 'phos pas kyang sa gong ma ba'i so so'i skye bo rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when one transmigrates from a higher to a lower stage, the state of ordinary being of the higher stage is lost.🔽The same should be applied to others.

original: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyi thob pas ma thob pa so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar ba de bzhin du thob pa dang bsams pa las byung
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyi thob pas ma thob pa so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyar ba de bzhin du thob pa dang bsams pa las byung
translated: Just as it is said that the state of ordinary being that is not obtained is lost through obtaining the ārya path, so too, the state of ordinary being that is obtained is lost through obtaining the uncontaminated state.

original: ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba yang sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The same should be applied to other phenomena such as those that arise from the cause of obtainment, those that arise from the cause of intention, and so on.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa'i rnyed pa ni thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ma thob pa'i rnyed pa ni thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: The obtainment of Dharma that is not obtained, such as Dharma derived from hearing and contemplation that is experienced in the desire realm, is relinquished by obtaining it.

original: skye bar thob pa'i dge ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i ma thob pa yang thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar thob pa'i dge ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i ma thob pa yang thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nonobtainment of virtue obtained from birth is relinquished by obtaining it.

original: sa 'phos pa'i las ni gang gi tshe 'di 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos te bsam gtan dang por skye bas 'pho ba de'i tshe de'i sa pa 'gro bas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams kyi ma thob pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur te 'gro ba dag ni nyon
analyzed: sa 'phos pa'i las ni gang gi tshe 'di 'dod pa'i khams nas shi 'phos te bsam gtan dang por skye bas 'pho ba de'i tshe de'i sa pa 'gro bas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams kyi ma thob pa rnam par nyams par 'gyur te 'gro ba dag ni nyon
translated: The karma of changing level is when one dies in the desire realm and is born in the first absorption, at that time the nonobtainment of the aggregates subsumed by the desire realm is relinquished because the desire realm is relinquished.

original: mongs pa can ma yin zhing lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /🔽lung @143a * //🔽bstan nam 'thob lhan cig skye //
analyzed: mongs pa can ma yin zhing lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur la / lung @143a * // bstan nam 'thob lhan cig skye //
translated: It is explained that the realms are not afflicted and are neutral alone.

original: zhes kyang bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes kyang bshad zin to //
translated: It is also explained that the obtainment of the neutral is obtained simultaneously.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyi ma thob pa ni thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i sbyor ba las byung ba rnams kyi ma thob pa ni thob pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, the nonacquisition of those qualities that arise from the preparatory stage of the first absorption is lost through obtaining that which was not previously obtained.

original: sa 'phos pa las ni sa gong ma pa 'gro bas bsdus pa'i sa der 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa 'phos pa las ni sa gong ma pa 'gro bas bsdus pa'i sa der 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nonacquisition of those qualities that are subsumed by the higher level is lost through relocating to that level.

original: kha cig gi sa 'pho ba rnam par bshad pa dper brjod pa 'di ni bye brag tu ma phyed par blta ste /
analyzed: kha cig gi sa 'pho ba rnam par bshad pa dper brjod pa 'di ni bye brag tu ma phyed par blta ste /
translated: This example of the explanation of relocation should be understood without distinction.

original: sa gong mas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams kyi ma thob pa ni sa 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: sa gong mas bsdus pa'i phung po rnams kyi ma thob pa ni sa 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: The nonacquisition of the aggregates subsumed by the higher level is not only lost through relocating to that level.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de thob pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: de thob pas kyang yin no //
translated: It is also lost through obtaining that which was not previously obtained.

original: dper brjod pa 'di ni ma 'chol bar blta ste /
analyzed: dper brjod pa 'di ni ma 'chol bar blta ste /
translated: This example should be understood without distinction.

original: 'di lta ste bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams kyi ma thob pa ni de dag ma thob pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la yod la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan rnams kyi ma thob pa ni de dag ma thob pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams la yod la /
translated: For example, the nonacquisition of the qualities that arise from the preparatory stage of the second absorption and so on exists for sentient beings who are not born in the desire realm.

original: de gal te 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas nas bsam gtan dang por skye na /
analyzed: de gal te 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral bar byas nas bsam gtan dang por skye na /
translated: If one becomes free from attachment to the desire realm and is born in the first absorption,

original: de dag gi ma thob pa de ni sa 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ma thob pa de ni sa 'phos pas rnam par nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nonobtainment of those is relinquished through changing level.

original: de dag gi bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i thob pa ni skye ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba'i thob pa ni skye ba kho na ste /
translated: The obtainment of the first absorption is obtained through birth.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gi yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gi yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the others.

original: de lta na thob pa rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i yang thob pa yod la de'i yang gzhan de'i yang gzhan yod pas thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na thob pa rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i yang thob pa yod la de'i yang gzhan de'i yang gzhan yod pas thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: Obtainment would be infinite because the obtainment of obtainment exists and the obtainment of that exists and the obtainment of that exists and so on.

original: phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan pas thob pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: phan tshun ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan pas thob pa dang ldan la /
translated: Obtainment is infinite because they possess each other.

original: thob pa dang ldan pas ni thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thob pa dang ldan pas ni thob pa'i thob pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Obtainment possesses obtainment and obtainment possesses the obtainment of obtainment.

original: thob pa skyes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ni //
analyzed: thob pa skyes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ni //
translated: Obtainment arises and ceases.

original: thob pa skyes pas chos sam sems de dang yang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: thob pa skyes pas chos sam sems de dang yang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: One also possesses that dharma or mind due to the generation of obtainment.

original: thob pa'i thob pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i thob pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One also possesses the obtainment of obtainment.

original: thob pa'i thob pa skyes pas thob pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i thob pa skyes pas thob pa kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One possesses only obtainment due to the generation of the obtainment of obtainment.

original: de ltar na thob pa ni gnyi ga la bya pa byed la thob pa'i thob pa ni gcig la yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na thob pa ni gnyi ga la bya pa byed la thob pa'i thob pa ni gcig la yin te /
translated: Thus obtainment performs its function in both cases, but the obtainment of obtainment performs its function in one case.

original: de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no infinite regress.

original: dge ba yang rung nyon mongs pa can yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyi thob pa sngar skye ba dang dus phyis skye ba yod pa'i phyir smos pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba yang rung nyon mongs pa can yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyi thob pa sngar skye ba dang dus phyis skye ba yod pa'i phyir smos pa yin te /
translated: Both virtuous and afflicted states are mentioned because the obtainment of these two can arise earlier or later.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i thob @143b pa ni lhan cig skye ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i thob @143b pa ni lhan cig skye ba kho na yin no //
translated: Obtainment of neutral states arises simultaneously.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la chos de dang de'i thob pa dang thob pa'i thob pa dag ces bya ba thob pa gsum skye ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la chos de dang de'i thob pa dang thob pa'i thob pa dag ces bya ba thob pa gsum skye ste /
translated: In the second moment, three obtainments arise: the obtainment of that dharma, the obtainment of the obtainment of that dharma, and the obtainment of the obtainment of the obtainment of that dharma.

original: thob pa dag dang ldan pas de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa dag dang ldan pas de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One possesses those obtainments.

original: yang thob pa gsum po de dag dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir thob pa'i thob pa gsum skye ste /
analyzed: yang thob pa gsum po de dag dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir thob pa'i thob pa gsum skye ste /
translated: Again, in order to possess those three obtainments, three obtainments of obtainment arise.

original: thob pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are six obtainments.

original: skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa las skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni chos dang bcas pa dang rdzas dgu'i thob pa dgu po rjes kyi thob pa dang bcas pas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa las skyes pa'i rdzas rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni chos dang bcas pa dang rdzas dgu'i thob pa dgu po rjes kyi thob pa dang bcas pas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The substances generated in the first and second moments are nine substances, including the nine obtainments of dharmas and substances, together with subsequent obtainment.🔽Thus there are eighteen.

original: de ltar thob pa rnams gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thob pa rnams kyi skad cig ma gong nas gong du spel ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar thob pa rnams gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thob pa rnams kyi skad cig ma gong nas gong du spel ba'am /
translated: In that way, the obtainments increase in the later moments.

original: thob pa rnams skad cig ma gong nas gong du spel ba ste de'i 'gres ni gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres so //
analyzed: thob pa rnams skad cig ma gong nas gong du spel ba ste de'i 'gres ni gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres so //
translated: Those obtained increase from one instant to the next.🔽The pattern of increase from one instant to the next is as follows.

original: gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres des thob pa 'di dag bskyed na'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du spel ba'i 'gres des thob pa 'di dag bskyed na'o //
translated: If those obtained are generated by the pattern of increase from one instant to the next,

original: phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste /🔽skad cig ma bzhi pa la ni skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa'i chos dang thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa dag dang bcas pa gsum yang yod la skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa'i phyis kyi thob pa
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig bstan par bya ste / skad cig ma bzhi pa la ni skad cig ma dang po la skyes pa'i chos dang thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa dag dang bcas pa gsum yang yod la skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyes pa'i thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa'i phyis kyi thob pa
translated: I will teach just a fraction of that.🔽In the fourth moment, there are three that arise in the first moment together with dharmas, obtainment and subsequent obtainment,

original: dang ldan pa drug kyang yod do //
analyzed: dang ldan pa drug kyang yod do //
translated: and there are six that possess obtainment and subsequent obtainment that arise in the second moment.🔽Similarly, there are eighteen that possess obtainment and subsequent obtainment that arise in the third moment.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gsum pa la skyes pa'i thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa phyis kyi thob pa dang ldan pa bco brgyad kyang yod pas skad cig ma bzhi pa la ni skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la skyes pa
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gsum pa la skyes pa'i thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa phyis kyi thob pa dang ldan pa bco brgyad kyang yod pas skad cig ma bzhi pa la ni skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la skyes pa
translated: Therefore, in the fourth moment, there are

original: rnams kyi thob pa nyi shu rtsa bdun rjes kyi thob pa de snyed dang bcas na thob pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽skad cig ma lnga pa la ni skad cig ma dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la skyes pa rnams kyi thob pa dang rjes kyi thob pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi dang skad cig ma bzhi pa la skyes pa rnams kyi thob pa dang rjes kyi thob

translated: If we add the obtainment of these twenty-seven and their subsequent obtainment, then forty-four obtainments arise.🔽In the fifth moment, there are fifty-four obtainments and subsequent obtainments of those arising in the first, second and third moments, and there are two groups of fifty-four obtainments and subsequent obtainments of those arising in the fourth moment.

original: pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa phrag gnyis yod pas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa phrag gsum ste /
analyzed: pa lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa phrag gnyis yod pas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi pa phrag gsum ste /
translated: Thus there are three groups of fifty-four,

original: thob pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thob pa brgya drug cu rtsa gnyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: and one hundred and sixty-two obtainments arise.

original: de ltar gong nas gong du spel ba'i bsgre bas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du spel ba'i bsgre bas brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be expressed by the multiplication of the above.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba 'dir da ltar byung ba ma smos pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin @144a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba 'dir da ltar byung ba ma smos pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin @144a * //
translated: Here, the term present is not mentioned in the expression past and future because it is not definite.

original: rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not definite because it is not obtained.

original: skyes nas thob pa zhes bya ba 'dir sbyor ba las byung ba ma smos pa yang gdon mi za ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽// / bam po bcu bzhi pa //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa zhes bya ba 'dir sbyor ba las byung ba ma smos pa yang gdon mi za ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir / // / bam po bcu bzhi pa //
translated: The term “obtained from birth” is used here because it is not necessarily the case that the term “obtained from preparation” is used.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni srog chags gcig la yang skad cig skad cig la yang thog med pa dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa rnams kyis thob pa mtha' yas shing tshad med pa dag skye bar
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni srog chags gcig la yang skad cig skad cig la yang thog med pa dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor bar gtogs pa rnams kyis thob pa mtha' yas shing tshad med pa dag skye bar
translated: The phrase “in beginningless and endless saṃsāra” means that in each instant of time, there are infinite and immeasurable objects that are obtained by sentient beings who have been in saṃsāra from beginningless time.

original: 'gyur na mang po rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur na mang po rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “what need is there to speak of many” means that this is so for each sentient being, not to mention many sentient beings.

original: rdzas mtha' yas pa nyid ni thob pa'i rdzas mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzas mtha' yas pa nyid ni thob pa'i rdzas mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “infinite substances” means “infinite substances of obtainment.”

original: kye ma 'di ni thob pa rnams kyi dga' sten chen po zhig ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsting ba yin no //
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni thob pa rnams kyi dga' sten chen po zhig ste zhes bya ba 'di ni bsting ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “Oh, what a great feast of obtainment” is a sarcastic remark.

original: stes te thob pa rnams gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stes te thob pa rnams gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtainment is not a substance because it is not a form.

original: thogs pa med pas 'di ltar go skabs rnyed do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pas 'di ltar go skabs rnyed do //
translated: Since it is not impeded, it finds an opportunity to function.

original: skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
translated: Similarity of sentient beings is similarity of status.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la skal ba bsten pa mtshungs pa yod pas na skal ba mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la skal ba bsten pa mtshungs pa yod pas na skal ba mnyam pa'o //
translated: They are called “similar status” because they possess a similar reliance on status.

original: de'i ngo bo ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the similarity of status.

original: yang na skal ba bsten pa mtshungs pas na skal ba mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na skal ba bsten pa mtshungs pas na skal ba mnyam pa'o //
translated: Or, they are similar status because they possess a similar reliance on status.

original: de nyid skal ba mnyam pa nyid dang dang ldan pas skal ba mnyam par 'gyur ba de ni rdzas yin no //
analyzed: de nyid skal ba mnyam pa nyid dang dang ldan pas skal ba mnyam par 'gyur ba de ni rdzas yin no //
translated: That itself is the similarity of status.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba ni spyi ste mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba ni spyi ste mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Similarity of sentient beings is a generality, that is, a universal.

original: sems can smos pa ni sems can ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can smos pa ni sems can ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term sentient being is mentioned to exclude non-sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams dang sems can du bgrang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'dra ba ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang sems can du bgrang ba'i chos rnams kyi 'dra ba ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid yin gyi //
translated: The similarity of sentient beings and phenomena that are counted as sentient beings is the similarity of status.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa dag gi ni yin par mi 'dod do /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa dag gi ni yin par mi 'dod do /
translated: But it is not asserted that the similarity of non-sentient beings such as rice, barley, and so on is the similarity of status.

original: bstan bcos las ni 'di'i ming ris mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa las ni ris mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'dis sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa gang yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni 'di'i ming ris mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa las ni ris mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'dis sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa gang yin pa bstan to //
translated: The treatise mentions the name “homogeneous character”🔽The treatise, such as the Yogācārabhūmi, mentions the name “homogeneous character” to indicate that which is not associated with mind.

original: 'dir ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ming 'dis bstan to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshigs su bcad pa bsdebs pa dang mthun par skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ming 'dis bstan to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Here, the name “homogeneous character” is mentioned in accordance with the meter of the verse.🔽It is also nondifferent and different.

original: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang tha dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la yod pa gang yin pa de ni sems can re re @144b zhing gzhan dang gzhan yin yang 'dra ba'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang tha dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la yod pa gang yin pa de ni sems can re re @144b zhing gzhan dang gzhan yin yang 'dra ba'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o
translated: That which exists in all sentient beings is called “nondifferent,” because it is similar in each sentient being, even though it is different from each.

original: // de ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi lta bu gcig pu dang rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: // de ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi lta bu gcig pu dang rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the Vaiśeṣikas’ principle, which is singular and permanent.

original: tha dad pa ni kha cig la ni yod la kha cig la ni med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni kha cig la ni yod la kha cig la ni med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The difference is that some have it and some do not.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa la ni zhas bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa la ni zhas bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail: “The difference is that some have it and some do not.”

original: khams ni 'dod pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: khams ni 'dod pa la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The realms are the three: desire, form, and formless.

original: gro ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gro ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The destinies are the five: hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, and humans.

original: skye gnas ni sgo nga la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: skye gnas ni sgo nga la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The birth processes are the four: womb, egg, moisture, and spontaneous.

original: rigs ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni bram ze la sogs pa'o //
translated: The castes are the four: Brahmin, Warrior, Merchant, and Laborer.

analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dge bsnyen ma dang dge slong ma dang sleb pa yang ma yin pa mi slob pa yang ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdus pas so //
translated: The term “etc.” includes the upasaka, bhikshu, neither-trainee-nor-post-trainee, and so on.

original: phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni phung po'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid nas chos kyi khams kyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang khams kyi sgo nas so zhes bya ba ni phung po'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid nas chos kyi khams kyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi bar yin no //

analyzed: khyad par med par zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bo yin no //
