analyzed: par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: According to them, one should say, “If you assert that the realms that are mutually distinct are undifferentiated, then the cognition and designation of the realms as distinct would not occur.”

original: 'chi 'pho bar yar yang 'gyur zhing skye bar yang 'gyur la sems can gyi skal ba mnyam par nyid 'dor bar yang mi 'gyur 'thob par yang mi 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid de mi nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The sentient beings’ homogeneity is the homogeneity of sentient beings, which is characterized by being a human and so on.

analyzed: sems can smos pa @145a * //
translated: The term sentient being is mentioned

analyzed: ni chos las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: in order to distinguish it from the homogeneity of phenomena.

analyzed: mu bzhi pa 'dir ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid brjod par 'dod pa yin gyi chos kyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: In this fourth alternative, the homogeneity of sentient beings is intended, not the homogeneity of factors.

original: 'dir ni sems can sems can zhes bya ba'i rnam pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang yin par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems can sems can zhes bya ba'i rnam pa'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang yin par mi 'dod de //
translated: And here, the homogeneity of the class of sentient beings, which is called “sentient being,” is not accepted.

original: gal te de yin par 'dod par gyur na sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid de ni 'gro ba 'phos kyang de'i so na 'dug pa'i phyir mu gsum pa grub par mi 'gyur ro //

translated: If it were accepted, then the homogeneity of sentient beings would not be established as the third alternative, because it would remain even when transmigrating to another realm.

original: mu bzhi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mu bzhi zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the fourth alternative,

original: de nyid du skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid du skye ba na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “when born in that very realm” means

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: that, for example,

original: mi'i gro ba nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: mi'i gro ba nas shi 'phos te /
translated: having died and transmigrated from the human realm,

original: mi'i 'gro ba kho nar skye ba na 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho bar yag 'gyur zhing de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur la 'dis mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor ba yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba kho nar skye ba na 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho bar yag 'gyur zhing de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur la 'dis mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid 'dor ba yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: One does not abandon the human universal characteristic,

original: 'thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor does one acquire it,

original: mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid de de'i so na 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid de de'i so na 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that human universal characteristic remains as it is.🔽The second is when one enters the certainty of perfection,

original: gnyis pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa na ste zhes bya ba ni des ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid de so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid 'dod zhing 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan 'thob bo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nges pa la 'jug pa na ste zhes bya ba ni des ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid de so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid 'dod zhing 'phags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan 'thob bo //
translated: because one who enters the certainty of perfection abandons the universal characteristic of sentient beings that has the nature of an ordinary being and acquires another that has the nature of an ārya.

original: gsum pa ni 'gro ba 'pho ba las so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'gro ba 'pho ba las so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is from the transmigration of realms.

original: mi'i 'gro ba nas shi 'phos te lha'i 'gro bar skye ba na de bzhin du 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho bar yang 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba nas shi 'phos te lha'i 'gro bar skye ba na de bzhin du 'chi ba'i phyir 'chi 'pho bar yang 'gyur zhing //
translated: When one dies and transmigrates from the human realm and is born in the god realm, one dies and transmigrates, because one dies.

original: de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid du nying mtshams sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir skye bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: It would also be born, because it would possess the linking consciousness.

original: sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'dor bar yang 'gyur zhing lha'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzhan 'thob par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'dor bar yang 'gyur zhing lha'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gzhan 'thob par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also discard the essential nature of the human essential nature of sentient beings and acquire the essential nature of another essential nature of the gods.🔽The fourth is that which is not included in those categories.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam par de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i mu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam par de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i mu'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is not included in the essential nature of the alternatives that were previously explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: so so'i skye bo'am 'phags pa gson pos cung zad kyang mi thob pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'am 'phags pa gson pos cung zad kyang mi thob pa lta bu'o //
translated: an ordinary being or an ārya who is alive does not obtain anything at all.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdza zhig yod na go so so'i skye bo nyid kyis ci zhig bya ste zhes bya ba ni mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdza zhig yod na go so so'i skye bo nyid kyis ci zhig bya ste zhes bya ba ni mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: If there were a real entity called the essential nature of an ordinary being, what would be the point of ordinary being itself?

original: so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kho nas so so'i skye bo zhes bya bar yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kho nas so so'i skye bo zhes bya bar yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The state of ordinary beings is established as ordinary beings only by the general homogeneous character of ordinary beings.

original: dper @145b na mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kho nas mi zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper @145b na mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kho nas mi zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, human homogeneity is established as humans only by the general homogeneous character of humans.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag ma rnyed pa bzhin du mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid las mi nyid ces bya ba ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig tu rtog par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag ma rnyed pa bzhin du mi'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid las mi nyid ces bya ba ngo bo nyid gzhan zhig tu rtog par ni mi byed do //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not conceive of a human as a different entity from human homogeneity, as if it were a nonacquisition.

original: de la sgrub pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid ni //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid ni //
translated: Proof of that is as follows:

original: rang gi skal ba nyam pa nyid las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi skal ba nyam pa nyid las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Ordinary beings are not different from the general homogeneous character of ordinary beings.

original: rang gi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi rkyen gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi rkyen gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi nyid lta bu'o //
translated: They are described as ordinary beings due to the condition of their own general homogeneous character, like humans.

original: 'jig rten gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi mig gis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir te gzugs med ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi mig gis ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir te gzugs med ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The world does not see the similarity of life because it is not material.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi mthong ngo //
translated: The world does not see the similarity of life because it is not material, because it is immaterial, or because it is not of the nature of form.

original: ji ltar mi mthong ba de bzhin du mi thos pa nas reg par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mthong ba de bzhin du mi thos pa nas reg par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as it is not seen, so also it is not heard, up to it is not contacted, in the same way.

original: 'dis ni mngon sum gyis ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mngon sum gyis ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that it is not established by direct perception.

original: 'di shes rab kyis kyang yongs su mi chod med kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su dpag pas kyang mi 'grub bo zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di shes rab kyis kyang yongs su mi chod med kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su dpag pas kyang mi 'grub bo zhes ston par byed do //
translated: It is not even discerned by wisdom. This shows that it is not established by inference.

original: sems can rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad pa yang khong du chud do zhes bya ba ni de med par yang ngo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rigs tha mi dad pa yang khong du chud do zhes bya ba ni de med par yang ngo //
translated: And it is understood that the species of sentient beings are not different.

original: de las ji lta bu zhig byed ces bya ba ni rigs tha mi dad pa rtogs pa yod pa de ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid rdza gzhan du brtags pas byas pa ma yin te tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid kyis de'i las mi srid pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: de las ji lta bu zhig byed ces bya ba ni rigs tha mi dad pa rtogs pa yod pa de ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid rdza gzhan du brtags pas byas pa ma yin te tshad mas mi dmigs pa nyid kyis de'i las mi srid pa'i phyir ro
translated: The existence of the realization of undifferentiated types is called homogeneity. It is not created by the imputation of another substance because it is impossible for it to be the object of such imputation since it is not observed by valid cognition.

original: // khyod spyi'i blo ni rgyu mtshan med pa 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin te des na spyi'i blo de'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas yin no zhe smra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: // khyod spyi'i blo ni rgyu mtshan med pa 'byung bar 'os pa ma yin te des na spyi'i blo de'i rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i rdzas yin no zhe smra bar 'gyur na /
translated: You may say that it is not tenable that a cognition of generality arises without a reason, therefore, the reason for the cognition of generality is a substance called homogeneity.

original: kho bo cag kyang spyi'i blo de rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin par ni smra ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang spyi'i blo de rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin par ni smra ste /
translated: We also say that the cognition of generality has a reason.

original: blo de ni 'dra bas byas pa yin la 'dra ba de yag rdza gzhan ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: blo de ni 'dra bas byas pa yin la 'dra ba de yag rdza gzhan ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: We say that cognition is produced by similarity and that similarity is not another substance.

original: de'i phyir gzhan yang sems can ma yin pa skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yang sems can ma yin pa skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, why not assert that nonliving beings also have homogeneity?

original: sems can sems can snyam pa'i spyi'i blo ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid rdza gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can sems can snyam pa'i spyi'i blo ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid rdza gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The general mind that thinks sentient being, sentient being is not a reason for the same status.🔽

original: spyi'i rnam pa can du 'byung ba'i phyir s'a lu dang nas dang mon sran gre'u la sogs pa'i spyi'i blo lta bu'o /🔽'di dag gi spyi'i blo ni s'a lu dang nas @146a * //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can du 'byung ba'i phyir s'a lu dang nas dang mon sran gre'u la sogs pa'i spyi'i blo lta bu'o / 'di dag gi spyi'i blo ni s'a lu dang nas @146a * //
translated: The general cognition of sentient being is not a reason for the cause of the sameness of state because it arises in the aspect of a generality, like the general cognition of rice, barley, beans, and so on.

original: la sogs pa'i rang gi rigs 'dra pas byas pa yin la /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rang gi rigs 'dra pas byas pa yin la /
translated: The general cognition of these is produced by their similarity of type, such as rice and barley.

original: de dag gi rang gi rigs 'dra ba yang rang las don gzhan ni ma yin no //🔽skal ba mnyam pa phan tshun tha dad pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems can gyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan yin la /🔽khams kyi skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan yin /

translated: The similarity of type of those is not different from themselves.🔽Those different states are also different from each other.🔽The sameness of state of sentient beings is one thing, the sameness of state of the elements is another, and the sameness of state of reincarnating beings is another.

original: 'gro ba'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan yin no zhes skal ba mnyam pa nyid phan tshun tha dad par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyang gzhan yin no zhes skal ba mnyam pa nyid phan tshun tha dad par 'dod do //
translated: Thus they assert that the sameness of state is different from each other.

original: khyed ni de dag la 'di yang skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyed ni de dag la 'di yang skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: You say that they are the same in terms of their lot.

original: 'di yang skal ba mnyam pa nyid do zhes tha mi dad par skal ba mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'dogs pa 'di byed de //
analyzed: 'di yang skal ba mnyam pa nyid do zhes tha mi dad par skal ba mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'dogs pa 'di byed de //
translated: You also make the designation of sameness of class without differentiation, saying, “This is also sameness of class,” and “That is also sameness of class.”

original: gal te de la yang gang gis na skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi spyi'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba mnyam pa gzhan zhig yod par khas len na de'i phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de la yang gang gis na skal ba mnyam pa nyid kyi spyi'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba mnyam pa gzhan zhig yod par khas len na de'i phyogs snga ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs su mi rung ngo //
translated: If you accept that there is another sameness that is the cause for the arising of the general cognition of sameness of class, then that is not a suitable position because it contradicts your former position.

original: de lta na ni bye brag pa rnams kyis gsal bar byas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bar bar byas shing gzhung btsugs so snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni bye brag pa rnams kyis gsal bar byas pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bar bar byas shing gzhung btsugs so snyam du bsams pa yin te /

original: de dag kyang spyi'i dngos por smra ba yin la khyed kyang yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang spyi'i dngos por smra ba yin la khyed kyang yin pas so //
translated: Because they also advocate the existence of a universal, and you do too.

original: gcig yin yang me tog gi phreng ba'i skud pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: gcig yin yang me tog gi phreng ba'i skud pa lta bu'am /
translated: Even though it is one, it is like the string of a garland.

original: 'byung po'i mgul du srad bu sbrengs pa ltar du ma la 'jug pa 'di ni bye brag pa de dag gi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'byung po'i mgul du srad bu sbrengs pa ltar du ma la 'jug pa 'di ni bye brag pa de dag gi khyad par yin no //
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas are distinguished by their assertion that a single entity can be the substratum of many universals, like a garland of flowers with many strings.

analyzed: spyi'i rdzas su smra ba'i phyir gal te gsal bar byas kyang rung /
